name: COREY WRIGHT
text:
Hey love 💘 the restroom design
Lighting. And very. Clean. Place

name: Jeffrey Morales
text: Zero communication. The "Madden Team" are lazy, unprofessional,  and offer no communication, assistance/advice, or support. If they sense you are eager to sell they will sell you out to get sale. There's 100's of agents available so no reason to use this garbage company. If you do, you do so at your own peril. I could go on but some people need to learn for themselves.

name: Tim Caldwell
text: Marrissa Rennaker and Bellator are great!!!  My go-to agent for anything related to residential purchases/renting in Baldwin County!!!

name: Kyle Klenck
text: Just don't use Marissa Peyton Rennaker

name: XxFmjx33
text:
We had the best experience with Sloan at Bellator in Spanish Fort. He is very knowledgeable, professional and all around great person to work with when buying a home. My family can't thank him enough.
Thanks Sloan!

resp.text: Hi Lisa, thank you for taking the time to stop by and tell us about your home buying experience! So good to hear that all went well with you finding the home that is right for you. We love what we do for you here at Bellator! Thanks again.

name: C I
text: Hanh was a referral from a friend. She was very highly recommended. In fact, we had someone in mind but after we met her, Hanh had to be our realtor. She understood immediately what we were looking for on our first home. During the whole process, Hanh was very informative, knowledgeable, professional, positive, and on point. Within about 2 months, we closed our home. She answered texts, calls, and emails very fast. She met with us on last minute calls, any day of the week. We feel very blessed to have such a great person to work with. Hanh made sure we were offering the write amount and not what the seller wanted. I cannot say anything bad about her. I would definitely recommend her if you are looking for someone that is passionate and truthful to her job.

name: grace DeFee
text: Less than pleasant.

resp.text: Hi, Lee Ann! We'd love to know how we can improve your experience with Bellator. Feel free to reach out to us if there's a way we can help!

name: Kenyon Gradert
text:
Edit: seems like Hayley boosts its google reviews by rating itself. (See pic.) Appears that one of their own property managers left a five-star review.  And four of their five-star reviews come from people with the last name Hayley, same as the owner. (Maybe it's a coincidence!) It's almost funny.

Read through these reviews and you'll notice a trend that explains Hayley's poor ratings everywhere: they start with poor quality and end with scamming you out of your deposit. My pregnant wife and I spent 3+ hours on our hands and knees scrubbing our rental house top to bottom before we moved out. It was far cleaner than when we moved in. We discovered $100+ was kept from our deposit because we "didn't have it professionally cleaned" -- which is not even a requirement of the lease. I provided photographic evidence that we cleaned up messes that Hayley had never addressed when we moved in, proving that we left the place cleaner than Hayley did. (See photos below for before and after.) Their lawyer said our photos were selective and that we were "belittling" their efforts -- says the person who penalized a pregnant woman for cleaning 3+ hours. Nor did Hayley specify what we failed to clean, much less photographic evidence to prove it. All this to say that Hayley appears to automatically deduct $100+ from deposits for cleaning yet doesn't use that fee to clean the place to their own supposed standards.

This was just the last of many frustrations. Ants and roaches were present when we moved in. Here too we picked up for Hayley's slack and hired exterminators. Hayley's lease requires tenants to maintain the yard but when we moved in, we discovered the yard filled with bamboo and 1+ foot of pine straw (no wonder there were bugs). We asked Hayley to fix it; they sent a maintenance crew that cut the bamboo and left everything else. I spent all week raking it up.

Finally, the property was quite literally rotting on the outside. (Again, no wonder there were bugs.) The owner clearly was attempting to put as little maintenance into the property as possible. I think Hayley is coasting on the Auburn housing market, but it won't take much for a competitor to pick up their slack.

name: Marc Newbern
text: Let’s start in the beginning.  A week after I moved in I had to go pick up the garage door openers because they didn’t give them to me when I moved in, the also didn’t have two keys and had to go get one made.  The office told me that they thought my wife and I had funny relationship.  One, my wife is black and I am white so I am not sure what was even meant by that and two,  it’s none of their concern what kind of relationship we have.  Secondly they cheat you out of your deposit, doesn’t matter if that was the way it was when you moved in.  I have pictures to prove and the move in sheet.  They took $600 for touch up paint. I would be curious to know if they actually painted because they sure didn’t paint any walls when we moved in.  Keep moving, don’t rent from them, it isn’t worth the hassle.

name: Heidi Smith
text: Nice places to stay, but you have to put up with unprofessional office staff.  I am furious and would not reccomend them to anyone.  Takes forever to fix anything, they have their deposits all mixed up and allow folks to move in even if they havent signed lease for that time period.  they make me sick

name: Ann-Braxton Mann Smith
text: Follow the rules and dont destroy the home you live in and you may get different results when ya move out. I had absolutely no issues while living with them. Always nice when i called the office and never had any problems! Highly Recommend them if you know how to follow rules! :)

name: Elias Moritan
text: Do not respond to calls and applications in timely fashion. Hard to work with. Would not recommend.

name: Meredith Kemp
text:
We purchased a condo two years ago for our sons to live in while at college. The current tenets had four months left on their lease so we had Haley stay on as property manager since we were not living in the area. About two months later we received an email notifying us that an upstairs toilet had leaked but it had been handled and everything was dry. Since they had eyes on the situation we trusted them when the email said they had handled it and everything was dried. We had insurance, if they had informed us how bad the leak and water damage was we would have contacted them to come in. Instead two years later we have reports from an environmental mold specialist ongoing us that the upstairs and room beneath where water leaked is covered in black mold. Testing shows that it clearly originated from the bathroom leak not dealt with two years ago and the specialist also told us this does not happen when fans and dehumidifiers are brought in to properly dry everything out.
We owned a home in Virginia that had been handled by a property manager for 7 years before we could sell and they were always clear about communicating and honest with handling any issues. Haley was paid to do a job and clearly did not. My guess is because they knew we would not be extending our contract at the end of those four months when our sons moved in. We now have $20,000 worth of mold damage and our son with asthma health to worry about because of their poor management of our property.

name: Brent Butts
text: Rented from Hayley management for over 4 years. Not all of it was bad, but I wouldn’t recommend them. When we first tried to rent from them they told us to come sign because they were holding a spot for us. Only for us to come in and they told us it was given to someone else. They wouldn’t do anything about it until I had my dad come up there and speak to the manager and show them the text. Just over all unprofessional. Then upon move out they racked all these charges on us. Some were warranted and completely understandable. Others were not. A professional company would call you and explain the situation. They basically told us through email that our case was closed and to pay. They would not provide any proof of the work done or proof that fault was on us for certain damages. Not the worst place in auburn but you can find better for sure.

name: Edward Branchhill
text:
I've tried contacting Haley Management on multiple occasions to try and set up tours of available units. I always got the same response that they were "shorthanded" that day and to leave my information so that they could call me back to set up a showing. I've never been contacted back even after leaving my information on four separate occasions. The first time that I contacted them was over 3 months ago. Your experience may differ, but if the way they handle tours is any indication about how responsive they are to their current tenants then I would avoid them if at all possible.

Also, it appears that at least some of the 5 star reviews are left by representatives of Haley Management. For example, the most recent review by "Ann-Braxton Mann Smith" appears to be from a person that works for Haley Management (just do a quick search of her name). On its face, it appears to be a conflict of interest.

name: Matt King
text: I’ve been renting from Hayley for 3 years now and have had no problems. The staff is friendly, helpful, and they are super flexible on rent payments which is great if you are a student. The two leasing agents, Kelli and Ann Braxton and are always happy to help and answer any questions I have. They actually care about their owners and tenants. If you are a student and need a place to rent in the Auburn/Opelika area, I highly recommend renting from Hayley Management. Fantastic establishment.

name: Evlyne G
text: Friendly informative. Easy to work with cross country. Was given other options when the first choice wasn't available

name: Arthur Bosswell
text: Super trash!  They have employees and family boost their ratings.

name: Maxi Roberts
text:
I lived with Hayley for 5 years and literally didn’t have a SINGLE problem. I see a lot of reviews concerning security deposits. They give you a check list to
Go by when you move out. I followed the check list just like my lease said to and I got my entire security deposit back. I know this is a college town so maybe all of these mad people are just college kids who don’t understand how the move out process worked...? Not sure but I’m just here to say that they were all great and very professional to me.

I’d be curious to see the conditions of the homes that these “bad” reviews were left in. I can only imagine what some people lived like!

name: Adrian Buice
text:
Absolutely terrible to work with.  Would not recommend to anyone looking for a rental property.  We moved into a house that was poorly painted; single coated, holes in the walls were terribly patched up and not painted.
Upon receiving our deposit statement, they charged us $450 for them to repaint.

Edit: After sending in photos of what the paint job looked like BEFORE we moved in, they asked us to provide MORE documentation because apparently their team has NO documentation whatsoever on the unit.  A complete asinine request.  They also stated the grass wasn't cut and charged us $200 to cut the grass.  We provided photos of the yard the day we moved out which shows the lawn was in good shape.  A month went by before new tenants moved in.  I'm pretty sure they did have to cut the grass again between that time but we shouldn't be responsible for those cuts.  Disgusting company.

name: Mallory Mitchell
text: I love Hayley Management! They have been super accommodating to me and my family since renting with them in 2018. Ann-Braxton has been soooo helpful in getting my needs met and I’m so thankful to rent with them!!!

name: Jessie Mann
text: Where do I begin... we subleased an apartment and after being promised the place would be cleaned and carpets professionally cleaned we moved in. Well months went on and I stayed on the phone with their managers about the damages that were there. Moveout time comes after discussing it many many times with them they send me a bill for 7k dollars wanting me to pay for damages the previous tenant caused. They are so very unprofessional.... I SEVERELY wouldnt recommend renting from them!

name: Georgie the sweetest
text: First time ever writing a review in my life..Lived here for a year. WORST place to live. All good reviews are fake..Worst part is when you move out. They will check everything on their move out check list dirty and will charge you $450 for painting, $200 for carpet cleaning, $150 for “unprofessional cleaning” when the apartment was not painted and cleaned at all when I first moved in.. Absolutely worst worst place to live

name: David Aguiñaga
text: Unprofessional place, called them every day to check for any updates on my application and at the end they ended up leasing the property without notice they told me to look for other options on their web site and they will call me back... which they didn't. I didn't even rent here and I do not even recomend it because of their service.

name: DaJon McIntosh
text: They have a lot of nice housing options, but bad communication between their different offices. I submitted my application before my roommate and he got a response of rejection before me. And this was after we had already made an appointment to see the house, and on the way to see it. They should really suggest doing the application first before setting up an showing. It cost us $70 for application fees and $15 in gas and a waste of a day.

name: callie morris
text: Hayley Management has been so quick to respond to any questions that my roommates and I had during this pandemic about our future living arrangements. They have also been very polite and worked so hard to make sure that we got the answers we needed.

name: Kenneth Beard
text: Worst rental company to ever do business with. They will rent your property out from under you giving you little to no time to find somewhere else after you have discussed trying to renew your current lease. They never call you back when they say they will. The tenants right to a peaceful enjoyment will constantly be broken with them trying to find the next renter. They care less about the properties structure or maintaining it so they can make you pay for it. Everything is half way complete with anything they do. I would give them ZERO stars if possible. Also, if you do try to do business with them read the fine print cause they will try and pull a fast one on everyone of their tenants. It's not a personal basis with them only a number and dollar sign. Beware for you have been warned.

name: Brittney Johnson
text: They full of it. They want you to have a high credit score when alot of dont have that! We have good.

name: Jeffrey Webb
text:
Smooth move in and worked with us if someone was a couple days behind on rent. I would give them 5 stars but....
They gave us a check list of stuff to do to get back out deposit. The place was sparkling when we left but we were still charged for everything on the checklist. I would have been better off not cleaning at all. Hope they enjoy the bonus month of rent money.

name: Kim Spencer
text: Discriminatory with mixed couples

name: Ted Cook
text:
I don't normally write reviews, but I feel like I need to warn people about this company.

I lived at a Hayley property for two years and actually enjoyed the property itself. The size and location weren't bad for the price, and the one time pet fee made having a dog in college actually plausible. Unfortunately, that was pretty much all Hayley got right.

The yard was always a mess, with massive patches of dead grass and poor irrigation that caused the yard and our sidewalk to flood whenever it rained. There was also an issue where the owner of our property had requested that Hayley not sign anyone to a lease after our first lease ended so that he could sell the property, but Hayley signed us to a second lease anyway. This lead to confusion between us and the owner over whether we would be able to even live there the next year at a point in the year were most properties in town were already taken.

However, the worst offense was their predatory security deposit handling. During our second lease, our new owners would visit often and always thanked us for taking such good care of the property. On moving out, we followed Hayley's checkout list in full and left the place better than we found it. Despite all this, instead of getting our security deposit back, we received a bill stating we owed $1600 in damages BEYOND what our security deposit covered.

We were surprised to hear this based on how we kept the property, so we requested proof of the damages we were being charged for from Hayley. We were told that we would have to schedule an appointment for that, but any subsequent attempts to schedule an appointment were ignored.

Funnily enough, a friend in the same neighborhood who also rented from Hayley received a very similar bill upon moving out and has had the same experience in being ignored.

It seems as though Hayley's strategy is to scare young tenants out of their security deposits by asking for a ridiculous amount of money and then silently slinking off with an extra month's rent. To make things worse, this money isn't being used to clean or renovate the properties either, if the state of our property when we moved in is any indication.

So in summary, just avoid this company. Don't be fooled by the reviews here (if you look closely, almost all of the good reviews are years old with no comments and the recent reviews are much more scathing). You may not have problems right away, but they're bound to arise at some point.

name: James Hayley
text: I highly recommend these people. I rented from them for 2 years. They gave me a check list of their expectations once I left. It was super helpful and I got a my deposit back. They responded to my work orders in reasonable time. The rental was very spacious and comfortable.

name: Side Track
text: Been living any their space for over a year and it’s been very easy. People are nice and respond quickly. They fix things as fast as possible. No complaints. Gonna keep renting from Hayley.

name: Smith Smithson
text: This company has to be one of the worst managed rental agencies around. They do not care about tenants at all. It can take weeks at a time to get a reply and answer for any questions you may have. If your question regards anything dealing with money, you will unfortunately never receive an answer. However if you're looking for a job though, I would highly recommend trying to become a manager for Haley Management. This is because every time you ask to speak to a manager the receptionists say that they are on "vacation". Sometimes they can be on "vacation" for weeks at a time. So if you're looking for a job that pays you to do nothing at all and gives you more paid vacation time than any business around, being a manager at Haley Management could be the right job for you. I would suggest only working for them though because living in a property owned by them is not half as rewarding.

name: Nicky Bravo
text: Unprofessional and drug their feet and lied to me. Would not recommend at all! If you have any other choice try to find arrangements with a different company

name: Janna M
text: This company is one of the greatest! We have rented from them and now rent our condo through them. They are always helpful and get things done fast when needed! I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a rental company!! All of the office staff is wonderful and very helpful!

name: Thanh Huynh
text: Their service is Good and I love working with Brandon, but some of the staff is so rule and I feel like I was discriminated. I cannot remember her name but she is white. She was so rude and racist. I can feel that by The way she talk to me because I am an Asian and don’t speak English well. She used to gave me some tours to the house but when I was not pleased with the house and then she had a bad attitude to us. Whenever I call to talk to Brandon, she never let me talk to him, and try to ask me why I call, and then answer impolitely. I feel bad. She is Really mean to me. Please respect your customer, I pay the rent on time, I didn’t take any one money. Please learn how to answer the phone if you are as customer service agent. Because of you, I give your company zero star.

name: Stephanie Greene
text: I called and asked to see a property, they were very polite and very prompt in sending me the access code. However, I was very disappointed to have found out that the house in question Had another interested party. In fact, I didn’t find out that somebody else put an application in on it until I called back about it, which wasn’t even 24 hours later. I am slightly disappointed of course. It was beautiful home and would have been perfect for my husband and I. However, I’m more frustrated that they wasted my time and as a former real estate professional I would have expected them to at least let me know that somebody else was interested in the home, had put an application in on the home, so that I would not have wasted my time. I think I’ll look for a more customer focused office for my future needs.

name: Trish Cooper
text: Very knowledgeable

name: Kathy McBride
text: The management is very rude. They don't respect their tenants at all. We don't mind to pay maintenance fee if it was our fault to clog the tub drain by fallen hair ( I tried my best to collect these hair while taking shower and threw them to trash can), but you don't have to send a complaining email and attached a picture on what you unclogged and warn us not to do that anymore! Sorry but I won't call for maintenance anymore!

name: May Chen
text:
I like the work of Hayley Management Company very much. They are very professional, responsive, efficient and considerate. They not only consider the demands of the property owners and handle management affairs efficiently and effectively, in the process of collecting lease and providing management service for the property, they are also very considerate for the tenants with the greatest goodwill. It is not easy to handle the balance of effectively solving problems and considering all relevant parties with a humanitarian spirit, but they can do it very well and balance them very well.

All the staff working there I have contacted, no matter over the phone or actually going to the office,  are very polite, professional and responsive to your inquiries and requests. So far, this is the best management agency I  have seen. I definitely highly recommend this property management company to my friends.

name: Brice Hilyer
text: I rented from Hayley Management last spring and their service was exceptional. The rooms were impeccable. Customer service is the best around! I would recommend Hayley Management for everyone!

name: Donna Burnett
text: Brianna is a great representative for your company.  She assisted me in finding a great place to live on short notice when I moved to Auburn!  I have every reason to recommend Haley Management Company to help others with their housing needs when moving to Auburn or the surrounding area!  Thank you, again!

name: Hannah Anderson
text: Rented from this company for 6 months. They were always prompt when I called for maintenance. They even repaired the fence for the backyard before move in, so my dog would be safe. They added a pay rent online feature that makes renting from them much easier.

name: Chris Jefferson
text: I always thought organized gambling was illegal in the state of Alabama, that is until I signed a lease with Hayley Management. You see, Tom Hayley and his band of thieves run Haley Management like that of a casino. When you sign a lease with them you are gambling with what service you will be provided. If an appliance ranging from a refrigerator to an air conditioning unit quits working, you have a chance at them fixing it in either 1 try or 10 tries. Sometimes these issues can raise your power bill up tremendously high. If you call their offices to try and figure out an issue with money of any value, your chances of receiving any kind of help are around 10%, the house has 90% in this particular game they offer. But rest assure every December and January their employees try to reel you back into the Hayley Management casino just like a pit boss does in Vegas or Biloxi. So unless you’re a degenerate gambler I’d steer far away from Hayley Management.

name: Maddy Carroll
text: Very helpful staff, I have enjoyed working with this company, especially through this stressful situation of COVID-19!

name: Andrew Orman
text: Not very good on customer service. Absolutely robbed us of our security deposit, deducting for ridiculous reasons. Our unit wasn’t nice to begin with, and we had to get it cleaned after we moved in, even tho they claimed it was done before hand. Overall terrible. Would choose Northcutt any day of the week.

name: Mona Johnson
text: R&R rentals is by far the best company I've ever rented from. My duplex was clean and in great condition when I moved (and when I moved out). My roommates and I never had any maintenance problems, but Kurt (the owner) was always just a phone call away if we had any problems/questions at all. I would definitely recommend renting from this company, it was a good experience.

name: Stephen Hughes
text: Highly recommend!  Impeccable work ethic.  Rented many properties over the years and have never been so satisfied with the staff.  Very personable and easy to work with.

name: Brett Nelson
text: The owners here are very friendly and very helpful.  The way the run things here flows smoothly and without a hassle. Highly recommended!

name: Ben Burkart
text: R and R (Hayley Management) took over management of the house we were renting right before our lease ran out. The company that was managing our unit did not provide Hayley management the total initial deposit amount that we put down. They also did not provide them with our initial unit inspection sheet. Because of this when we got our deposit refund it was much lower than it should have been. After explaining the situation to Kurt, and providing him copies of all our initial paperwork,  he was very willing to refund us the deposit amount that we deserved. Excellent customer service and they put their customers, both renters and owners, first.

name: DopeAMean (DJ Dope)
text: Unable to make contact, used someone else.

name: Farm House
text: Hayley management company is a great group of people to work with. They care about their customers and work to make their customers satisfied in everything they do. They really care about their work and the customers they serve.

name: ribbon ribbon
text: Do not be fooled by the close-to-perfect reviews of this rental company. The majority of the reviews come from random accounts who ONLY review Hayley Management AND Tiger Iron Gym... hmmm, the owner of both of these companies is Kurt Hayley, who only wants to boost the reviews of his places. I personally leased with them BECAUSE of these reviews, and while the quality of the duplex was sub-par, they don't have upkeep of their rental properties. People have dogs and don't even pick up after them... Not the worst rental company in Auburn for sure but I think it's really shady that the good majority of these reviews are from the owner hidden behind a computer. *disclaimer: This isn't my main e-mail account as I do not want to be harassed by places where I provide my HONEST review.

name: Andrea DeWitt
text: I was very disappointed a number of times working with Haley Management. I had accepted a job in Auburn and was looking to move relatively quickly. It was very difficult to get a reply to the emails I would send about available properties and viewing appointments. I still to this day have yet to receive an email from Charity about a property that I was later called for. I was told it was no longer available by phone call on my part but then called by Brandon the next week after I had accepted a property with a different agency. I understand that emails can pile up and get lost but after three months of working with them I would not recommend them if you are in any type of time strain.

name: Tfoles4Life
text: We have had a fantastic experience with R & R rentals. We had bad experiences with several other companies in looking for a house initially, but Kurt with R & R was very personable and easy to work with. We found a great place to live owned by R & R, and we've had great service ever since! When we first moved in there were several issues with the house, but within a couple short weeks R&R got them fixed. When we had a problem with some of the maintenance workers, Kurt went above and beyond to figure everything out for us. It is rare to be truly taken care of and looked out for as renting college students, but R&R has done a fantastic job!

name: Katelyn Johnson
text: Not much managing going on here. More interested in collecting a paycheck than ensuring and managing quality properties.

name: Glenn Lamb
text: Hayley Management is great! They really work hard on finding the right spot for you. Plus the lady up front is smoking hot!!! Makes you look forward to coming in every month to pay your rent!

name: Angela Tran
text: Stay away!! They give you a dirty unit to start with and when you live in the unit for two years you clean and fix everything that they didn’t. And once you move out they want to charge you for every little thing just to keep your security deposit! Money hungry. They don’t care for anyone. They have a bunch of college kids working for them and no one even seems to care. Just stay away from this place!

name: Sierra McNeel
text:
First of all, if I could leave Hayley Management 0 stars, I would. I lived under Hayley Management for 2 years. I enjoyed the property for the most part, but the office is very unorganized. Maintenance was also disrespectful to our belongings when they would come maintain the grass on the property. Grass was not cut as often as it should have been, multiple times it was knee high. They’d consistently leave the gate open and throw our yard furniture near the house. The bushes in front of the house were probably trimmed twice the entire time that I lived there. If you cannot maintain all of your properties, maybe you should charge less for rent and not offer this service.

Multiple times they called me saying I had not paid my rent when I had and even had a receipt to prove so. I was a very loyal resident who always paid my rent on time. The lease ended on the 20th of July and they would not offer us a pro-rate for the month. Although we had to pay the entire month’s rent, we were required to keep water and power on 7 business days after moving out, and if we turned it off, then we were charged a $95 reconnecting fee. Aside from all of that, Their move out checklist is insane. They are trying to have the tenants clean the entire property so that they do not have to pay a cleaning service to do it. Tomorrow is 60 days since we moved out and our lease stated that after move out if applicable we would receive our security deposit and could request a list of damages.

Back to being unorganized, no one in the office is able to provide me that list or amount that I am receiving back. I asked to speak to a manager and I spoke to Kurt who told me that this was a ridiculous question to ask. What's ridiculous is speaking to you clients like this. Is it really a ridiculous question to inquire about my money? Anyone who is leasing here or planning to lease here, be wary, because they make everything seem really nice in the beginning but really screw you over in the end.

name: Crispy Cloak
text:
I have rented from 3 other companies in the Auburn area. This is hands down the best realty company I have been with.

We had a flood here on Christmas Eve. When the realty manager Kurt comes out here himself on Christmas Eve with boots and shovels to dig trenches and rip out carpet and help us take care of the problem, you know you're in good hands.

I don't think I need to say anymore, but I will.

They are super easy to rent from, maintenance will come same day if you report a problem. Rent is a fair price and the office is always friendly. Coming from Alice Henderson realty before, this is paradise.

name: Ellis Kennedy
text: I got my full security deposit back. Great people and management. Definitely will rent from them again.

name: Valerie Tisdale
text: it's been 72 days since I've moved out and haven't gotten any information on my deposit refund. I didn't get any sort of checklist upon moving out. It seems like it's managed by undergrad students. Look at Northcutt reality instead.

name: Harry Fisher
text: Loved renting from Hayley management. Great people and always were quick to come fix something if it broke. Highly recommend renting from them.

name: Austin Phillips
text: My back door knob jammed after hours and I called and they were here within minutes. Changed the knob like a NASCAR Pit crew. Much appreciated.

name: Katy McCollister
text: I needed a place fast and Hayley Management helped me get a place to rent that day. They showed me the unit, ran there background check, and we signed a lease. It made finding a place to stay a breeze.

name: Melissa Monroe
text: Most of the good reviews are from friends of the Hayley family, family members themselves, and employees. They're the ones that treat the tenants poorly. Maintenance never fixed my leak, mold was present in unit and after requesting it to be taken care of and speaking with the ladies in the office along with Kurt they just said sorry. When I first moved in the floors were filthy, walls were missing paint,  window pane and blinds were already torn, light bulbs were not working, air filters were dirty, toilets constantly ran etc. Did I mention the unit and other units are invested with spiders. Even after telling them I had a baby present in the home nothing changed. I was never late on rent and kept my unit clean. When I moved out they were frustrated because i told them I was not resigning my lease due to their lack of care for their tenants.

name: LaDonna Moore
text: Hayley Managment is awful, my son’s lease has not even officially started and I can tell you I would NEVER recommend this company regardless if you are leasing or a property owner. My son signed a lease to move into an apartment where two other young men were renewing their lease for the upcoming year.  Not a sub-lease a NEW LEASE. The guy that moved out left the bedroom and bathroom disgustingly dirty, blinds broken, holes in bathroom wall.  Spoke with HM face to face with pictures in hand and they refused to do anything about it. Told me it was my problem and office manager said  “ if I were you I would not have signed a lease for an apartment I did not view first” . My son did view the apartment back in February when he signed it is now July.  I am sure HM will keep this boys deposit but they are refusing to use any of those funds to fix the damage and mess he left behind.

text: Hayley Management Co. has by far the best service in the Auburn/Opelika area. Kurt runs an outstanding management team who's focus is clearly on the tenant experience. They are more than willing to work with you and place an emphasis on availability and ease of communication. After 5 years of renting through several other large management companies in Auburn,  I can say with full conviction that HMC succeeds where so many other companies fail: with a customer service focus, reasonable rates/requests, timely maintenance, and up-to-date/well-kept units.

name: Joseph Vinson
text: Hello all, I'm a recent customer of Haley Management Company (HMC) after the homeowner I currently rent from began to use their services. I first want to state HMC was very point blank and aggressive and I find them to be unreasonably rude, making use threats and unnecessary means of manipulation to obtain rent EVEN THOUGH I WAS READY AND WILLING TO MAKE A PAMENT. After a recent Identity theft and a severe life threatening illness that left me homebound for several months I was very hesitant to send large amount of money to a company that I had never heard of. All this happened over text message too at that, though they Implied that I(who have had a great rental history prior to my current very difficult landlord) "Had just been ignoring them and they had been trying to make contact". All their problems were my fault. They show absolutely no desire and put forward effort to make my rent payment easy to make, just threats. even after the check I wrote them was RETURNED TO ME DUE TO SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY. Excuse my language but i didn't even know where the goddam office was. This is an inexpensive company that at the moment appears to care nothing at all about about the well being of their tenants. This is just a personal note, but I can give the impression of that of a low income person in trouble (when in reality that was not the case) and I get the impression that this company has been using the fear and threat of security as a means manipulate their "less desirable" clientele regularly for some time now. they seem very practiced. My advice, don't do business with people who use fear as a business model. I will be living my very well enjoyed home to work with a company that values my business and perhaps more importantly, value me as a human worthy of respect. Spend your time, happiness, and money with better people. You (or your tenants) will thank you.

name: Mengyuan Qiu
text:
Hayley Management Company is by far the best management and real estate company in the Auburn/Opelika area.

Realty Service: Kurt Hayley is one of  the most knowledgeable and experienced realtors  in the area.  He is honest and to the point and will tell you exactly what the condition of the property is and how much you should pay for it.  His comps are current and accurate. You can't go wrong to pick Kurt and his team if you are a potential home owner.  Unlike other realtors in the area, Kurt is also a real estate investor.  For all the potential real estate investors out there, Kurt is the agent you want.  He is a great lead and he finds properties that are not on the MLS.  He has a team of contractors that can quickly and accurately estimate repair costs so you can generate your cost estimates.  Most importantly, if he cannot find a property that fits your criterion, he will tell you so instead of trying to sell you one that wouldn't be in your interest.

Management Company: Hayley Management Company will always answer your phone call and address the concerns you have on your properties.  The team always collect rent on time and send the check on time.  Kurt will always look for the best price for repairs to save you the owner money while keeping the customer satisfied.  I have heard nothing but good things from my renters.

name: Cait Chri
text: Love the Clubhouse. There are even showers in the men and women's locker rooms near the gym. Gym is better than the planet fitness!! Pool is fun! This place is perfect for students to live with friends.

resp.text: We love our new gym, too! Thank you so much!

name: tammy stanfield
text:
Read this before signing a lease. My daughter lived at this apartment complex for two years. When we got the house assignment before my daughter moved in they had completely changed the type house that my daughter had agreed to rent. Then they said directed me to the place in the least small print where it says they can switch you to any unit they please. There was nothing we could do about it. While we were in the unit the hot water heater was replaced going to a gas hot water heater and because the gas was in my name they charged the hot water heater to my account. It was charged to my gas account and debited out of my checking account, $1800 without my permission. I had to wait three months to be reimbursed and I also had to wait on a coupon from the gas company to be reimbursed. We could not wait to get out of there.

——I did receive a phone call a few days after posting my review from the corporate office about my negative review. I want to clarify that Spire didn’t charge my account without the On-site management people at Creekside letting the gas company into the home. I nor my daughter was there to let them in and the only people that authorized the charge and transaction was Creekside and Creekside refused to call Spire and correct the problem by billing them or the owner of the condo. Also, the small print indicating they could and did switch the unit that we wanted is a fact and an issue that future tenants need to understand. It makes you realize that they could and did show a nice unit in the style, location, and price and switch you to whatever they want.  They placed our daughter in a unit that was at the entrance to the community, high traffic, high noise, and her Eno was stolen off the tiny porch the first week.

resp.text: Hi Mrs. Stanfield! Thank you for taking our call this afternoon to discuss Spire charging your account for the water heater. We are glad they were able to sort everything out, but apologize for the lengthiness of the process.

text: Very poor quality for what you pay. My carpet tack strip was showing in multiple places when I moved in and was never fixed. name: Bolton Brothers
text: I have lived in Creekside for all of my years at Auburn which would be 4. It has been an amazing experience. Beautiful landscaping, friendly neighbors, and a lot of good memories. The management has also taken great care of us. Lost my car keys and they delivered them to my house. Overall great quality.

resp.text: Thanks guys! We love your moving company! We are so happy you had such a great college experience here at Creekside!

name: Becca Hopkins
text: BEST most incredible staff out there. I have had the most amazing time living here. It blows my mind that people write about how the staff is unprofessional and rude. I promise those reviews are people who broke the rules in the neighborhood and were held accountable for their actions. I want to say just how beautiful the houses all are. There is a huge grass area for your pups to play! But most importantly, no matter what issues arose, regarding the neighborhood, my house, other residents, you name it, Kristen went so far ABOVE and beyond to be the most genuinely caring person. She is the sweetest manager you will ever meet. She didn't have to do 99% of what she did for me while I lived there and I can never say thank you enough for the staff of Creekside. Truly a luxury living environment. I spent a couple years living here and never regret it for a minute!! If you are looking for a place to live Fall or Spring you have to look at Creekside or you'll miss out BIG time! Also shout out to Charlie in the front office for helping Kristen pack my WHOLE house and move it to my new unit for me while I was abroad. How many managers and their employees in the office will do that for? that is just a testament to how much the staff cares about everyone (pups included).

resp.text: Becca! This is such a sweet post! We really appreciate all the love you have for Creekside and the staff! We loved having you as our resident for the past several years!

name: Kristin Burton
text: I have lived in Creekside for 3 years in as a student. This property has the absolute worst management I have ever seen. Clearly they don't train their staff to know anything. Any time my roommate and I had maintenance issues in our apartment, we had to call several times before someone would come out and fix the problem. Our AC in our unit breaks all the time. During graduation weekend it wasn't working and we were going to have several people in our unit celebrating with us. On Saturday, we called and were told maintenance doesn't work on Saturday's and then were told we could call someone not affiliated with Creekside. When we asked for a recommendation the girl said, I don't know I'm from Florida. Clearly, they don't care at all. The gate is never working and part of the money we pay to live here includes it being a "secure" neighborhood. They don't take care of the property. Don't live here even though it seems nice, I wish I had lived in Aspen Heights.

resp.text: Kristin we would like to find out more about your situation please call our office and thank you for the feedback.

name: Em1827
text:
Unprofessional staff and management.

When I first moved in there was a tanning bed as a part of the amenities which was appealing at the time, it was later removed because it “was too much to maintain” or in other words the management or employees did not want to maintain it and a study room was put in its place. There is already a large study room downstairs. The monthly HOA fees have stayed the same.

On multiple occasions I have to call days later after I have already put in a maintenance order to see when maintenance will be coming, lack of communication to residents.

resp.text: We would love to hear more about your experience.

text: Don’t even bother going for a tour. We were so excited because we had been recommended and saw positive reviews. Went for a tour and the apartment was DISGUSTING. All bedrooms were locked and tenants wouldn’t let us in. There was paint all over light fixture and dirt all over the floors. Absolutely ridiculous. Even if you tour a clean one you don’t know that you’ll end up with that one

resp.text: Genney, thank you for the review, we apologize for the experience you had with us. We do not have a model home on site so we must rely on our residents to show our homes. We would love for you to give us another chance, call us today.

resp.text: Creekside's pool is AMAZING! Voted #1 best pool in Auburn! We are so glad you love our staff! Thanks for the kind review!

text: If you have plans to live in creekside the first step you should take is deciding whether the amenities and homes (which are honestly very nice) are worth the unprofessionalism and hassle that you will deal with from the office staff. My roommates and I went 7 weeks without a washer or dryer after ours broke. We have had other issues that either went unresolved, or were handled poorly. There are some great things about creekside, but don't expect to be treated respectfully if you ever have to interact with anyone that works in the office.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback we would love to hear more about this issue. Please give us a call 334-321-2356

text: Literal children could run a better office. the people that work in the office are rude and incompetent. They have zero regard for anyone other than themselves in the office.

resp.text:
Hi Lizz, thank you for the review. We are so sorry to hear this, management would love to speak with you about our staff and gate system . Please give us a call and we would be happy to speak with you.
Sincerely,
Creekside Management

They also closed the gates at night at the beginning of the year without giving all of the residents access cards. Would not recommend to anyone.

resp.text: Miah we hate to hear this experience, the washer and dryer did get replaced for you all. Also when your roommates informed the office of the mud and scratches left on the wall the manger went over to the home to review the damage and offered to vacuum your stairs and took photos of what happened from the appliance company.

name: J Pizzle
text: Don't listen to all these fools complaining about petty issues they've had while living in Creekside. As far as a college living experience goes, I challenge you to find a better place. Good community of higher grade college students, units are roomy and nice, neighborhood is very scenic compared to anywhere else I've been, and amenities are nice even if they could be better kept at times. Staff is lenient on things that don't really matter and take care of things that are priority (exactly what I was looking for.) Overall I've really enjoyed my four years of Creekside and would be hard pressed to find another place for a similar price per quality.

name: ribbon ribbon
text: Creekside is filled with nothing but immature college students (this review is COMING from a pre-med college student and I'm not revealing my name because I regretfully still live here). The week of finals, everybody just raids the pool/plays volleyball, which doesn't make sense to me AT ALL... The apartment quality is fine, considering the RIDICULOUS amount you pay. People are loud, and they throw their trash everywhere, when there is even a trash bin OUTSIDE your door!! The only thing good about this place is Kristen at the front desk. She is great and makes sure you are accommodated for. HOWEVER, in their lease, they claim this place is a "gated community." One time out of 50 the gate is closed, but some immature "resident" or "guest" will run INTO the gate, causing it to fall off. No joke.  This place could get in big trouble for not following through with their leasing terms. This place is way too expensive unless you are living with 10 roommates, but the rent is probably still around 300-400 if that. If you are a serious college student, this place is NOT for you.

resp.text: Thank you for all of your feedback , as we are a college community we do have residents who enjoy to socialize more than others. We are pleased to hear you do enjoy the quality of our homes and that you enjoy our manager Kristen! We strive hard to have residents follow the rules and have consequences for when residents do not want to follow our gate rule.

text: The property looks nice from the outside, but the inside is a different story. Our house was suppose to be fixed by our move in date in august, but it's march and things still haven't been fixed. The management is unprofessional and rude. Workers at the office never seem to know anything and give you the run around, no one is on the same page. Maintenance takes forever to come fix janky appliances, it's easier to run one down/get their personal number, when you see the walking across the properties. The gate has been down maybe 5 times since August, if the gate is down it only lasts maybe an hour because someone will run it over. Our house wifi and cable has been down for about 3 months maybe longer, every time we call the office they tell us to call pavlov and pavlov tells us to call creekside, giving us the run around. As I said before, no one knows anything around here. I wouldn't suggest anyone staying here. It's too unorganized, can't wait to move out!

name: Steve Klein
text:
I lived here for three years and figured I'd let people know my thoughts. Some of it is good, some of it is bad, some of it could go either way depending on what you want out of a place to live, and some of it is just unavoidable as it is targeted to college students.

Some aspects of the property are really nice. The clubhouse is pretty nice (though the weight room is a joke; I don't know why any Auburn student would use it instead of the top notch campus facility). The common areas are generally well-maintained. I say generally because while the landscaping is kept up, the gates are not. I've been trying to get my name added to the call box for three years and it still hasn't happened, yet I know residents that moved out years ago still in the list.  The gates are frequently broken and they keep nobody out. If someone wants to get in, they will get in. They will simply wait for someone to open the gate and go in after them. If you are going to be a "gated community" then be a gated community. In my opinion, Creekside should just get rid of the gates because they really don't accomplish anything except annoy the residents.

Creekside does not tow. This could be good or bad depending on your point of view. I never had an issue with parking. On busy football weekends, perhaps I'd be 10-12 spots away from my front door but that was about the extent of it. However, other parts of the complex may not have quite as abundant parking so that could be an issue. I'm really not sure. It was nice to not have to deal with visitor passes, etc. but it would be very frustrating if there wasn't enough parking near your home.

Creekside does not enforce many of its own rules. The one that really annoys me is the pool. It is supposed to be limited to residents and residents are allowed two guests I believe. What it ends up being is tons of people who might know one person in Creekside... or in some cases just show up without knowing anyone. I pay good money to live in a place like this and don't feel like my money should be going to clean up after non-residents who break chairs, leave beer cans and bottles strewn about, etc. Some would say I'm a party pooper... but I like to think of it as being irritated by trespassing. People (many times non-residents) bring beer bottles and dogs to the pool routinely... both are supposed to be fineable offenses... but I've never seen one handed out.

Maintenance is a mixed bag, but mainly poor. To get a broken door repaired, it took about a dozen phone calls over a two month period. Simply absurd. I also reported a broken toilet two different times. Once, it was repaired promptly. The other time... I was told they'd be out there "in the next couple of days" and nobody ever came. After about a week, I fixed the toilet myself. Also, I should point out that *OWNERS* are occasionally treated as second-class citizens by the on-site management. Essentially, the homeowner's dues should get me the same rights as the renter's... but when I file a maintenance issue that is supposed to be covered by the HOA dues, they handle all renters first... I guess to make sure they get people to resign because they know the homeowner is unlikely to sell because of a small issue like this. Or, in the vast majority of cases, it isn't the actual homeowner who lives in the house; It is often the parent of one of the residents who probably never even hears about the issue.

The last issue I have is with the TV/Internet Service. It has been nothing short of awful the entire time I've lived here. In 2015, I don't think people can really appreciate just how bad I have had it and what a negative it is. The internet is slow, often less than 1 megabit/second so forget about streaming Netflix during peak hours; You'll be lucky if you can just get a YouTube video to play in 240p, nevermind HD.

All in all, it is a decent place to live. You could definitely do a lot worse. I think I'd rather pay for a location closer to campus rather than the resort style amenities, but that is personal preference.

resp.text: Thank you for the valuable information

name: Angie Chatham Denton
text: Real nice, gated community.!

resp.text: Thank you Angie!

name: Kelly Tsaltas
text:
Creekside of Auburn claims to have the best pool and amenities in Auburn and to be “student living redefined.” Their definition of student living, however, did not live up to its advertisement.

Firstly, what they boast as the best pool in Auburn is ever crawling with non-residents and is usually dirty. Oftentimes people who come to the pool don’t even know anyone in the complex (I have no idea how they get in). Adding to their being unwelcome is the fact that they, along with actual residents, throw empty beer cans and cigarettes into the pool, making it disgusting and completely unable to be used.

Creekside also advertises itself as a gated community. Unlike other gated complexes, however, Creekside uses a barcode scan system, which is usually broken. Thus the gates are open 24 hours a day, including weekends. If the gates are closed and the scanner is broken, there is no code to open the gates, which led to three broken gates because of cars driving through them in the year that I lived there. Why they chose a system with no backup way to get in is beyond me.

Creekside is a magnet for irresponsible students who love to party loudly. I did not understand how there could be such a high concentration of people with such habits, but then I discovered that much of Creekside’s advertising involves half of drink specials for residents and other alcoholic incitements. There were obnoxiously loud parties that could be heard two rows of houses over and up the street nearly every weekend and even on weekdays. These parties were rampant with underage drinking and lasted until four a.m. or later. The courtesy officer never picks up his phone, so the police usually come. This is an inconvenience and an annoyance for the officers, especially since Creekside hired someone who is supposedly responsible for taking care of such noise disturbances.

The Internet is abysmal, and it is nearly impossible to get someone to come out and fix it. Our Internet didn’t work for three months, and the management refused to give us a refund on the portion of our rent that went toward cable and Internet.  They also refused to let us get our own router.

Management threatens to fine its residents constantly, but never follows up; therefore, what looks like a beautiful complex from outside the gates is full of porches that are littered with beer cans, cigarettes, trash, and beer pong tables. Any complaints about the state of the porches will go unnoticed.

All in all, Creekside is a place for rich kids whose parents don’t care if they drink excessively underage and blow off classes in the morning due to a midweek party. Were I a parent, no matter how much money I had, I would avoid investing in a unit in Creekside like the plague.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback on our college student community.

name: Kevin
text: Expensive. Internet service provider is horrible. Other than that the Units are in decent condition though i believe we are all overpaying by about 50-75 dollars per month and the front gate is NEVER fixed. A gated community isn't a gated community without a gate. If you require at least internet a few times a week i would stay away from Creekside. I, unfortunately, am locked into a lease already..

name: Brittany Wiginton
text: I rented a house with Rudolph Realty and I have to say they are the absolute WORST company I’ve ever had to deal with. So unprofessional, unreliable, and untrustworthy. They do not have the owners best interest at heart; and definitely not the renter’s. The only way to contact them is through email, in which they don’t answer often. Had to send several follow up emails to get anything done. (Bc they don’t have a phone number to call anyone). Took two months to get my security deposit back and then they hit me with stupid charges so they didn’t have to refund the whole thing. Sooo glad to not be managed by them anymore! Just wanted to let anyone looking for a rental company know so you don’t get stuck in a contract with them and regret it.

resp.text:
Brittany,

By law, we have up to 60 days to close out the security deposit. You vacated the property during one of our busiest months of the year so it took longer than usual to get to put together the invoices and close out your file.
Overall, the move out went well except for the overpowering pet odor. The carpet cleaners you used did an insufficient job in cleaning the carpets and we had no choice but to have the carpets cleaned again.  You do not get to determine how much a company can charge for cleaning carpets.
We have responded promptly to each and every one of your email inquiries.  You seemed to have a bigger problem with not being able to call our staff and verbally berate them as you did when you 1st took possession of the home. Hostile/emotional phone calls from you to my staff were the main reasons we switched to email communication only.
We wish you the best.

name: Timothy Hall
text:
Not great: They could be hard to contact at times, but if there was an issue, maintenance was always out promptly. Some of the staff weren't very friendly, some were.
They will give you your security deposit as late as they can (& for me falsely claimed a car was parked in the yard).
They also didn't communicate with the home owner about the pet deposit they collected on the owner's behalf.
They're inflexible when it comes to business dealings. They will do what's in your contract, nothing more and nothing less.
They're far, far from a slum lord, but also far, far from the best rental agency I've worked with.

resp.text: Tim, we appreciate the kind words. I hate to here you had somewhat of a bad experience.  You are correct about being inflexible.  We follow the  Alabama Landlord Tenant Act.  All tenants are held to the same standard when renting a home and when they vacate.  We try to process the security deposit refunds as quickly as possible and sometimes the we use most of the 60 days given by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Act. I'll research your comment about the pet fee.  If a pet was listed on your application, you would have paid a non-refundable $200 pet fee at the time you took possession.  Any funds collected would be credited to the home owner's account.

name: Sean Isaacs
text:
I've rented for over 10 years and have never had a place require an application or a "fee" just to look at a property. This should have been a sign of how they were to work with, but we tried it anyway.

We filled out their application, paid their fee, and looked at the home. It needed a lot of work done. The floors were really scratched up, the walls had holes in them, the patchwork and paint work looked like it was done by a child. Not to mention this property hadn't been cleaned in a long time.

Their application packet came with an offer page. I made a reasonable offer, asking for a small discount to forgo them fixing the floors, paintwork, and cleaning. They said they were "insulted" by my offer and wanted nothing to do with us a applicants.

They told us if we followed their process, it would work out. Well, it didn't. And now we are stuck with finding a new place to live and only have a few days to do so.

resp.text:
Seen (or Sean),
Let's review the timeline of events.
You initially come into our office and had issues with the fact that you must pre-qualify in order to check out keys to view the property.  We do this to ensure that neither you or our staff have to waste their time if a potential renter has an unsatisfactory credit score.
You boldly stated that you are a car salesman and "you know how to negotiate".
After speaking with you about your concerns where you may or may not qualify, you were instructed to turn in the application so we could process it and determine if we could rent to you and your family.
You offered $1,300/month on a $1,650/month rental and you demanded that my client waive the February and March rental payments.
I took your offer to the owner who informed me that he was insulted by your offer and would not consider you as a renter.
Keep in mind, you came to us.  You may be a car salesman but my client is not buying a car.
You were not charged the full application fees.  We did everything we could to work with you.  I'm sorry you are scrambling for a home and we wish you the best of luck moving forward.

Thank you much.  I have enjoyed getting to know and spend time with you guys over the last few years.  I know Brittany and I came to the company after you had already been with us for several years.  We look forward to many more memorable dinners in the future and can't wait for the house warming party.
Rudy

name: Mike Lee
text: I've done business with the Rudulph family for a decade and have received an unsurpassed level of service. They know their customers and treat them how they'd like to be treated. Honest, dependable, always professional and on time. Top notch. Highly recommended.

resp.text:
Mike,

Thank you much.  I look forward to working with you again in the future.  Enjoy the retirement!!

name: bruce donnellan
text:
For the last several years Rudulph has managed a rental property in Ross Bridge.  Every time there was a problem, they were on it.  When it was time to renew the lease, they were on it.  When it came time to sell, they were on it.

They did a great job from start to finish and I would recommend them to anyone.

resp.text:
Bruce,
Thank you for the opportunity to represent you as a property manager and as your listing agent.  Look forward to working with you again in the future.

name: Terri Nicole
text:
What a great team of professionals! We rented from Rudulph for 3 years and were immensely pleased with them from start to finish. That is saying a lot because there were issues with the property owner not meeting the standard of maintenance that Rudulph requires on several occasions. Each time, Rudulph did everything in its power to encourage the owner to comply.  Eventually, Rudulph decided to end its relationship with the owner, which made sense to us as  well.

Upon move out, the owner sued us for $3,500.00 in trumped up damages. Instead of leaving us high and dry, Rudulph took care of us and we only had to pay our security deposit, which was fair. We could not have asked for more support from any company.

If you are thinking of renting from Rudulph, I can assure you they operate with integrity and truly look out for their tenants. We are now looking to rent again and of course, we would not consider using anyone else but Rudy and his team of caring, knowledgeable professionals.

resp.text: Thank you so very much.  It was great to run into you today.  I'm glad it all worked out in the end.  Looking forward to working with you again.

name: Coleysia
text:
Terrible company that lacks integrity. I am currently moving out of an apartment and I pay $1200 for my rent. I was inquiring about a townhouse they have listed for $1200 (I’m thinking same price, more space, makes sense). I thought this would be a simple transaction but boy was I wrong. I submitted an application and the security deposit (equal to one months rent). I passed the credit check, employment/ salary verification, and rental verification. You would think that would be enough to enter a contract.

My application was denied because the owner didn’t feel comfortable renting to me because I’m on (unpaid) maternity leave. I return back to work in August ( which was confirmed by my job). To prove I was secure financially, I offered to pay July and August rent to ease concerns. The owner still didn’t feel comfortable. I called back and offered to pay up until October (4 months). The owner still didn’t feel comfortable renting to me. At that point I knew I could offer to pay up the entire lease and it wouldn’t matter, because it wasn’t about maternity leave.

I was told negative things about this company prior to my inquiry but I decided to try them out anyway. I see this is just the way these people are. I’m not going to make accusations but I’m a well educated, professional, African American woman. Draw your own conclusions.

resp.text:
C C,
You were turned down because you did not meet our posted minimum requirements.
1) Combined monthly income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable wages.
2) Minimum credit score of 600 for all adults to be considered.  Having a 600 credit score does not guarantee that you will be accepted but your application will be considered based on the other criteria.
You were initially turned down because you did not meet the combined income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable income.  The other adult on the application reported no income on their application.  You and I spoke on the phone and you asked me if you could pay several months up front to cover the time until you went back to work.  I called the owner last night and reviewed the application with him and gave him your offer.  He said he did not feel comfortable accepting the application based on the information that was given.

name: Drew Herring
text: I rented a house from Rudulph for 2.5 years and had a great experience.  Management and staff were always friendly and very helpful.  On the occasions where repairs were needed, they were done quickly and professionally with minimal intrusion.  I would definitely recommend renting from Rudulph!

resp.text:
Drew,

Thank you for your thoughts.  We enjoyed working with you.  Good luck on this next chapter of your life and please do not hesitate to reach out if you find yourself in need of our services again sometime in the future.

name: Rick Ryan
text: I used Rudulph Rental company to manage my property for 2 years and could not have been more impressed and satisfied with their service. Staff was always pleasant to talk with and were always very professional. I would recommend anyone who is looking for a rental company to use them. Thanks for everything!

resp.text:
Rick,
Thank you much.  We enjoyed working with you guys and wish you the best in the sale of your home.

name: S B
text:
I don’t want to go into complicated details, but what I will say is that miscommunication has now cost me a great deal of money. ($10k+) I will also recommend to anyone using this company: that any communication be done ALL in writing.

What’s even sadder is that after renting/selling my home with them for years, my side of the story was considered a LIE & there was no attempt to keep me as a customer. To say I am disappointed is a huge understatement. I also just think that people should treat others better.

resp.text:
Ma'am,
The details are not complicated.    We had a roofing company ready to take care of what needed to be done after the adjuster went to your home.  Your father said he had a buddy who was a roofer who could handle the issue.  Your father's roofer is to blame for not removing the wet/molded insulation in the attic.  Your father's roofers did not put the gutters back on after the repair.  You asked us to handle.  Our contractor said the roofer did a sub-par job. You asked us to send everything to your father.  We did as you asked and he blamed us for what his roofers failed to do. You asked us to handle the interior repairs.  Our contractor handled the repairs from the ceiling down (patch and paint).  As we were not provided a copy of the adjuster's report, we had no way to know what was going on in the attic. We are certain you were paid for mold removal/remediation yet you never received a bill/estimate for mold removal/remediation from our contractors. This is an unfortunate series of events that I would like to help you with however you feel the only remedy is for me to take responsibility for something that was mismanaged by you.  You have a claim against the roofing company.  Have you contacted them about this?  It seems that it is easier for you to lash out at us instead of taking the necessary steps to hold the person(s) responsible who dropped the ball. I enjoyed working with you and I hate to end the relationship under these circumstances.
Rudy Rudulph
Property Manager

name: Ali Marie
text: I was in a close race for a place, we were in from out of state and told the property was unavailable for viewing until the coming Saturday and that they would not accept anything until that Monday. But they showed the property that Friday, and even still I got my deposit in at business open that Monday before anyone else. I didn't get the house but they came back and helped with my search, and are very invested in making sure I find a good placef

resp.text:
Alanna,
Thank you for continuing to work with us.  I'm glad you were able to find something that fit your needs.  Please keep us in mind in the future.
Rudy

name: Dalton Newell
text: I rented a home from Rudulph Real Estate, and the experience was fantastic. This company was easy to work with, responsive to all maintenance requests, and super fair in their handling of the security deposit that I put down when I signed the lease. 10/10. Would do business with them again.

resp.text:
Dalton,
Thank you much.  We appreciate you guys being such great tenants.  Please keep us in mind the next time you need a rental home.  We would love to work with you again.

name: keren mccollam
text: I leased a property from them and was less than satisfied with how they did business. A few days after moving in I phoned to tell them the heat wasn't working they had it checked out and I was treated like I was just a dumb women and that the heat was fine. later when the temp dropped I had to call again since the house was at 50 degrees in January after another service call they said whoops the whole unit is bad. Upon moving out they charged me for trash under the house that was there when I moved it. Also changed me over 400 in pet cleaning fees that were not disclosed at time of lease. I also had to wait for over 2 month for the little bit of security deposit I did get back. Just not upfront and honest about stuff. 😡

Joseph and Karen McCollum move-out inspection

Of all the property managers I have dealt with, including the managers of my own property in Louisville, KY, Rudulph is lightyears ahead of their competition. They are timely when addressing issues, accommodating on methods of payment, take great care of their properties and make all of the processes for renting or moving out extremely easy. I would not use any other property manager in the Birmingham metro area.

resp.text:
SFC Shawler,

It was a pleasure to work with you over the last few years.  Good luck on this next step with the military.  Please keep us in mind in the future if you ever find yourself back in Birmingham.
