My wife and I rented with Rudulphrents for around 2.5 years in a house in Crestline Park. Rudy was an excellent property manager and his team was always prompt to respond to get things fixed when needed. In the time we were there, we had several issues including AC, plumbing, trees - all items resolved quickly.

We recently bought a house (mid-lease) which would not always be the best way to go for either party. From the time that I made Rudy aware of the circumstances, he was very good about making sure we were on track to sub-lease the house quickly so that we would not have to pay both rent and mortgage.

Overall, very good experience dealing with this company.

resp.text:
Jerrod,

Thank you much.  We enjoyed working with you guys.  We hate to see you go.

name: Amber Lese
text: No callback. Called for property management, instructed by machine to email. Sent email with my info, and still have yet ro receive any callback from them..

resp.text:
Amber,
I hate that we missed the opportunity to work with you. Please forward the email you sent originally to reception@rudulphrents.com.  This is the same email address where you should have sent your original inquiry.  I just spoke with my receptionist and she confirmed that we have not received any information requests from you.  Please note the spelling of Rudulph.  Many people have made the mistake of spelling Rudulph as Rudolph and the email does not get kicked back.  I believe that is because there are at least 2 Rudolph Real Estate offices in different parts of the country.  We welcome the opportunity to bring on new clients.  Even if a  property is outside of our service area, I always try to link you up with someone who should be able to help you.  I look forward to seeing your email.
Amber, we are still looking for your initial email.  Please forward to reception@rudulphrents.com so we can determine what happened.
7/15/19:
Amber: we still have not received the forwarded message from you.  Due to your lack of response, we will assume you either sent your initial request to the wrong email or you have never had contact with Rudulph Real Estate.

name: Neal Bradley
text: We've been renting from Rudulph for a few months now, and they have been spectacular.  The professional and courteous staff have been great.  We've had a couple maintenance issues that got resolved quickly through them.

resp.text:
Neal,
Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the feedback.

name: Cyndy Gurley
text:
I was extremely happy with this company up until just recently (hence the 3 star). I have been renting with them for around 14 months now. If you qualify and meet their standards they are wonderful to work with. If you are paying your rent in full and on time, they will go above and beyond to meet your needs. However, if there is an unexpected life turn, even notifying them will not help. I was laid off at work and could no longer afford the rent. Even their qualifications say that you must make 3x the rent in a months time. I now make less than 2x the rent. I notified them of my life changes thinking that was right thing to do, but as I had forgotten, just remember they have a contract in place and that is what they will go by like any other business. They are still a great company despite my disagreements and misunderstandings on some of their business practices, but if are going into renting with them knowing there is even a possibility of financial changes in your life, I would not recommend them.

Adding in response to owners reply. They did offer me release option, but ultimately that is continuing to pay the rent in full as usual until it is released, sold, or until end of your lease (which ever comes first). This is extremely risky option for someone who cannot afford the rent in the first place. Can’t afford their rent, but they want you to pay two rents while waiting for them to find another person to lease. Great idea guys. Even when I offered to pay 3 months rent, plus them keeping deposit to end lease ( 6400 total).  They claim they can get it leased in a month or two (3200 total) so why not take the 6400 total and let me go? Hmmm, wonder if it’s because they cannot/ or don’t try to immediately lease it out??? Just a thought. You have to move out before they will begin to show, again paying two rents. Not a great option when I cannot afford their rent, so no that’s not helpful as he claims. Not sure how that helps me at all as they are “helping me out of a bad situation”. And I have signed and returned the release option papers, so I am unaware of what that is about. I even got confirmation emails they were received, which I am happy to provide to anyone showing the dates of his post vs the dates of the emails. Also, I highly doubt I am the only person that has gotten frustrated from being in a financially binding situation, so not sure how that deems me the most difficult with this type situation. Again, great company, until you are in a financial situation where you cannot make rent.

Update on this (today 7/30/19), as if the owner below saying I did not sign and return the forms in June wasn’t enough, just got a call saying they did not have the forms (supposedly) and could not process anything. I told them I had email confirmation that all forms were received and would be glad to forward that over. Was told that worker was on maternity leave and they could not access email to get the forms. Not sure how that’s my problem??? But sure, I’ll redo everything again since you cannot properly arrange cover while employees are out on leave. 😄

resp.text:
Cindy,
Thank you for clarifying the fact that we hold renters to the agreement that they signed.  You did not include the part where we gave you the choice of a re-leasing agreement that you, as of today, have not signed because you would rather us let you out of your lease.  We understand that people run into financial hardships and we do this sort of deal at least 10 times a year.  We have never had someone react as you have reacted.  Keep in mind, we are trying to work with you to help you get out of a bad situation.

name: Troy Birdyshaw
text: My family has used Rudulph Real Estate for years. They are very passionate about what they do. I had some concerns about letting someone rent my new construction home, but Rudy explained in great detail the safeguards that are in place to ease my concerns.

Corey,

Thank you much for your thoughts.   It was a great move-out inspection minus the minor items you mentioned above.  We look forward to working with you again in the future as a customer or a client.  Good luck with you next endeavor.
Rudy Rudulph

name: Lori Andrew
text: I rented a place in alabaster AL. Mid-lease this company took over the lease. After moving out August 2013 they sent me what was left of my deposit per their evaluation. They deducted several hundred dollars out due to several things that were damaged when I moved in. The most money was taken for broken $10.00 Dollar General blinds that were all broken when I moved in. I emailed Rudy on multiple occasions from 10/2013- 1/14 with photos of the day I moved in of the broken blinds and marks in closets. He last stated in january he was out of town and would review once he was back. Ive yet to hear anything. I was a great tenant for almost 2 years and left the place very very clean and this is the respect I have received. Good luck.

resp.text:
Lori,

The last time we spoke, I informed you that I was no longer managing the property and that you would need to contact the new property manager about your issues with the move-out inspection.  As stated above, we were brought in after you had already taken possession of the property.  The pictures I used for my move-out inspection comparison slides were taken when I originally met you at the property.  From those pictures, I was able to determine that the charges against you were justified.
Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss as I had assumed you had taken this up with the new property manager.
Rudy

Your review is inaccurate.  You were given a refund of $337.34   You were charged for the items which were found to be your responsibility. Please follow the link below to view the slides from the move-out inspection:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6qaPDisaDLRbXd3OS0xUks4eVE

name: lindsey hutchens
text: A misunderstanding meant we had to pay for a door repair because it looked like someone had tried to break in the apartment we'd been living in for about a year and a half.  We weren't sure - the door frame just splintered one day when opening, leaving the lock virtually useless. (The door was not in particularly good shape when we moved in.) We didn't file a police report as there was no evidence that a break in had actually occurred. When Rudulph repaired it and didn't charge us, we thought there was no issue, since nowhere in our lease did it indicate a police report would be necessary. We were a little shocked when we moved out several months later and over $400 was deducted from our deposit specifically for the repair of the door - without prior notification by the property manager of the cost of the repair, which only included a new deadbolt and a patch fix to the door and frame. Upon speaking with Mr. Rudulph, this was how they recouped their investment in the door repair. Maybe this is standard procedure for most leasing agencies, but it seems like bad practice to require your tenants to involve law enforcement before you will pay for repairs to damage they did not cause and that, if not addressed, could endanger their safety.

resp.text:
Lindsey,

I appreciate your thoughts.  It is standard policy that any time a tenant reports a break-in, we require them to send us a copy of the police report as soon as possible to justify the cost of sending a contractor to fix the door.  I explained this to you guys at the time of the incident and trusted that we would receive the police report after a few days.
Rudy

text: Brooke was awesome! We are first time buyers and she answered all my questions, kept us updated on everything. She was absolutely wonderful.

name: Lucy Darling
text: Brooke was incredible!! The time and effort she put into selling my property was something I never expected. She had to deal with 5 offers, not all at one time. name: Brian Davidson
text: Brooke was outstanding as our selling agent; her insight and experience in Northern Alabama were key to pricing our home and land perfectly for the current market. text: Brooke was extremely knowledgeable, responsive, and helpful during the entire process. Made purchasing land a breeze. resp.text: Shawn, great buyers like you make my job easy and fun! Thank you for allowing me to serve you and looking forward to helping in the future.

name: Matthew Merced

If you're looking for a kind, patient, professional, and simply snacking realtor, call Brooke! She is our forever friend.

resp.text: Thank you From the bottom my heart for the kind words. You guys were so fun to work with and I wouldn’t have had it any other way.

—— RH Ward & Lynda Walker

text: Brooke was a great Realtor® to work with on the other side of a transaction! Very communicative & professional!

text: Known Chad Hampton for several years. When it came time to buy a home my wife and I could only think of and trust one person. If you’re in the market for a new home or selling your current, contact Chad Hampton and never look back.

text: Great people to deal with. Keep up the good the good work.

name: Ashley Lamar
text: Friendly & knowledgeable agents. The office doors are open and welcoming to all who enter!

name: Lori Marie
text: After our home was for sale for over a year with Coldwell Banker, we decided to go with RaJane. Thank God we did...she sold our home in less than 2 weeks! We were finally able to move back home to VA. It was a big mistake on our part not listing with RaJane in the first place. She didn't just list our home in the MLS and sit back while other realtors showed our house to buyers who couldn't even get a bank loan, like Coldwell Banker did...RaJane actually got out there and actively found a qualified buyer! Wonderful realtor! We recommend her highly!!

name: thomas dunnavant
text: Over the last several years, i have had the privilege of working with Rajane and her husband Mark on many projects.  As a home inspector, i am exposed to a lot of agents but Rajane is definitively at the top of her game.   Good business woman, fair to a fault and a genuine Southern Lady.  I try my best to be impartial, but she stands in my top five favorites. Five stars is the most i can give, but i'd like to do better.  Listing or Selling, Rajane deserves your attention when you are looking for a hard working, productive real estate professional.

name: Brian Edwards
text: Kitty is an amazing realtor and an even better person! Having the pleasure of working with her selling my house while going above and beyond to make sure the house closed promptly. She was able to secure full asking price, made sure all the inspection reports were performed timely and all the work completed that buyers wanted done, so the closing date was never jeopardized.  I could not have asked for a better person to sell my house and she knows the Tri County real estate market as well as anyone in the business! If anyone needs to buy or sell a house Kitty is the right person.

resp.text:
Thank You so much for your endorsement Brian!
We appreciate your business, and are so happy to be able to help you with your real estate needs. When Buying or Selling a home in the Montgomery, Alabama River Region, "When it comes to us, it's ALL about YOU!" is not just a slogan - it's Our Mission! Thank you again for your review of our real estate company. So glad we could help you get your home SOLD!

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Looking to buy a new home Contact Kitty Wasserman she is the best at what she does 5star Realtor.Lookingvfor a rental property Call Jeff Wasserman also great at what he does 5star Property Management and Realtor. Cant go wrong with choosing Capital Realty Group River Region!

resp.text:
Thank You for your comments! We really appreciate it!!!
Jeff

name: Cody Greene
text: My wife and I rented a house that was be under control of Capitol Realty Group. Living there for two years we kept the house in very good shape, compared to the renters before us. As our lease ended we did a walk through with the manager who said everything looks fine and we should have your deposit in the mail in a few weeks. Come to find out we were charged without being informed of any wrong doings. I would not recommend renting a house that goes through this group.

resp.text: Thank you for this opportunity to address your concern Cody. We apologize for any misunderstanding of the move out process and invite you to reach out personally to Jeff, our property manager, to resolve issues of your experience to your satisfaction. Our commitment to customer satisfaction is our #1 priority. We look forward to resolving this matter.

name: Ex Libbin
text: We were so lucky to find Kitty!  She was a professional from the beginning when she showed up to our house until we closed.  She made sure the whole process was as stress free as possible.  She went above and beyond to make sure we not only sold our old house but were able to get all the details figured out for purchasing our new home.  Thank you so very much Kitty!

name: Patriot Czar
text: I've found the Professionals at Capital Realty Group River Region LLC To Be VERY Helpful In My Search To Buy A Home during a recent PCS to the Maxwell / Gunter Area of Montgomery, Alabama. We found a GREAT Deal on a Home That Is PERFECT For My Family, and I HIGHLY Recommend Their Services!!!

resp.text:
Thank You So Much For Your Kind Words!!!
Remember,  "When It Comes To Us - IT'S ALL ABOUT YOU!!!"

name: Autumn Hooper
text: I would highly recommend Capital Realty Group to anyone. All of the agents actually care about their clients. I still keep in touch with my realtor, Cathy Varner, and consider her a friend! Not only do they do a fabulous job in real estate services, but also in property management. Jeff Wasserman does a fantastic and thorough job as the property manager on our behalf for our rental home. Above all else, they go above and beyond the call of duty!

name: D Hicks
text: Kitty ROCKS! My wife, Dr. G, and I moved from sunny S. Florida and before that we needed a real estate person that could find a house that would fit our lifestyle, and our special needs. We flew up to Montgomery and went out with her a total of three times.. the last time was the ringer.. ( we wanted to take our time and find that perfect home.) I Remember the day that Kitty found our dream home.. Stacie and I were laying in bed on a Friday afternoon, and we got a call from her. She was stopping by a home she had found that she thought would work.. When she got there she phoned us and could not stop talking about how beautiful and perfect this house was.. She asked if we could fly up that weekend and we did.. OMG, she was dead on right. Even in the rain of that September day we could see that the house was the one of our dreams.. WE walked in and my wife started crying.. this was it. Our house.. and it is. Kitty made our dreams come thru, she helped so much in so many things that no one else would have done. We love her and consider her not only our real estate person, but our friend!

resp.text:
Thank You So Very Much D & Dr. G!
Am So Glad I Could Help & Blessed To Have Your Friendship.

name: Kelly Wood
text: Myself and a few tenants voted to leave this review because we are so appalled. Last week I’ve learned that they fired the BEST leasing agent I’ve ever came in contact with at this property. All because this person wanted more clearance too HELP US. However was shunned and denied because she worked for a temp service! This agent even continued to help me with basic information AFTER she was let go! Personally, she was the only reason things were done around this place and even though she was new. It was done correctly! A few of us HAD to say our peace about this. I’ve lived here since 2017 and Danita was by far the BEST! This property is going downhill and we all decided NOT to renew our lease as well as let everyone know what’s going on by word of mouth. Please treat your tenants AND employees better! I pray this sweet soul has many blessings upon her endeavors. Because wherever she is greatness will follow!!! Thank you for everything!!!! That office will NEVER be the same! Get it together Arcan!!!!

name: HerSOULspeaks. NSW
text: Terrible stay here . Been here throughout 2-3 management changes and no one can seem to get it right. We still have outdated appliances, management would rather argue that fix problems and somehow my account keeps getting messed up. Being, I pay my money in full  and somehow still end up with additional charges. And when I question this, instead of carefully considering things they’d rather tell you how you’re wrong. Further more, parking is terrible and they send the tow truck around on contract but fail to provide adequate parking for its actual residents. Seriously considering breaking my contract given it’s not worth it for the even outdated apartments. my floors and ceilings are squeaking daily

name: Alejandro Cano
text: Staying at the Haven is pretty average. The apartment complex workers are nice and the Hoover area is an okay area to live in. The tour was very pleasant and nice but once you sign the lease you are not treated in the same manner anymore. The apartment I was given was not clean at all, I had to clean everything before moving my stuff in. I have been out of A/C for my apartment unit for 3 weeks now and they WILL not  compensate you for anything per the lease agreement. They follow the lease agreement to the T. It is not the apartment staff fault, it is the regional manager that will reference the lease agreement constantly. I do not recommend living here because of the regional company that owns this apartment complex, they are not understanding and you will find way better apartment complexes in the area at a better price/quality.

resp.text: Alejandro, we appreciate your compliments for our team. As we discussed, the parts necessary to repair your air conditioner were delayed due to issues with the pandemic. They have been ordered and will be installed as soon as possible. In the meantime, we have supplied a portable unit. In fairness to all of our residents, we enforce the terms of the lease agreement with regard to rent concessions or credits. If we may assist you further or bring more clarity to this situation, please feel free to connect with us at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. Thank you.

name: Jordan Tippins
text: I am new to the area, and I was looking for something safe and quiet! I found the Haven, and I quickly jumped to sign a lease. Everyone in the office has been so friendly and helpful. Fredrick, the apartment manager, has been an absolute angel with helping with the move-in process. Her and Grace both have answered all 50 of my question in a quick and timely manner. I’m so happy I have found my new home at the Haven!

resp.text: Jordan, thank you so much for your 5-star review. We are grateful you selected our community to call home. Fredrick and Grace will be encouraged by your acknowledgment of their superior service.

name: Kelly Kennedy
text:
The Haven is under new management so I had to erase my previous nasty, but blatantly honest review. The new office staff is accommodating, courteous, and professional. I’ve even heard rumors that they could be painting the heinous tan, grey & baby food yellow building color palette the previous color blind “designer” selected. The interiors are actually nice; don’t let the paint spook you off like it almost did me. Hopefully it will be a thing of the past soon anyways.

I am a single woman, about 2 years away from getting a home. 2 months ago I was certain I’d have to switch apartments before that time came, but now I am confident that the Haven will be a a great place to live once more.

name: Rachel Triplett
text: I was looking for something safe and quiet for my girls and I and I stumbled upon this gem! Everyone I have come across has been friendly and neighborly. Fredrick, the apartment manager, was absolutely amazing with helping with the moving in process. She was very patient, answered my emails in a timely manner, and always let me know she was there if I needed her. I’m happy we made Haven our new home!

resp.text: Rachel, your lovely review made our day! It's delightful to know that you and your family feel so much comfort in our peaceful, friendly community. Thank you for shining a spotlight on Fredrick's outstanding help during your move-in process. It's a pleasure to have you here!

name: Clementine Stanton
text: I have lived here since September of 2019. I absolutely love living in this area. I have felt safe since day one. My apartment is newly renovated and truly feels like home. I have never had any issues with maintenance. Once I place a work order, one of the workers have been out to my unit within 2 days. Dawn in the leasing office is always quick to answer any questions and helped me tremendously during my lease signing process. If you want to live somewhere that is safe, pretty reasonably prices, and updated this is the place for you!

resp.text: We appreciate your review, Clementine. It has been great to have you here over the past year. We will share your positive sentiment with Dawn. Please let us know if there is anything else we may help with as time continues.

Frederick Mccary is one who truly cares for her customers. She was a huge help to my husband and I since day 1. I loved her honesty as well as her sweet spirit to guide us through everything. We ended up having to move from Tuscaloosa to be closer to our jobs. Though it was a tedious process  she made everything run smoothly. We are so appreciative of her and now welcomed in our new place, our "Haven."

name: Miss Dominique
text: I’ve been here going on 6 months and I’ve had nothing but a positive experience. I’ve had a few concerns in my time here and the office staff has been wonderful. My concerns were taken care of immediately each time. My neighbors are great. Thanks Haven!!

name: Big ben D
text: Plenty of beg bugs when I stayed there before the renovation. Balconies were very dangerous as well due to the old wood that they are still using. They basically just paint over it when someone moves out. They also had plenty of  problems with their sewage, so many times the water was cut off without warning.  But the thing that did it for me were the bedbugs that hide in the corners or their carpets. Hopefully things are better.

resp.text: William, it sounds as though your experience here was not ideal. We would like to discuss your concerns in greater detail so that we may improve your time here. Your comfort is our top priority. When you have a moment, please email us at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. Thank you, and we look forward to connecting.

name: Calvin Taylor
text: Mrs.Frederick McCray has best customer services. If, you are looking for apartment home give Frederick a call.

name: Whitley Harris
text: It's been almost a year for me since I have been living there and I can honestly say I really enjoy it. Anytime I have any questions or concerns, Dawn is always there to assist me with whatever. She's always professional, she's knowledgeable of her job and very relatable. The maintenance man is amazing at his job & very expeditious about my requests, & I've NEVER waited for service. I wish the older gentleman had more assistance for such a large complex. His work alone is phenomenal I'm just saying you all should look into that.

resp.text: Whitley, we appreciate receiving your 5-star praises for excellent service provided by Dawn as well as our maintenance professional. We also made a note to evaluate our team resources in case they need expanding. Meanwhile, keep feeling right at home in your comfortable space.

name: Lee Hedrick
text:
I scheduled a tour of the complex online. I showed up 15 minutes prior to my appointment only to find the leasing office locked. The lights were on and the sign said open, but nobody was in the building. I waited until my appointment time and called the office number listed on the door and did not receive an answer.

The call was eventually routed to an off-site call center who said she would submit a ticket and get the office personnel to call me with at least an updated status of why they were not in the office. I waited onsite for another 45 minutes and no one ever returned to the office or answered my ticket. THREE days later I get a phone call from the apartment complex stating they would love to schedule another tour. They did not have an answer for why the office was closed, stated maybe it was a tour or they were walking the property. If that was the case you think they would have a record and could definitely say why they were out.

I can understand only one person working and being out on a tour that ran late, or maybe even property management issues. However, there is no reason to have the office closed for over an hour when someone had a scheduled appointment, much less wait three days to respond to them. If this is any indication of how they handle business, I would stay far away from this apartment complex.

resp.text: Mr. Hedrick, we do apologize for the experience you had at your time of visit and can assure you it is not a direct reflection of our services at The Haven. Unfortunately, there was a scheduling conflict and a previous tour ran over into your allotted tour time. We would have certainly returned your call that day, but did not receive the ticket due to a possible technical issue. We would love to reschedule your tour appointment to show you the property and inform you of our amenities and floor plans at The Haven. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you were caused and hopefully we can alter your perception of our community with another visit. We hope to speak with you soon!  Thank you,  The Haven Apartment Homes

name: Lisa Sanders
text: No complaints. I love the area, neighborhood, and access to shops. The office team is knowledgeable and friendly. They are very swift and exceptional. They under promise & over deliver! Kudos Michael, Dawn, Grace, Bilal & Ray you all make my home life pleasant & relaxing. Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing these comments. We are happy to be of assistance.

name: Katie Park
text: Great people, great services, great maintenance. I love this apartment complex!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and review, Katie! It is always a pleasure to hear straight from our residents that we have been providing exceptional living experiences.

name: Morgan Hudson
text: The move in process has been extremely easy. Frederick is wonderful and has a great personality. So happy we chose The Haven!!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share such valuable information with us, Morgan. Your feedback about Fredrick and our team assures us that we are headed in the direction of providing excellent service and in creating a place our residents love calling "home."

name: Kisha Mitchell
text: We have been living here for 11 years. We have really enjoyed it. Its very safe and convenient to shops in the area.

resp.text: We appreciate your loyalty to the community, Kisha. We have been happy to have you and your husband here for eleven years. Thank you for the kind words about our community. We love having your vote of confidence in the team. Cheers!

name: frecia vega
text: The place is ok but they try to make more and more money that you don't have to take it out I lived for a year I never paid late and leave my apartment clean when I move, my surprise was that they sent me to collections and charged me $100 extra because they painted the place and had already made enough money with me to get me out more so far I haven't The people in the office are bitter, and also if you leave in a 3 level the ac is no working good I always have issues with that !

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out. We are always upfront with our residents about move-out pricing and policies, so we are sorry to see that you are disappointed. The charges you mentioned were for standard touch-up paint, steam, and clean. According to the lease, residents have 14 days to make arrangements for payment or dispute charges before they are sent to collections. We are happy to assist you with this matter at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Jesse Turner
text: Frederick McCray was such a sweetheart...she took the time to help me with the application and also was very straight forward with all the information she presented to me no beating around the bush or hidden things I didn’t know about. I appreciate the excellence

resp.text: Hello Jesse, thank you for taking an interest in our community! We're delighted that Frederick McCray was able to assist you with the application process. We would love to have you in our community!

name: Evelyn Jefferson
text: My experience touring the Haven was great. Frederick  was helpful on the decision making process for myself.

resp.text: Evelyn, thank you for your review. We are happy that your experience touring the community was great. If you have any questions as time continues, please let me know.

name: Cleon Mitchell
text: My wife and I have been living here for the past eleven years.  The professionalism of the staff is unmatched.  The Haven is one of Hoovers best kept secrets!!!!!!!

resp.text: We appreciate your loyalty to the community, Cleon. We have been happy to have you and your wife here for eleven years. Thank you for the kind words about our community. We love having your vote of confidence in the team. Cheers!

name: Lonnie Campbell
text: Throughout the entire move in process The Haven staff has been professional and personable. Anja Sellers has made this an enjoyable experience for my wife and I. Moves can be stressful especially when you have a child on the way. We couldn't be happier with the service. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy to provide an exceptional community experience.

name: Tawanna Crum
text: It was the smoothest move-in ever thanks to Ms. Frederick for an awesome job she made the process a breeze ..... Thanks

resp.text: Tawanna, we are thrilled to know that your move-in was smooth and easy due to Frederick's help. We appreciate your generous review!

name: Shaneka Richardson
text: When I say I LOOOOVE FREDRICK MCCRAY! She has taking her time and has provided the UPMOST respect in the process. She has provided detail for detail in the process and has patience of gold.

resp.text: Thank you for your upbeat review and a five-star rating. We are thrilled to see your feedback about Fredrick and will be sure to pass it along.

name: Nate Watson
text: Everybody was friendly and courteous. The apartment I toured was clean and well kept and the dumpster area wasn’t overflowing with trash.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review, Nate! It is always gratifying to hear that our team is doing a good job making our guests and residents alike feel at home in our community. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Shaniqua Eve
text: This place is EVERYTHING. The senior leasing agent Fredrick is awesome. Soon as I walked in, the place already feels like home.

resp.text: Shaniqua, we are delighted that you were able to immediately feel at home in our community. Thank you for your recognition of Fredrick's awesome service and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Emily Tamburelli
text: Me and my boyfriend move into Haven apartments in December and we couldn’t be more excited!! Thank you Mrs Fredrick for answering all of my questions and concerns! Can’t wait to move in

resp.text: Emily, it's great to read how excited you are to move in. Thank you for highlighting the top customer service provided by Mrs. Fredrick. We can't wait to welcome you to our beautiful, comfortable community.

name: Chancelor McDaniel
text: great service and great staff can’t wait to move in shout-out to Frederick McCray

resp.text: Chancelor, how good it is to hear that your experience in our community has been great! We're so happy Frederick has made things a little easier for you. Thank you for sharing the positivity with us.

name: Sirilo Baza
text: After experiencing one year at haven apartments I’m highly disappointed.  I lived here from Jan 2020 to Jan 2021. When I moved in, it found dried dog poop left in the bedroom closet, as well as the previous owners dishes in the dishwasher. I found this after the leasing agent Fredrick, told me the apartment would be “deep cleaned” before moving in. She also said that the countertops would be replaced, which never happened. Maintenance techs come into your apartment whenever, even if they have told you a certain date and time. When it was time for me to move out, I made sure to clean and vacuum. It was as clean as it was when I initially moved in, but because it wasn’t spotless we are being charged enough to keep my security deposit and more. I would not recommend Haven apartments, just for the simple fact of not having good quality control.

resp.text: Sirilo, we are thrilled that your visit to our community was a great experience! It's wonderful to hear that you were impressed by the top-notch service from Frederick and our lovely amenities. Thank you for the review, and we are so pleased to welcome you as a resident soon.

name: Cyrus Patel
text: Lived here for a little over a year. It’s fine.

resp.text: Thank you, Cyrus, for your excellent rating. If there is anything we may do to enhance your experience, please don't hesitate to let us know! And we're sorry for not responding to this review earlier - this review platform had suspended publishing reviews due to the COVID-19 situation, and we are only now seeing your feedback.

name: Saria Dickinson
text: The unit is beautiful, neighbors are nice. The Hoover school system is one of the best school systems in the area. The playground that is directly across from our building is lovely. The cleaning crew needs to do their job thoroughly. On move in day, the carpets should not make my socks black after 15 minutes nor should my allergies/sinuses be going off like crazy after the same period of time. After a week of constant cleaning, the carpet is clean and my sinuses/allergies did not get set off. I’m extremely thankful for the air conditioning and the heating system, it works perfectly. My family and I can even enjoy a nice fire in the living room when it’s quite time as we read stories to our children before they go to bed. Nothing is more peaceful than that.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with us. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to provide you with an exceptional community experience.

name: Zatie
text:
Upon arriving to these beautiful apartments, my friend and I walked to the leasing office and the sign said please come in but the door was locked and no one was in there. I called the number and I was directed the call center and made an appointment. My friend and I sat outside for 45 minutes before someone came back. When Fredricka returned to the office, she was off the rip rude. I was washing my hands at the sink and I guess that is frowned upon at the Haven apartment complex.
When my friend was explaining the purpose of her visit, Ms. Fredricka was not comprehending anything she was saying. Before viewing the apartments, I gave a suggestion to Ms. Fredricka that she should turn the sign around so people can know she is not in the office at the moment. She explained to me that she didn’t turn it around because she was just getting her lunch. Although she was just getting food and not handling business pertaining to the apartments, she should have still turned the sign around so others can know that she is not in the office.
We went and viewed the renovated version of the Madison and it was beautiful. One thing that I might add is that the description of the “patio” should be worded and explained as a balcony because that’s exactly what it is. The bedrooms in this particular unit is not big enough for the price of rent.  Upon our return to the office to view the other unit, there were people standing outside because once again, the sign was not turned around to inform them that she was on a tour. We went to view the classic version of the Hamilton and how Ms. Fredricka explained this unit is not how I envisioned it. This apartment has cream counter tops and appliances and it is not appealing to the eye at all. The cream appliances and grey cabinets make the apartment look real country. The fridge had rust on the side and I asked Ms. Fredricka if they would replace or paint over this rust stain on the refrigerator should my friend move into this unit. Maybe she did not see nor comprehend what I was saying because she said that this apartment comes with cream countertops and appliances. That’s clearly not what I was asking her. I asked the question again and she seemed perplexed as if I was asking if she personally would replace the refrigerator. When she finally comprehended what I was saying, she explained that no one has ever asked that question but she would have to check into that and see. This whole experience, completely turned my friend and I off from ever thinking about renting apartments from here. I gave it two stars because the first unit we viewed and the property itself is very beautiful. If you can deal with this lady’s attitude then I 10/10 recommend this apartment complex.

resp.text: We're delighted to know that you liked the first home you toured as well as the community in general. We assure you that if your friend had any concerns about her home, we would address them to ensure her satisfaction, and we're sorry if you left with any other impression. If you have any further questions, we invite either of you to contact us at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. Thank you.

name: Jamaal King
text: Great location. Yet, the complex doesn't seem to have a high moral ground when it comes to business. My family and I just moved out of this place and I am glad we aren't giving them a penny more. We left the apartment expecting a few charges for cosmetic cleaning, but the bill they tried to issue us in the end, with no hint of such charges to be expected during the walk through was quite surprising, especially the " wear and tear" charge for the carpet for $600 dollars, when not so much than a stain can be found in the entirety of the carpet.Begs to wonder, what is the point of the walk through at the end, if they are going to charge you anything they want once you are gone. It is quite ridiculous and I will never recommend such a place to anyone. Rent at your own risk, but take heed to those that have taken on that risk already.

resp.text: Hello Mr. King,  We appreciate your feedback. During the move-out process, we conducted a visual inspection of the apartment and its condition. At that time, we discussed both a heavy apartment and carpet cleaning. While attempting to professionally steam clean, it was determined that we could not salvage the carpet due to excessive soiling/staining and matting. The damages were beyond normal wear and tear and the charges are reflected accordingly. Please contact the leasing office to further discuss charges and review photos taken during our walk-through.

name: Vivian Hood
text: JUNE 2016: The location near the Galleria Mall is exceptional because every store, pharmacy, restaurant, movie theater and freeway acces is less than 10 minutes away. The three bedrooms are large with bay windows in the living room.  I moved here in 2014 and have never seen any bugs or pests, but make sure valet trash is properly handled and not left out all the time. I have very clean neighbors. The pool area is well maintained and overlooks the lake. Tonya and Cindy in the office are accommodating, polite and always helpful. Maintenance is phenomenal. They respond immediately to both big and small issues. One of them told me he has been here about 20 years.  I chose this property because Hoover City Schools is one of the best school districts in the entire state and because I do not want to spend my weekends in the yard making home repairs.  Changes in ownership are always a pain and the water problems are aggravating but they always try to make things right.  As long as they keep the staff and crew, we will stay.

name: Don Honaker
text: Don't waste your time going here.  The place does not even rate one star.  Went to see what was available.  Apt mgr told me how busy she was, handed me a rate sheet, and asked if I had any more questions.  Very sorry I bothered you.  Certainly will not bother you again!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. The team at The Haven Apartment Homes takes our reviews very seriously. We would like to have a better understanding of your experience. Please reach out to us at (205) 847-5933 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Malcolm Jordan
text: Before you apply for an apartment look at the ratings. I failed to do so and consequently had to suffer the consequences. I wish there was a no star rating on this review or a negative star rating. Management sucks and is very unprofessional. I was not informed that I wouldn't receive my Admin & holding fee back if I didn't decide to go thru with the apartment process. I didn't find this information out until I called the apartment complex explaining to them I wouldn't need the apartment anymore. The leasing manager is rude and very sarcastic. Take my advice DON'T do business with these people!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We were happy to communicate with you and confirm that you did receive our property facts sheet that outlines our application policies and non-refundable fees. Our team members are trained to confirm these policies verbally in order to ensure that we maintain transparency throughout the entire leasing process. Please let us know if we may be of further assistance.

name: Ameer Kotadia
text: Very nice community to live in.moved here in august.move in process was very smooth and friendly.leasing office staff very friendly.definitely recommend.

resp.text: Ameer, it's great to see your wholehearted recommendation of our friendly, well-maintained community. Thanks for letting us know that your move-in was a smooth one. We hope you keep feeling right at home.

name: Kyler Dunning
text: Frederick McCray is amazing!! She was so helpful and  nice

resp.text: Kyler, thank you for sharing your 5-star review! We are thrilled to hear that Frederick provided a helpful and positive experience.

name: Kirsten Myette
text: Currently living here and the water has been going out on and off (quite consistently, almost every week) for the past 4 months. They keep claiming to have fixed it, they even had Alabama Water Works out here 4 days ago. The Haven left a nice note on the door stating it was THEIR problem to fix and that they had done so. Me thinks not!!! Never had a problem when this place was Waterford Landing.

name: Juliet Campbell
text: Fradarick mccray helped us so much and she was so nice!

resp.text: Juliet, we are delighted to hear of your positive experience. We will be sure to let Fradarick know how pleased you are with her friendly service!

name: Crystal Sherer
text: If you are looking at this complex, please ask for "Lauren". She has helped with the process from start to end. I am extremely happy with the service she has provided. I am relocating from Georgia. Thank You Lauren Planz.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We strive to provide excellent service here at The Haven Apartment Homes.

name: Lynette Franks
text: I have been here since 2016. With wonderful customer service from previous management. Now the new property management, tells us we are no longer with AUM  water company. Now they tell us our water bill will show up on our ledger. That's what we will pay. It's my right to see my water bill, especially if I'm paying for it. Not be told they are unable to email me a copy. I really don't think they stopped using AUM Real Pages utility management.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We hope you continue to enjoy calling our community home.

name: Dionne Trannon
text: I am editing this post and adding a response for the owner since there is no way to add a response their your post below. You received this one star from me due to the parking and towing issue. I have come to you already several times and this issue was not resolved properly at all. I lost $335 that has yet to be reimbursed to me. You can't penalize residents when there is limited parking. Then, tow the car without any kind of notice. You don't do your residents that way. You said you wanted to improve my experience, well I'm here if you want to reach out to me and do the right thing.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving feedback. Please reach out to us at (205) 988-9266 so we may identify ways to improve your experience.

name: Kartikeya Sharma
text: I am temporarily relocating from Florida to birmingham, and the Haven administration (Lauren and Michael) have been absolutely supporting me to ease my move in through constant communication over phone and email. I really look forward to staying in this community during this summer.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy to be of service!

name: Howard Brown
text: Definently one of the best apartment complexes around

resp.text: Howard, we can't thank you enough for your awesome review of our community! We're delighted to be known as one of the best!

name: Lyn Franks
text: I love living here. It’s quiet n when spring hits, it’s awesone to have windows up n b able to hear the kids playing such a joy. The office staff Ashley, Michael, n Ray and all the rest are so awesome.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy to be of service.

name: Ashley Williams
text: Moving made easy and simple!!! Thanks to Dawn. if you need a nice place to live and no hassle doing it, this is the place to be!!! Thanks Dawn Pope!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We strive to provide excellent service here at The Haven Apartment Homes.

name: E. Y. Rodgers
text:
I actually live at a condo property nearby and my concerns would be the caliber of people that reside at your property. On a daily basis, I see persons riding from property, speeding and throwing trash out of their car windows. Personally, I would like to know your screening process and criteria for residency at your complex. I can only assume that anyone that would do such things to lower the standards of the community, does not and did not have favorable landlord history.

Please screen your prospects for current and previous landlord history, maybe even criminal. Your current residents (I am sure, not all) are giving your complex a bad reputation in the community.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention. Our records do not reflect any reports that bear resemblance to the concerns you have presented here. However, we are happy to look further into these concerns as we strive to maintain a comfortable and peaceful environment. Our screening process is used by many reputable management companies and is an industry standard. Please let us know if we may assist you further.

name: Anderson Watts
text:
Tons of problems... for example, we requested a completely new AC unit in October of 2017, all they did was put in more fre-on in our old unit instead and the problem continued for the next next summer and is still an issue now. It was a constant 75-85 degrees.
My car got towed last summer and they chose to use a towing company in TARRANT.... so we were out $360 just to get my car and this all happened 2 days before rent was due.
My moving out process was an absolute nightmare and the property managers communication skills and are beyond frustrating and unprofessional. It’s too bad that management is awful because this is a beautiful and safe complex, but it’s just not worth it.

resp.text: Thank you for this detailed feedback about your experience with us. We are sorry to read that your experience has not been as you expected. Our team strives to not only meet but exceed expectations and provide a great experience for all our residents and guests. We would welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns directly with you. Please reach out to the management team at thehaven@trinity-pm.com or call us at (205) 988-9266 at your earliest convenience to discuss any previous service requests that were not satisfactory. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

name: Savannah Stamps
text: I have lived here since February and all I can say is wow. My air has been working on and off since February.....it's the end of April. The maintenance man would come out and say that there was nothing wrong with my air conditioning when it was 85 degrees in my apartment. I called the emergency maintenance request and they said that they would send someone within 2 hours...no one ever came.  I live on the 3rd floor and the sun sets in my apartment. My air stopped working 2 weeks ago and I have been without A/C for the past couple of weeks. Lisa finally told me that they would replace my A/C. I received a call a couple of days ago stating that they would fix my A/C the next day. I never received a call or any sort of notification stating that they were going to fix my air. I called 6 times that day and no one answered the phone, so I went up to the office and Lisa was sitting right by the phone. Every time I call no one answers, I have to physically go up to the office and speak to someone and all they have are excuses as to why they won't fix my air. It is miserably hot in my apartment. I have called Trinity's customer service and left several messages starting 3 weeks ago...no answer. I e-mailed feedback...no answer. I e-mailed the regional Manager Danielle Wilcox...no answer. I am sure that I will receive an automated post on here stating how sorry they are and for me to contact customer service or feedback. Well...I've tried that, I can't get in touch with anybody. The communication is non-existent. Maybe I shouldn't pay my rent...that way someone would have to talk to me. No wonder their reviews are awful online, reflects the company. Please take it from me and the other reviews, do NOT live here. The air conditioning does not work and they are not on top of maintenance. I could continue on how much of a joke that this apartment complex and property management is.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. The team at The Haven Apartment Homes takes our reviews very seriously. Please reach out to our Cares Team at feedback@trinity-pm.com so we may address your concerns with our upper management team.

name: tiff lee
text: For a single mother this was my safe haven: I was a resident for about 3 years and I must say although all places have flaws this place by far well exceeds where I have made the most horrible mistake to move to. This complex really gave me the true meaning of exceptional living. They catered to my household needs and gave my child a safe haven while I battled traffic to get her. They made sure she was safe, gave her snacks, and also taught her things about money, technology, fashion, etc My child was very fun of them and I felt very lucky and I assure you since I moved NOTHING is the same.  I must say that the mere fact that they cared enough to watch after my daughter kept me there and I am so grateful. Now there were some flaws but they were always good about getting them fixed, the only recommendation I would make would be to add more light in some places for people who come home late. I truly miss this place and if I could and I am thinking about it I will be back. THIS PLACE IS THE TRUE DEFINITION OF A HAVEN!!!!!!!!!

name: Nina C
text:
I honestly enjoy living here. It's going on my 3rd year here at Haven Apartments. And not only am I happy and satisfied with the community. I am please and comfortable with the staff here! I'm a hugh people person so when I tell you they ALWAYS (no matter if they are hard at work ) manage to look up and waive! Some even know my name by heart. That means a lot. I've also been in this industry before out of state, so let me just say I do not hesitate recommending HAVEN APARTMENT COMMUNITY IN HOOVER, AL!!!! #havenapartment #awesomestaff #youshouldlive
SHOUT OUT TO: Michael, Raymond, Bilal, Grace, & Dawn! Keep up the Great Job!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing these comments. We hope that we continue to meet your expectations.

name: Esperware Interactive
text: Renter beware, we received notice the complex was sold a couple of weeks ago. They then stated inspections would be performed and a note left when completed. Well, that time has passed and no note. When we signed our lease we chose that no one could enter without us present unless it was an emergency of course. They pay no mind to that and stated "we can only take that into consideration but can't always abide by it". Way to break a contract. When our lease is up we are gone because with all the "improvements" they say they will be making, you can expect rent to go up exponentially.

name: Sarah
text:
Left my belongings in my (locked) sisters apartment for a day to help her move her things to Florida and someone working at the apartment complex entered the apartment before the move out date, stole my backpack of everything I owned and other misc. things and then relocked the doors. Apartment complex management did nothing to help. Just shrugged it off.

Edit: And no, no one else had keys and we did not leave the doors unlocked. It was someone working here. Who locks the doors after robbing a place?

resp.text: Thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention. We recommend that you file a police report for your missing items. Our team does not enter apartment homes unless a maintenance request is submitted or keys have been turned in for an apartment. We require permission to enter and every service request is documented in our system. If you have any additional information, please reach out to us directly and we will be happy to assist you.

name: Aj Jonesy
text: I was rushed there the whole experience. The apartment wasn't clean on the day I received keys. Least than a month in and cabinets are undone, the closet want close the the furnace. It's a scary looking maintenance man, he looks like a damn thug. They say I owe money, due to a guy that they hired and fired. Now my family and I have to suffer due to the incompetence of the Havens employee's. I wish I had of listen to the reviews, but I figured the place was to nice for some of the things to be true. They have one person handling all the duties of the office. I'm outside as I text waiting for some service. The Havens owner needs his or her ass BEAT for hiring this confused MESS! Then they blatantly steal money for the water bill and say you owe a certain amount that they can't even prove. The water bill is one big bill from every tenant. If you are not there often, who cares you still owe. I wasn't told about the water until, I was signing the least and it still wasn't explained for me to understand how someone can just make up a figure out of no where. They wouldn't even get one star if I had a choice. I'm pissed!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy to share that we have made updates to our community team and we have a new Community Manager starting next week to help better address the needs of our residents. Please contact us at 205-988-9266 and we will happily address your concerns. We look forward to enhancing your living experience with us.

name: Nathan Jordan
text:
I lived here for 18 months did everything I was asked to do and gave a 30 day notice at my lease end asked if there was anything else I needed to do before I moved and was told no. I gave a forwarding address for my deposit to be returned and it was not so i assumed no big deal it was $350, even though I paid someone to clean the apartment before I left.  I got a call 3 months later from a collection agency and was told that I was past due by 713.65 for clean up and damages. I was very upset and was told that if I did not make arrangements with them  it would be reported to my credit. I asked why i had not been contacted before and told them that i left the apartment in as good of condition as it was when I moved in.  They told me since I did not schedule a move out inspection and have it in writing that i would have to pay it even if i disputed it they would be filling it on my credit that day.

All I can figure is that the remodeling they are doing is being financed by people moving out. I would look everywhere else first.

name: Sarah
text:
If you like the below, then please, do sign a lease here:
-Being charged exorbitant water/sewer bills (300% higher than normal) and being expected to believe that this is due to normal "cost of living increases" and legal changes in utility billing
-Having your lease breached by the complex by not being provided a reasonable living standard in your apartment or community
-Not having anywhere to park after dark and having to walk hundreds of feet through a poorly lit parking lot with questionable youths loitering (most of whom don't even live there), THEN having the threat of your car being towed when you have to MAKE a spot because there are none left
-Mold that they deny, then force you to clean up and/or just paint over themselves
-Roaches
-Cabinets that are LITERALLY falling apart due to rotting and/or water damage
-Moving in to carpets that were "cleaned" but actually smell like throw up that you and your 60 year old mother have to spot clean on your hands and knees.
-Fixing 75% of the issues you find when you move in because you either a. don't want to wait months for them to fix it and/or b. actually want it fixed correctly
-Incessant water leaks, A/C, toilet, you name it.  Count on having to call in to maintenance once a month, then wait 2 weeks for it to get fixed, then for it to start leaking again another few weeks later.
-Not being able to get a truthful answer out of the local or corporate property management teams about anything, including their malicious business practices that take advantage of many lower-middle class families that can barely make ends meet after the drastic utility increases.

name: rb S
text: DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND AVOID THIS SLUM-LORD OWNED PROPERTY.. Trinity has a horrible rating with the BBB and many current residents are speaking out. $170+ water bills as well as fictitious and frivolous charges added into rent. This was a decent affordable place. Thanks for turning it into a nightmare. By the way, puke green and charcoal grey are they worst two colors you could pick. Should have started working on the real issues like main breaks and mold instead of painting. Either way it goes, pink or gold, a turd is still a turd. Repair the 30 year old A/C's, do something for the long time residents instead of pricing us out of homes. And quit saying you are pet friendly because you are not. Pet rent on something considered property in Alabama? And where did you find that troll Lucretia? She won't last long. This is Hoover but this is still the south. You are messing with people's happiness and homes. I hope you guys sleep well at night knowing some residents and their children can't even afford groceries after your exorbitant rent hikes, hiked up water bills and even more outrageous move out fees.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We have repaired three leaks and adjustments will be made to next month’s bill so we may address the billing discrepancies. We have addressed these concerns as promptly as possible and thank all residents for their patience.

name: Sarah Durrani
text: This place has so many names that it's ridiculous! Waterford Landing, Waterford at Chace lake, The Peninsula and now "The Haven". I imagine it is to try to escape the horrible ratings it gets. Please let that be a BIG red flag to not rent here among the other reasons that I'm about to give you. The ownership of this place changes constantly and never for the better. Our current owners have added monthly pet rent and in addition to paying a security deposit you will be charged for every item in your apartment that is not cleaned to their standards AND you will be charged for replacement carpet and to repaint the apartment even if you have lived here for years!  Any decent apartment complex does not charge for normal wear and tear but this place is run by money hungry vultures so BEWARE!  Bugs (especially mosquitos)  are also a HUGE problem here because of the lake. Children play/scream unsupervised in the parking lots and roadways. Parking is terrible. There is no assigned parking so if your neighbor has friends over you may have a very long walk back to your apartment with your arm full of groceries. Maintenance staff are rude and incompetent. This place SUCKS no matter what they change the name to. Don't let a fresh coat of paint fill you. This place is a dump and a money pit!. I lived here for several years, recently moved out and wanted to warn prospective tenets so they don't get fooled. Read ALL the reviews and ALL the fine print.

name: ashantey green
text: Whatever you do! Take it from me! Do not move here! They will not contact you back. They screen phone calls. I've been waiting for 3 weeks for then to research and issue I have with the water bill. Tonight I go to pay the water bill (even after They didn't call back) and to my surprise the bill is higher on the website. I've called several times. I've emailed. I've covered the charges they requested! If apartments want quality tenants than they must have quality workers. In the am I'll start my rant with the bbb and upward to the necessary powers. It is absolutely pitiful for apartments to handle tenants in such a fashion when you attempt to do right by them. They are so quick to slap late fees on accounts but aren't quick in handling your concerns. Take it from me save your pennies! Oh and they screen phone calls.

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that your stay with us has not been to your satisfaction. If you have any additional comments or suggestions of how we may improve your experience with us, please email our Cares Team at feedback@trinity-pm.com.

name: Unknow Unknown
text: Been living here for about 2 months. Only complaint I have is my apartment smelling like smoke at all times which is coming through the vents from another apartment. It's not good because my child has asthma very badly. So far, no other complaints as of now.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this concern to our attention. Please contact us at 205-988-9266 so we may learn which apartment you reside in and properly address your concerns. We are here to be of service.

name: Mike Jones
text: I’m not sure what’s going on with this complex but things are not looking good as of late. The false advertisement of the weight room that’s been under construction since I moved is the start, but most recently is with my utility bill. I’ve been living here for 2 years and my bill has doubled, almost tripled in just one month. After reaching out to the new management about this issue, they told me there was NOTHING they can do and the cost is the cost. They couldn’t give me any explanation as to why the utility bill has changed other than saying each apartment has to pay a share of the entire complex’s usage. It was my understanding in the lease I signed that I was responsible for the water that “I” used. I was told to reach out to American Utility Management (AUM) for further assistance. After doing so, AUM said that it seems like there has been a substantial amount of water being used throughout the complex lately, which makes sense due to the major sewage and water leakage issues and construction that’s been occurring for the past month or so, which adds to the water/sewage usage. Sounds like they’re overcharging us so they can cover the cost of the sewage issues that we don’t have anything to do with. There are other things that concern me as well but I’ll just say that there has to be a better way to handle these situations. I WOULDN’T RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE. I’ve had enough, looking forward to moving out in October!

name: Ashely Artis
text: TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT! The only good thing about this complex is the fact that maintenance is good. One of the maintenance guys Bilal hurt his back really bad and still came back 3 times to make sure my a/c was working. I still wouldnt recommend them because management cares nothing about your concerns and makes no efforts to pretend to. They're only nice until you sign the lease. I DIDNT WANT TO GIVE THEM ONE STAR BUT I HAD TO. P.S. There have been a lot of break ins, this is the hood of Hoover

name: Liana Manroh
text: Low class

resp.text: Liana, we are saddened to see your low rating. We strive to provide a place our residents are proud to call home. At your convenience, please email thehaven@trinity-pm.com so we may learn more about your experience in our community.

name: Justin Chandler
text: The best thing about this complex is the location. It's near everything you need. Other than that it is average/below average. Management is very unresponsive, some of the units are older and in need of updating, maintenance is lacking, and the grounds aren't the best.

resp.text: Thank you for your constructive feedback. If you have any outstanding maintenance requests or see a portion of the community that can benefit from additional attention, please contact us at 205-988-9266. We are here to be of service.

name: William Davis
text: I stayed here for two years. Worst apartment experience ever. The Ac never works, they did repaint the complex but turd green and gray isn't that quite pleasant to look at, the front office is no help at all, EVER! I've never been late on rent and my price increases tremendously with ever renewal. The absolute worst apartment experience ever I wouldn't recommend to even my worst enemy. Rippppp offffff

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that your stay with us was not to your satisfaction. We strive to address maintenance concerns in a timely manner and make improvements throughout the community that enhance the overall resident experience. We wish you the best of luck in your search for the ideal home.

name: dude man
text: I would give 0 stars if I could. This is THE WORST complex ever to live in. I am so glad I moved from that cesspool.Please please pleaseeeee stay away from these crooks. Lisa in the office is an incompetent, uneducated bimbo that doesn't know her mouth from her anus. She talks to the people in the office like they're little peasants beneath her. I can't believe they put up with her. I understand people need their jobs, but good Lord!! She always smell like Marlboro Reds and Newports. The Haven is always taking advantage of the Hispanic tenants and other poor people out there. My sister in law had cameras inside her apartment when the workers came inside after she pissed Lisa off one day(can't say much about this case). Nothing ever works out there. Lucretia was like an angel compared to that brainless Lisa. Wonder why Lucritia was fired. Hmm.Kristin wasn't much better but she was more approachable than CruellaLisa Deville. Lisa should be blackballed from any type of jobs that deal with the public.These people should not even be allowed to do business in Hoover. Several tenants have gotten together for a class action lawsuit against these crooks. Boycott the haven!!!! And boycott Trinity Property Consultants.

name: Alexis Mahaffey
text: It's honestly a waste of money! The apartments are old.. Most apartment complexes when they do upgrades  usually upgrade every apartment even  in the ones that people live in. So anyways they done upgrades and you can get it upgrading your apartment unless you pay like three or $400 extra month there's never no where to park here it's really ghetto they don't keep the place clean up there's trash everywhere I hate it here

name: Jacob Chesser
text: My unit has been without an air conditioner for over 3 weeks now.

name: Myra Elaine Watson
text: Worst place to live.  AWFUL managment....very rude and not helpful at all.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. The team at The Haven Apartment Homes takes our reviews very seriously. Please call our Community Manager directly at (205) 988-9266 to discuss ways in which we may enhance your experience with us. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Tiara Walker
text: I just didn't like it they never come to fix anything they have spider webs everywhere outside the rent is always going up the amount your paying for rent here you should just get a house

name: Quinton Price
text: Man the staff are horrible they don't tell you everything when you move In he apartments are ok but we having a pests problem right outside our apartment but back to the staff first when we moved in they said that we won't have to pay anything to move on then turn around we have to pay a 100 deposit fee next the bills the rent 855 so I'm thinking utility's are included which they are not and they don't tell you they billed us for a bill of 680 dollars for the electric which if I pay 755 on my rent u give me a notice saying I owe you a hundred dollars but you can't give me a notice saying u been paying my electric bill like the staff are idiots I'm just waiting on my lease to be up so I can get the hell away from here

name: Giselle Carney
text: Good

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We strive to provide excellent service here at The Haven Apartment Homes.

name: corey leventis
text: Easy move in process. Friendly management. I had to change my move in date twice due to some unexpected stops driving cross country and this was no problem. So far community is quiet and I love it .

resp.text:
Dear corey,
Thank you for your positive feedback! Our goal is to continue to provide a 5 star experience. We appreciate you and your business.
Sherry Burger-Lee, burgerlee@hpilancasterplace.com

name: Diana Kennamer
text: I have been a tenant here for four years and I don't have a negative thing to say.  It is very quiet, clean and very safe.  The office staff is always very helpful, they make your home very pleasant.  Maintenance keeps everything working in a safe and efficient manner.  I consider Lancaster Place my home and my family.  You won't regret living here. It is pleasant every day.  The apartments are very spacious and well laid out.  All of the apartments have a private outdoor space.  There is a pool here, tennis court, fitness center, laundry facility, valet trash pick up, and a safe place if you like to take a daily walk.  I highly recommend making Lancaster your home.  You won't regret it.

resp.text: Diana, thank you so much for the kind words about Lancaster Place property, maintenance and office staff.  We are all one family even though we may not know everyone.  Please let us know if you should need anything.  And again thank you for your 5-star review.

name: Viper Venom
text: Very friendly staff, flexible appointment scheduling for complex move-in plans, warm/welcoming community & easy online application process.  Would recommend to anyone.

resp.text:
Hey Viper! Thank you for your 5 star review. We appreciate you and your business.
Sherry Burger-Lee, Community Manager

name: Samantha Dennis
text: I am currently on my 2nd year lease. I absolutely love the apartment complex and amenities. What really has impressed me, was the compassion Lancaster has had during the pandemic. That is very rare to find. I plan to stay a resident here until I am ready to purchase a home.

name: Vanessa Bartley
text: All of the ladies I've interacted with in the office are very friendly! We've had a few issues here and there(our heater went out; turned out to be a fuse. And then our water heater started having issues) but the maintenance guys are always quick to come look at and fix anything you tell them about. They are friendly as well. These are the nicest apartments I've ever lived in!

name: Alecia Long
text: Overall strict rules but I understand also that without them you want have a nice place to stay in. Can also use some up to date in kitchen and bathroom.Other then that had a awesome living here.

name: Roger Shugart
text: Management is outstanding and the response for maintenance issues is exceptional, but cutting the budget for pine straw in the flower beds prevents this amazing complex from looking like a 5 star property.

name: Audie Edwards Jr
text: Gone down hill after new owners wooden fence that blow down in storm has not been repaired in mouths grass on bank has not been cut all year and is grow up making a perfect place for rodents and if you are older you need to think twice because if you need anything taken care of in your apartment you can’t call the office you have to go on line and put in a work order they want your rent money but after that taking care of the tenant it secondary

name: AJ
text: I’ve viewed their one bedrooms and I’m in love with the layout! But their prices are waaaay too high especially with nothing included and no updated appliances. I would really love to live there so hopefully the prices will go down in the fall.

name: Remedy Chiks
text: The one bedroom units are nice and spacious, they have easy access to I-65 but for the area, they’re pricey. For the calera area the price should be under $800, or at least have utilities or something included. Apartments in the alabaster are the same price but have internet/cable included and are surrounded by plenty of shopping choices so they’re worth the price.

name: Colby Key
text: The apartments are ok to live in but maintenance is horrible. Don’t expect any help unless they are at the property. I’ve had light switch issues In my kitchen for months and they have still yet to fix the problem because, “it was like that when we moved in”. It wasn’t like that when we moved in because I could flip the switch and it would work. Even if it was like that when I moved in it’s not functioning correctly and they should’ve fixed it. Now my other switch in the kitchen doesn’t work. Can’t turn the lights off without flipping the breaker or taking the bulbs out. Great service maintenance! Like always I’ll fix the problem myself. I’ll keep paying you to take it easy.

name: Cindy Werner
text: I have lived here since April of last year and have LOVED it!! I have never waited more than a couple of days for maintenance (usually come the day  I make the complaint) and they are incredibly nice.  Also, the office staff has been wonderful as well.  I honestly didn't have the highest of hopes when we moved here, but it has truly exceeded my expectations.  I have recommended them to friends as well.  The grounds are pretty. They are pet friendly.. just a wonderful place to call home.

name: Amy Jackey
text:
Nothing but good to say! It's quiet. Maintenance is beyond fast and easy. You set the request through the app for the complex and short time later you get a message that it's done. The office staff is very friendly but professional.

I have recommended this place to SO many.

The grounds are kept very nicely, pool is beautiful, workout room and laundry facilities are clean.

My only negative is my counters in bathroom and kitchen are very outdated and kitchen floor needs replacing. Otherwise it's great in the apt.

Strongly recommend. I've been here for 5 months and this is my HOME.

name: Stink Palm
text: This is a great place to live. I have lived for here 4 years now.Never had any problems, it’s quite clean and you can actually use all the facilities they offer. Nice pool, great staff, if I ever had any thing that needed to be fixed I called the office and they had it fixed very prompt.its also a great place for kids nice Park.its near Walmart and Publix.the staff here are great and very helpful.the apartment are nice clean fresh paint and new carpet when moved in and super clean. They also care about the grounds and they are very respectful about your needs.give them a chance u won’t regret it.

resp.text:
We appreciate your time in reviewing our community,Stink.  The staff and I are happy that
you’ve enjoyed your stay here at Lancaster Place.  We’ve enjoyed having you as
a resident! Your kind note has really made our day and we promise to continue
to offer the highest standards of apartment features and community amenities.
Feel free to contact us at (205) 476-0050 if there is anything at all we can help with.

name: Alabama Crappie Adventures
text: We are having mice in our apartment. Someone please contact me asap! Apartment 727. We don't know if they are coming from another apartment or a hole under the sink, but this needs to be addressed. This is day 3 having mice running through the apartment. Glue Traps are not working. We need maintenance to stuff the holes with some wool or something please. Thanks, Brian

name: Andre Lacey
