text: I've been living there for a month now and my experience with the staff was and has been great so far. I enjoy my new apartment, and all of its amenities.

name: j milwood
text: Decent looking apartments and the management is pretty good.way to many ADDITIONAL fees to add to your bill at the end of the month to make your bill well above $1100. Also there is no o red light at the front entrance of a very busy and fast moving highway at this complex and someone will eventually get badly hurt if they haven't already.

name: Sulmorko Nightstorm
text: Great place. Staff is wonderful. The maintenance staff is on point. Would totally recommend living here. We will probably be here for years!

name: Jamye Morris
text: Great place to live.  Brandon in the office is awesome!  He is always so friendly and helpful.

name: adrienne williams
text: So much to say where do I start. You pay for trash service and they barely pick up your trash. Next you pay for pest control but bugs are all over the place. Then when you request maintenance they come when ever they feel like it no rush to help. The apartment above me flooded into my laundry room causing leakage into my circuit breaker. And to fix that they dried it out with a fan. Mold has started to grow in the laundry room I told them and as usual nothing was done. I had 2 floods and now my apartment smells like sweaty gym shoes. The worst part is the college boys that moved in. The college boys are loud, rude, inappropriate with 13 year old girls, they never go to bed keep up working people. When we asked to break the lease for all these reasons we were told we would have to pay. My daughter bike was recently stolen right off our patio I walked around the complex and there it was laying in someone else's yard. You pay all this money to be uncomfortable and forced to stay because they make it impossible to afford to move. I wouldn't advise any hard working family to live here. Living here is like a  fraternity house. Worst place I've ever lived. Oh and let me not forget to mention they barely answer the phone. You have to go to the office and they are just sitting there so why wasn't the phone being answered.

name: Aquarius X2
text: My brother's apartment on ground floor was flooded from 3rd floor at 3:30 am on September 13 Tuesday. He and I were both promised maintenance and cleaning that day. Here we are September 14 Wednesday 7 am. 27 and a half hour later NOTHING!! No hotel provided! This is not a little flood. Not a single room in his apartment isn't wet!!

name: Chanda Mitchell
text: Seems really crowded, but the pool is nice and I've heard the management is nice. I don't live there though

name: Taylor Woodall
text: Have had nothing but bad experiences, apartment flooded after 2 weeks into moving in, (from 3rd floor all the way my the bottom floor, where I'm at) now 2 months later still have half unfinished walls, they came into to paint the first time unannounced(after requesting numerous times to be notified before coming to paint since I am pregnant) You pay monthly for pest control and then get told that they only spray twice a year, they can spray once a week but you have to request it. Needless to say my apartment is infested with ants, coming out of cracks in the walls, and if I pay every month for a pest service of course I want to apartment sprayed. Office people are rude.

name: TERRY HENLEY
text:
I stayed there in 2015. The only thing I can say  negative about my stay is, I didnt feel safe most ot the time when I left my apartment. Other than that I had a great stay. It is near everything. I played around with the staff and manager who was very to me. I must give the two men, cant remember their names, who kept the apts in good repairs a raise. Thanks for keeping my apartment in good shape. If I had a complaint, never had too wait hours or day for you guys. My hat off to you, because I dont know how the owner or owners expect two person to take care of such a large amount of apartment that you have. If several apartment are flood, refrid out, air cond, out stove dont work, etc How are they to be there on time for all the people. Some people are not willing to wait when things stop working. I suggest you hire more laborer when you are booked up and let some take time off when things are slow.  Dont you care about letting your guest suffer like they do, so they have to write such bad things about. Just hoping you stay in business. The place was in good shape when I was there. Looks like the last year was bad.
Just happen to see your web review and thought I would add my two cents.

name: Rosalyn King
text: This the worst place to stay.  I suffered a really bad experience here, this place is the luxary hood.  They have a group home of college boys staying at the faciliy.  I feel is so unappropriate, for a family environment.  The apartment is infested with bugs.  The manager is so unprofessional and so is the other lady, they run through staff.  Did I mention that the bugs there are horrible.  When pest control is suppose to be spraying they aren't spraying.  DON'T GO HERE.  I REPEAT DON'T GO HERE.................

name: Nathan
text: I wouldn’t quite say luxury, but over all our stay has been fine.

name: Christine Colmenares
text: Amazing apartment complex

name: brittany mitchell
text: Management is awful

resp.text: brittany, please reach out to the Lancaster Place staff at (205) 476-0050 so we can address your concerns directly.  We are sorry we have not met your expectations and we will do our best to remedy that.

name: Christy Hargett
text: Never been there

name: Josh Rigsby
text: I always have a great experience. Those ladies really are knowledgeable and always available to help out. If you are buying, selling, renting, or looking for a professional company to manage your investment you can rest assured that this one stop shop will not disappoint.

resp.text: Thanks, Josh! It has been a pleasure working with you in the past and looking forward to helping you in the future. We appreciate you!

name: Ashley Moon
text: Kami is a professional who knows her stuff. She always provides the best advice and makes each experience special.  She loves meeting the needs of her clients and is a joy to work with.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We appreciate you!

name: Kim Stackhouse
text:
The best real estate agents in the area--hands down. The team is a group of wonderful people both personally and professionally. Would give them 10 stars if I could!

They also always have the prettiest plants in front of their office. A+🌱

resp.text: Thank you. We appreciate you!

name: Dani Animates
text: The New Stone staff is very knowledgeable of the Tallassee and surrounding areas.  They are always very helpful and quick to respond.  I would highly recommend them if you are looking for a home, selling your home or need assistance with property management.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Constance Ruff
text: They are all really friendly. They have always sent someone out to do repairs in a timely manner. I would definitely recommend them as far as renting from them. The only negative thing I really have to say is that THEY ARE RARELY AT THE PLACE. I prefer to pay my monthly rent in person instead of dropping it off in the door. But it is hard to catch them there.

resp.text: Hi Constance,  thanks for your review. We are sorry that you didnt feel you could give us a 5 star review. We strive to be at the office each day, but both office staff members are active real estate agents so there may be times when we are out of office showing property,  performing inspections, and meeting clients at property. We do have a dropbox to drop rent and correspondence for that reason. We also usually forward the office phones to an agent if we are gone during business hours. Feel free to call us at 334 283 2900 with any questions.  Thanks, Kami

name: Shona Griffith
text: I can not express how much I love New Stone Realty. Very professional and such lovely people to work with. Thank you New Stone. My fav. 🙌

resp.text: We have enjoyed working with you. Thank you!

name: MARTHA D THORNELL
text: I was looking for a house. They are all very friendly and the applications are very easy to fill out. They also refund application fee if your not approved. Great realty company, I would recommend them to you.

resp.text: Thank you, Martha. We appreciate your review.

name: Carrie Lloyd
text: Awesome customer service

resp.text: Thank you, Carrie. We appreciate you!

name: Janie Green
text: Horrible customer service

resp.text: Janie, we are sorry you feel that way. We reviewed your application and responded to your multiple phone calls and visits in what we feel is a prompt manner. We don't post details on statuses of applications on public venues, but it is my understanding that a member of our staff has updated you to the status of your application.

name: Jameshia Rogers
text: Not in service!

name: Tammie Walter
text: This guy is a joke. Once he has your info he will hound you for "referrals" to people who need their credit fixed. Hound. Like a broken record. And then has the gall to want a CO-SIGNER for a $425 drty old apartment in a slum neighborhood with dead roaches in the tub, amoung other things. I'd LOVE to see someone with "great' credit rent one of your "properties". Not happening. Hound on dude.

name: Amber Adams
text: I have a wonderful and blessed New home

name: Terri Mobley
text: This by far was the worst buying experience I have ever had to deal with. Unlike a lot of people I kept every email and message that will back up my dissatisfaction. And we have purchased many homes in the past, Sonja is by far the Queen of dishonesty and circumventing. She was the most unprofessional Relator she made what was suppose to be a pleasant experience a nightmare, I should have read the reviews from the beginning and I most certainly wouldn't have went through this experience. The continued aggravation we had to deal with because of the current housing market squeeze and had we not already sold our home, we most certainty would not have continued with this sale, her games and change of direction style of doing business was almost too much to bear. So with that being said this is my experience and I hope everyone after me will have a more pleasant encounter.

name: Amy Walker
text: I’ve been friends with Sonja for years now & she is one of the most professional, kind and hard-working people I know!  I highly recommend her services to anybody who is in the market!  I am sure she will treat you like you’re her #1 customer!!

name: Paul Onderdonk
text: Honestly I haven't done any business with them yet. I inquired about a rental property, however the residence rented before I got around to view the house or submit an application. But all the support and help I've received from the realtor trying to help me find another suitable rental, I think I've found my realtor for when I'm ready to buy next year.

name: Terry Collette
text: Sonja gives the personal service you deserve. She does real estate listings and rentals. We used her to rent our home - they manage everything for a small fee. Would highly recommend.

name: Sarah S
text:
Respect both deed holders, not just the one you prefer. You hindered our family's property goals with all of your time-consuming circumventing, and you're supposed to be a property manager.
You're supposed to LISTEN when the property owner tells you to do all business through the co-owner. I dont know why this was so difficult for you to fulfill; regardless of your reason, it is inexcusable for a service provider to work against their client's wishes.

You offered no help in regards to the utilities issues.

The tenant made the house move-in ready, so yes, that tenant deserves a 5-star review.

Do not contact me again about changing the score you have earned. You stated my father likes you, so go get your 5-stars from him.

name: karen voelkel
text: Great  broker

name: Robert Calhoun
text: I lived in downtown Auburn, renting from Badger Properties.  Without a doubt, it was one of the best rental companies that I have used in Auburn.  Apartment complex was very well maintained.  The atmosphere was quiet, perfect for a serious student.  Also, I loved how convenient it was to walk to central campus and downtown.  I recommend Badger Properties to anyone looking for housing in the Auburn area!!

name: J. Keith Maxwell
text: I stayed in Center Court this summer for a temporary situation. I had top notch service from Chris Kearns and Jason at Badger Properties. I would highly recommend Badger if you're looking for a quiet place to study or just to live. His rental policy is great for older students. Also, the customer service is superb.

name: Amanda Weaver-Laird
text:
My experience with Chris as a landlord and Badger Properties has been nothing short of an excellent experience. I moved to Auburn 2.5 years ago for my job in property management and have only lived on properties that I worked at. When I decided to move away from my student housing property I wanted to move somewhere that was close enough to campus that I could walk for game days, but that wasn't full of young students and this was the perfect place (Park Hill cottage). It was secluded and quiet, but just a walk away from downtown and all the fun that Auburn has to offer. The biggest downfall for this property was that there is no dishwasher (not a huge deal), no washer/dryer (but there is a laundry mat on site and down the street at Thatch Hut) and it has cinder block walls so it gets really cold in the winter.

I made the decision a few months ago to move to another newly renovated apartment that Chris also managed (Broadway Apartments) that were a few minutes farther down the road. I was so excited about the price and the location is still great, a littler farther from downtown but the apartment is so worth it! The renovations that Chris did are great, I love the flooring, paint colors, it had new carpeting and the room and closet sizes are great, it also comes with a (very small) dishwasher and a washer/dryer. The only issue that I have with this apartment is the amount of noise that I can hear from the people upstairs. Maybe keep the dogs on the 1st floor! ;-)

Chris has been a great landlord and I would absolutely recommend him to any serious students or young professionals looking to be in a great place in Auburn.

name: ASHLEY MURPHREE
text: Badger Properties is a diamond in the rough when it comes to realty companies in a college town. During my four years at Auburn, I used four different realtors. Badger Properties was by far the best! Chris, the owner, is a very kind and respectful business owner! He does not allow freshmen to lease at any of the properties, which is great for studying. I lived in the complex on W. Glenn, which was great because I was able to walk anywhere that I wanted to go (including class and the library)! You will not regret renting from Badger Properties!

name: Clay Grisetti
text:
If you need a place to stay in the Auburn area contact Badger Properties. Myself, the best man at my wedding, my sister, and many of my friends have been incredibly impressed with Chris Kearns and his locations.

Extremely fast repair or response time if you need anything. Friendly management that does a great job taking the worry out of renting.

If you enjoy Auburn life you can find Chris around campus, town, and even at Sporting Events across state lines.

My wife and our families have moved away from Auburn now but we have recommended Badger to many students and professionals and everyone has the same thoughts: if you need a place to stay, call Chris at Badger Properties.

name: Ashley L.
text: Probably one of the most humiliating rental experiences I've ever had as a renter. I went to Badger Properties because I read good reviews on Google and had heard generally good things from people. I went to the office in person and told Chris "the badger" my situation. I was just getting out of a 12 month rehab program, and had been working for a Christian Ministry and looking for an apartment in Auburn since I was a student at Auburn University at the time. I was very up front about my bad credit but was working 7 days a week and had many references etc to back up that I was honest and good for the rent every month. After seeing me alone in his office after hours, and asking me to come along (still alone) with him to see one of the properties (still after hours) I agreed because I was desperately in need of an apartment. He took me to an apartment to collect rent from a girl around my age, then he took me to another apartment where he basically showed me a place and then just sort of "visited" with some tenants. Every one seemed to like him, the apartments were pretty nice for how old they are, regardless, I was impressed at the time. We then went back to his office (once again, all happening after business hours) and he gave me an application, but before he did that he sat me down in the seating area of his office. We were completely alone and it was very dimly lit, and the front door was locked. He asked me extremely probing and personal questions about my past drug use. Mind you, I was sober for over a year at this point, active in church (still am) and admittedly hadn't even smoked a cigarette in over a year. He asked me questions like, "So what led you to do drugs?" "what kind of drugs have you tried?" "how did you do your drugs? did you shoot up? snort them?" He just kept asking SO many invasive and frankly, inappropriate questions; it was almost sadistic. I answered them as honestly as possible without divulging too much, because I really needed an apartment, I was impressed by the ones he had shown me and I thought that being as honest as I could would show him that I was a good tenant despite my bad credit, etc. After filling out an application and getting my credit checked through the program he said he uses to run credit (which gave a very vague summary of ones credit) I went back to his office once I had submitted my credit report and application. He said he didn't think he could rent to me because my credit report showed that I was $25k in debt; I explained that those were my student loans and that the program he uses wasn't showing exactly WHAT the debt was, just the amount. He said he couldn't rent to someone who was that far in debt. I explained that I am a student and that those are my student loans. I said, I would get a more in depth credit report and bring it to him. He gave me back my money order with the application fee on it and said to come back with a new credit report. My aunt is a real estate agent and she ran my credit for me, this time I had a complete credit report with every single student loan showing in detail, but because I had now ran my credit twice in one week, my already poor credit score was even lower. Despite that I went back to "the badger" and told him that the large amount of "debt" he saw was indeed my student loans, which were not even in collection because I was still attending Auburn at the time. He said then said he couldn't rent to someone with a credit score as low as mine and with a history like mine (due to my past drug use I had a criminal record. I have not had a single run in with the law in almost 4 years). So all in all, after wasting time, money, energy and being thoroughly humiliated, I would say that Badger Properties only serves those they deem worthy, and they don't believe in giving people second chances, only sadistically probing and dissecting the past of people who have made mistakes despite turning their lives around. A huge waste of time.

resp.text:
After 15 years of running Badger Homes and Badger Properties, I stand by my record of treating all applicants fairly in terms of their qualifications for an apartment.  They area 1) Credit score, from a tenant or direct relative, 2) Academic progress, and 3) good references from their previous landlord.  As stated above, our screening reports DO only show a credit score, they do not show a full report - meaning, we don't know the type of debt.  Our screening criteria is designed to approve or deny based on the SCORE, regardless of the type of debt.

If this dispute ever got serious, *I could produce a chain of emails which would explain and clearly show the reason for Denial*.  There was never any "trade" or "back door" approval process offered, and their never has been since I started the business.  We document every case of approval or denial, so we are ready to defend against accusations such as these.  That is not how we operate.  To have one negative review in 15 years should be evidence of how we do things.  Are we perfect?  No.  But we don't run the kind of business we are being accused of in the allegations above.

On the rehab comment: I can confidently say that we have rented to people coming from / still in rehab programs.  We have also rented to gay, straight, and many different religions and ethnic backgrounds, as well as singles, married couples, singles with kids, and families.  We have rented to people with low credit scores, also, but they must have a direct relative with a qualifying score be screened and sign as a Guarantor for their lease.  Our records are clear on that as well.  The "second score" that was brought to me to qualify was well below our minimum qualification.  We require a 650, the score presented was well below 600.

As stated above, there was not a qualifying score, and possibly not the required academic progress - but maybe
she met that qualification, I honestly do not recall.  We do not search any Applicant's criminal record, only our employees.

As stated above, I DID refund the Application Fee, and provide a true explanation of the reason for denial.  I do not remember asking questions about shooting or snorting drugs - I don't even know enough about drugs to know what that would mean anyway.  I have never even had a beer in my life, which everyone I've known for 41 years can verify.

After hours, most (not all) of the lights are off in our storefront office, and the door is usually locked, but it is a full glass storefront on a busy street full of shoppers - so hardly a threatening or scary place.  I admit I probably asked questions that I didn't officially need to ask, true.  I am sorry if doing so had a worse impact than I expected.

I do remember that the reviewer above and I did go to see an apartment and collect rent from a neighbor, but in most cases our rent is paid online, and has been for years.  I always thought that giving tours after hours and visiting with tenants after hours was a sign of good customer service, not something I would have to defend later.

If an independent auditor surveyed all of our current and previous tenants - male and female - over the last 15 years, they would come up with a conclusion that we are a little slow on maintenance, tough on noise, but that's about it.  If they surveyed everyone that has applied and that we have turned down over the last 15 years, they would find that there was a clear reason for each denial, and it was based on our written requirements of Credit Score, Academic Progress, and References.  That's it.  There is no evil, juicy story to report.

Ashley applied to rent from Badger in Sept 2014 for a Dec 14 opening..  I admit, I could have done better with the questions or the office lighting(?), but I have made no further attempt to contact her or to be in her life in any way beyond the Application period.  I am not sure why in April of 2016 she has decided to bring these accusations/allegations.

name: Kerry Devose
text: So I asked what's the requirements before I fill out an application and they said its up to the agent. I asked was it a certain credit score I have to have and the lady told me no. So now 4 days later I called to check on my application and they told me that I'm $93k behind on child support which is not true. I don't owe child support then they go on to say you got to have a 650 credit score. I said well I asked what the requirements are before I did the application. Well the phone said click. Not just that, they wouldn't give me my check studs back. Application fee scam

name: Abby Cook
text: After renting one of Tom West's properties for 2 years, I can say I've had a great experience overall. They made it very easy to go look at any of their properties initially and were quick to get everything situated with a lease, especially since I was out of state at the time. I found a wonderful little home that was a little older, but anything that came up was handled promptly with good communication. Alyson and Tabitha both have always been nothing but helpful and friendly throughout my 2 years. Really appreciate them and would rent from them again in the future!

name: amy Elliott
text: I wanted to look at a commercial property for rent. I went to get the keys from their Office to let myself in and there was an obstruction in the key hole. They said they would call me as soon as it was fixed. They never called. I was suppose to be top of the list to see it so I was told. Just not good business.

name: Kim Nunley
text: Mr West is a very professional and sincere person.

name: Ashley McGee
text: Allyson Powell was so helpful with selling our house and purchasing another one. She was very easy to deal with and handled all the details! I would definitely recommend her to my friends and family.

name: FL Coast
text:
Loved working with TWC!   They have a wonderful, friendly office and staff.  Alyson Powell is beyond helpful and always goes above and beyond for her customers.  She is very knowledgeable about the Dothan area and puts her customers interests first.
If you are looking for a realtor you can trust, look no farther than Mrs. Powell.

name: Kayley McCall
text: If I could give zero stars I would. The townhouse was disgusting upon moving in and the list of things I asked to be fixed was ignored. If anything broke it took weeks to get it fixed. The dumpster stayed piled with trash and there were used feminine products laying out where I was expected to walk to throw my trash away. They came into my house on multiple occasions without any notice. The women in the office have terrible attitudes and are absolutely no help. If you're thinking about using Tom West, DON'T!

name: Jermaine Dawsey
text: It's a pretty good company to rent from

name: Sheaba Griffin
text: It seems to me that he only rents to the middle class and upper class white folks! Not only are his staff rude, but unprofessional! And it seems that they don't rent to people that work and make a honest living, your credit shouldn't be the only qualifying factor in renting from this company! But it is, not to mention being African American.

name: Scarlett Vinson
text: My husband and I have been renting with Tom West since March of 2016. From the beginning, the women that work there were very short and snooty with us, especially a young girl that worked at the front at the desk with short brown hair. Her nose was so far in the air, I don't even know if she knew what earth looked like. I got the vibe of "I'm better than you". No one is better than anyone no matter how much money you make, or what you wear, or what you do for a living. We haven't really had that many issues except a few. First of all, we own a dog. A well trained amazing dog. When we saw the house at first, the carpet was terrible. There was a huge black stain on the carpet in the living room and it was coming up at the seams in some places. You could tell the carpet was cheap and old and quite frankly plain nasty. They (owners/tom west) refused to replace the carpet because we had a dog. Also, the kitchen tile was terrible and in some places of the house, you could tell needed to be replaced. Second, We called Tom West a couple months back about a bed bug infestation. When we moved in, we had noticed little bugs a few places, but in the lease agreement, it stated we were to take care of pest control, not realizing they were bed bugs. We did not have bed bugs at our apartment and had verification from the previous landlord. We never called until about a year later when we couldn't get rid of them and they refused to pay to get them removed after we had tried just about everything. Its laughable now because we are moving out and they are still going to have to pay to remove them. Also, in the moving out procedures, you have to pay to get the carpet cleaned. They want me to have that cheap, stained carpet to get professionally clean knowing they are probably going to remove it anyways. We brought our newborn into this home thinking this could be our home for a bit, and now we are moving out 7 months later because it's just what's best. Over all, I would say the company is ok, but pick them last if you have to. When I rent again, they will be last on my list of companies to go through just mainly because of customer service and not taking care of their customers the way it should be and maybe it has a lot to do with the owners of the property as well in which case they need to be realistic as well.

name: Donna Harbert
text: I've never been so upset at one company in my entire life. I rented a home that was left in wonderful condition! 1 small repair and 1 blind was all that I had trouble taking care of before I left. I asked the front clerk the day I was turning my keys in if I could purchase a new pair of blinds and drop them off or even borrow the key to replace them myself because I wanted to do the right thing... she so RUDELY told me she would have to charge me another day. As a customer coming to you and WANTING to do the right thing, I was beyond upset to know this was so rudely handled. My security deposit that was mailed to me is literally NOT EVEN a quarter of what I paid up front because of the "repairs & blinds installment" I was charged for. I will never ever again deal with this scam company who rips people off and so rudely present themselves to their customers. I also will never recommend them. If you pay a security deposit with them and leave them with a decent home as when you moved in, don't expect your deposit back. They will find "repairs" to get you with. Completely & utterly disgusted with this company. Worst in Dothan.

name: Cornelius Clark
text: Tom West is probably one of, if not,  the biggest company in the Dothan area when it comes to renting or buying homes in the area. For starters the customer service in the main office is by far the WORST I have ever dealt with. Everyone is short and snobby especially the females that work at the front desk. I was renting one of their properties for close to 5 years. I travel a lot with my job and that was the only reason I stayed there so long. When I moved in I immediately had issues with things that were suppose to be done but wasn't. Had issues with things breaking and not working properly. It took forever to get some one out to take care of the issues. Then I move out and I have to get the carpets cleaned and provide a receipt only to be told that the carpets weren't good enough and they would have to have the company they use to come out and clean it again and charge it to me. They will not do a walkthrough inspection with the tenant before moving out. Then as I expected, my $575 security deposit is taken for painting the townhouse, so called repairs and cleaning. I paid to have the place cleaned as well but they have no plans on returning your security deposit. They make up whatever they can with no explanation. Just a horrible company to work with and I would NEVER recommend to anyone..Avoid at all cost. I notice all the 1 star reviews with the one 5 star review...that had to be a mistake!!! If I could give 0 stars I would!!!!!

name: Brooke Kelley
text: Horrible customer service. They do not take care of their properties or rental customers. We were told upon moving in to do a walk through and make a list of things that were wrong. We did, and we took pictures and gave them a list of about 15 issues we noticed. We rented a property from them for a year and in that year they fixed one thing off our list. Upon moving out we followed all procedures listed in our rental agreement. Most of the things on our list upon moving in we were charged for when moving out!!!! On top of that they made things up along the way in order to keep our initial deposit of $1150.00. They said that the property had leaks, mold and that we didn’t turn in the keys and garage door opener all of which was untrue. We did not receive ANY of our deposit back plus they tried to tell us we owed an additional $500 +! When we called to tell them to take it out of the deposit they kept they informed us that it was over and beyond that. Then they changed their story to say that when we didn’t turn in our keys(which we did) that we forfeited our security deposit?! When we asked what the additional money was for we also got a different story every time we called....first it was for removal of items(we left hangers 🙄) then it was for carpet cleaning....call me crazy but last time I checked neither of these cost 1600 dollars! They then sent us invoices that they had that they said we were being charged for cleaning fees???! Entire house was cleaned and left in better shape than when we moved in. Funny thing being, the three invoices they sent for the work done which was all minor cleaning around the house didn’t even total 500.....do not rent from these lying thieves that cannot keep their stories straight!!!!

name: Lynn Miller

name: Christina Roach
text: My Husband and I have been displaced by Hurricane Michael; and, have been seeking for a home in the Dothan area. We found two homes that met our budget and what we’ve been looking for from their listings. A Ms. Powell, with Tom West Company of Dothan, told us it would be a $40 application fee for each of us (there are 3 of us) to seek Rental.  She took our money and called us that afternoon to say we were denied because of credit. Didn’t considered we were displaced; or, anything else for that matter. I’ve been working for Lowe’s for over 20 years; and, my Husband has been self-employed for the past 8 years. My Mom is retired. They didn’t take anything else in consideration, only the fact our credit wasn’t appealing to them. Can’t believe you’ll judge someone based on their financial credit. We’re not buying a house; we’re renting a house. Shoot one of the Houses appeared to have been vacant for quite some time. I can see that, especially the way Tom West Company manages properties, especially when it comes to renting to people. Even though we’ve been taking advantage of despite our unfortunate situation, we will prevail; because, God will open a door for us. He always does.

name: Kimberly Botters
text:
DO NOT RENT HERE.

My husband and I and our two dogs have lived here for two years from 2018 to 2020. We have seen the complex change management hands several times, and yet nothing ever changes. The area around the front office is clean and well manicured, but that is where the polished front ends. There is constantly trash everywhere, on the sidewalks and in the parking lot. Valet trash is nice, except for when they leave it in front of the building to stink in the Alabama heat. Dog poop stations fill up and are left completely full for weeks without being emptied, so people let their dogs poop wherever since there is nowhere to put it. Maintenance requests go ignored and unanswered for days, sometimes weeks. Even now, I am waiting for our air conditioning unit to be fixed. I’ve submitted a request and called several times, with no result. Office staff are usually polite, but not helpful and sometimes just downright rude. We have to monitor our bank account to make sure that rent is automatically taken out like it’s supposed to be, because there have been two separate incidents where their system messed up and didn’t take the money out and they tried to then take out additional money for the “penalty” of being late, even thought it’s THEIR system that didn’t work properly. Most of the neighbors are lovely people, however there are a few ‘bad eggs’ with revolving doors of mischief that keep the Hoover police busy in this complex. If you have kids I would definitely not recommend bringing them here- it is not safe. I honestly cannot stress it enough, DO NOT RENT HERE.

name: Tanesha King
text: Awful ! Been living here a year almost never used my dishwasher nasty water smells like a  sewage in the bottom of the dishwasher Staff ! Been telling me Miquel coming haven’t saw him I been cleaning up maintenance mess Propery manger I miss the old one Tatayanni haven’t had an issue with her at all very helpful I love her , Hopefully Hills at Hoover get better but for now I advised nobody to move in

resp.text: I’m very sorry to hear this. I will have someone there today who will fix your problem.

name: Sharon McCraw
text: Your staff was very helpful today.  got all my concerns attended  to.

name: Jonathan Gordon
text:
PLEASE READ:
Believe every review you read about this place. Honestly this has been one of the worst apartments I have ever had the inconvenience of leasing. It’s really a sick joke. It all began when I first moved in. The apartment was NOTHING like the apartment I toured. Besides the apartment not being cleaned (the smell of smoke and plenty of dead bugs everywhere), there were so many inconveniences such as faulty lighting, doors that still do not function correctly (closet and room doors were not made to close or lock for some reason) and horrible appliances.

But by far, what really made the apartment horrible is the infestation of ROACHES and CONSTANT WATER SHUTOFFS.

Since day one, roaches have been a huge problem throughout the apartment. Every night there would be multiple roaches throughout the apartment, even after constant cleaning and spraying my own pest control. It was so disgusting to the point where I never cooked in the kitchen after the first month (that still didn’t stop the roaches though). One night, a Valet trash employee even told me that this complex had a terrible roach problem.

As far as the water, you can expect to go without water in the entire apartment for at least 3-5 days every month. I can guarantee it. This may not sound like a lot, but for this to be your “home”, being without water for random, unplanned periods of time is completely UNACCEPTABLE!

Please save yourself the trouble and look for a better option. If I could leave a 0 star review I would. Honestly, I could go on more about the apartment complex in general, but I will leave it at that. Don’t do this to yourself.

name: Belgee Chandler
text: I’ve tried to be understanding, but at this point I’m livid! First, they stopped valet trash (a service that was included in the rent) and replaced it with pressure washing! That was something that we as tenants had no say so in. Now, yet again, we’re randomly without water and without notice! I work from home, so imagine not knowing the water is going to be off and finding out when you go to use the bathroom that you can’t flush or wash your hands! This new management is a JOKE! Will be looking to move ASAP! I may even pay to break my lease. This is beyond ridiculous.

name: Joshua Buhler
text: Roaches, roaches, roaches. Moved in early March and bugs have been a HUGE issue from the start. I just found FOUR in the bathroom. Most i’ve found at a single time and it’s what pushed me to post this review because i usually don’t post bad reviews. I find them mostly by the back door because it was not sealed properly. Worst place i found one was crawling above my bed. When i went to get it it fell IN my bed. It’s the stuff from nightmares. Gave it two stars because the layout and space is good for the price, but it is not worth the paranoia the bugs cause.

name: Fred Noland

name: Edith Castleberry

name: Mateo Roshi
text: This place shows you a great apartment and a nice pool. When you move in, you find lots of things broken and leaks and painted over dirt and taped over holes in the wallls. . The breezeways are filthy. Utility doors are hanging off the hinges. The laundry facilities are always filthy, half the machines dont work. Management is friendly but dont get anything done. Cant wait to move.

name: Sheniqua Hall
text: DO NOT MOVE HERE!!!!!! PLEASE. I have been here for 3 months and have been having problems from this place since day one from roaches to A/C not working 4 times out of the month to  my refrigerator not working for 3 days and they still have not came out to fix it along with other issues that I have complained about. I have even went to the office to speak with David the property manager ( after I sent him a long email days before that he still till this day has not responded to) He is a joke. I should have listened when I read everyone else's reviews. Trust me it's not worth the money. This place is not worth any stars but it wouldn't let me post with out putting one.

name: Drea Denise
text:
I moved out August 29TH, and I thought my horrible experience would have been over with. But it’s not, MAKE SURE BEFORE YOU MOVE IN THAT YOU ASK ALL THE QUESTIONS ABOUT THAT UTILITY PACKET IN THE BEGINNING because it sounds are nice but they defer you 2 months and then come back and charge you those two months in the end. YOU WILL THINK YOU ARE GETTING A GREAT DEAL UNTIL YOU GET TIL THE END ITS DECEIVING. THAT UTILITY DEFERMENT SHOULD BE AN OPTION AND NOT A SURPRISE WHEN ASKED WHAT I NEED TO PAY TO MOVE OUT, because If you are prorated at the end, your rent shouldn’t be 400 dollars more then your other months living there. That’s how they get you. The day I moved out was a Saturday and to my surprise the rent off was closed and I was not notified. THEY DID NOT INFORM US THAT NEW MANAGEMENT HAD TAKEN OVER AND THAT THEY WOULD NOT BE OPEN ON SATURDAYS ANYMORE When I call that Monday, I’m informed that oh they told the other woman that was moving out on the same day as me, but I was failed to be notified. So I wasted 2 hours of that day just sitting at the office because maybe I thought the person was just on the property showing a model or at lunch. Nope. I was told I could use my deposit to pay my final balance for the utility BS, and that they were changing system and would be called from Carlton Equities, NOPE I HAVENT GOTTEN A CALL YET. I had to search for their number online only to be answered by someone that just says hello, like it’s their personal cell phone. My name was not asked or anything. They just told me oh well look into it and sorry for the unprofessionalism. MY LAST 2 MONTHS WERE THE ABSOLUTE WORST, there were places in the apartment that they were fixing the road because of their water pipe busting all the time, and the road stayed messed up for I SWEAR 2 months, just cones in the street. LASTLY, I hope no one is every talking a shower and washing their hair because they will turn off the water and not give you a bit of notice at all. THEY DIDNT LIKE COMING TO GET YOUR TRASH SOMEDAYS. For 981 dollars, THE THINGS WE DEALT WITH WAS JUST HORRIBLE. Not to mention When I got into the apartment an dining room light bulb had broke and I could never replace it because the screw in was stuck, the carpet was god awful, so I had to spend 2 of my final days deep conditioning and cleaning to floors. When I spoke with other apartment they always said I’m so sorry that Arlington was your first experience in living on your own. THEY CHANGED MANAGEMENT LIKE 3-4 TIMES. Y’all can see my earlier review under Andrea Johnson about them losing your money orders.

I HAD TO WAIT TIL I WAS GONE TO FINALLY WRITE THIS REVIEW.

name: Melissa Hampton
text:
I highly recommend NO ONE move here. They have changed management staff more times than I can count since we have moved in 3 years ago. Maintenance has only gotten worse since the last change in management. We use to be able to have maintenance come out here same day that we called about an issue. However recently none of our issues are getting resolved and no one is coming out. The roaches are a huge problem for one, it doesn't matter how often we have pest control come out or how often we spray around, the roaches don't stop. They pretty much live in the walls and no one seems to be doing anything about that.
The last couple of weeks our dishwasher has been overflowing and not draining. We've had someone come out to "fix" it twice by just draining the water manually, and we've been calling almost every day for the last 1 1/2 weeks to get someone back out here because it got worse after whatever he did. It's now flooding all over our floor anytime we turn it on. And everytime we call and they pick it up, which they don't always do, they say "We'll get someone out there today" and literally no one ever comes and it's the same repeat process every single day. Our hot water has been out for a few days now as well, and not a single person has come by to fix it. You would think hot water would be considered an urgent issue, but I guess they don't care and only want your rent money. Which by the way they slowly increase with each lease thinking no one is going to notice. It's gone up $120 total within the last few years. Our front door issue is another we have tried to get fixed. You can see and feel the outside light and weather from the inside. Summer time gets hot and the air conditioner stays on almost all day, raising our electricity bill. And winters stay freezing cold and the heat stays on all day. They need to replace the whole door but instead they always put a band aid on everything they touch. We've had someone come out at least 5 different times to fix our lock on the door because the door wouldn't even close shut all the way. If they really care about their residents they would do what is necessary to get a problem fixed, not just keep doing the same cheap thing over and over and over.
Really we didn't have many issues when we first moved in. It's been getting worse and worse each year and i'm finally fed up with it. They don't always answer the phone and they haven't responded to any emails. PLEASE DO NOT MOVE HERE. It is not worth your money.

name: Adam Castleberry
text: Love the new team!

name: Lyteria Robinson
text: If I can post a half of star I would, we are staying in a high price section 8. My building is infested with rats, pest control man came and did nothing about it saying that the rats live in the walls, that is disgusting and I am tired of dealing with this, I am uncomfortable in my own place!

name: Heather Page
text: The day we moved in we had alot of issues. The apartment wasn't even ready and we told them that and that we could give them extra time to get stuff done but rushed us to move in. We had alot of issues and most if not all issues hasn't been fixed. They like putting Band-Aids on stuff saying it's fixed then 2 weeks later same issue. Our AC blew a breaker and I contacted a ac company and told them and they said it was an issue with the unit not breaker. The maintenance guys said it was a fixed issue 2 weeks later same issue ac not working correctly. 2 weeks later another ac issue and all times our apt is hott cause ac isn't running correctly and they want to keep putting Band-Aids on it. Well our power bill is now double what it was before the ac issues started and can prove it with power company and times that ac was giving problems but the apts don't care and don't want to admit there's something wrong and won't pay for what there equipment has failed in. Would recommend finding another place to live as this place doesn't care about you just that your paying your rent. And I'm not calling y'all cause I already have multiple times and nothing gets resolved cause y'all don't care period so don't act like you do. I will be highly recommending for people not to move here and I will stand by my statement until my work orders are all complete and in satisfactory condition where I don't have to spend my first 3 months living here calling y'all to constantly fix things.

name: Tonatha EVANS
text: We have lived here for 4 years and love it. It's in a great location, it's a peaceful community, the office and maintenance staff are friendly and helpful, and neighbors are respectful. We just signed another 12 month lease! Proud to be resident at The Park at Deerfield.. T.Evans

name: Michele Wilson
text: Nice Place when I visit my sister

name: Yostin Hernandez
text: I loved the house of Bessemer But This Is More Better Than That Bessemer House! (😘) Yay!

name: Geoffrey Eggleton
text: I lived here for almost a year. The ladies in the front were very friendly and they were awesome. It wasn’t until they got a new property manager that things went downhill. He wouldn’t address any issues. Maintenance was awful, they didn’t do anything but collect a paycheck, I did all of the work myself as they never came and fixed anything. Horrible bug problem, I informed them, and they sent someone once who told me what to tel them about entry points; still not fixed! I fixed all this myself. I even had to continue spraying on a weekly basis to keep the bugs away. I also reported a few A/C units that had exposed capacitors, and nothing was done about this. Kids always played out there, and if they were to touch one, they would’ve been killed. They ignored all my emails, and I have it all documented, everything from video evidence, pictures with time date stamps, etc. I moved into the apartment completely dirty and a mess, and I left it in much better shape than their, “clean up crew”. To the ladies at the front, you guys are awesome, Lauren Howell should be the property manager, as she is one of the ones who actually cared and worked with people. She would be the saving grace of this place.

name: Jay Montcomedy
text: Haven't been able to use my bathroom sink for two weeks and I call the office for them to say they will get it done when they can. Should be laws in place for stuff like this to not happen cause I'm still obligated to pay my rent on time without avoiding any penalties

name: Katr Beav
text: It will be a year next month since I've starting living here. I love this place. The community and area are great! So far I haven't had any issues or complaints. The manager and staff are always courteous, friendly and helpful. The grounds are always kept up and maintained. I've only had to call maintenance once and the response was quick! Yes, I would recommend. Katrina B.

name: Kendra A
text: I love living here I have not had one issues while staying here it is mostly quiet and peaceful. My apartment has not had any issues since being here and when I did have some issues it was handled on time and quickly! These are the cheapest apartment here is Hoover especially with the bundle deal for cable and internet as well as trash.

name: Andrea Johnson
text:
the frustration…. I have been living here since august 30, every month since I have moved here, I have gotten a late fee when I make sure to pay with money orders. I pay on the first every month. They will lose your money order, put a payment confirmation in your mailbox, just to call you and tell you it was late or missing. KEEP ALL YOUR MONEY ORDER RECEIPT. Every time I talk to someone in that rent office, I get a different answer. Like please consult Your other staff before calling, SO YOU CAN BE UPDATED ON THE SITUATION. I was told hey, since you have never been late, we will waive your late fee, IT WAS NEVER LATE TO BEGINNING WITH. exactly down to the T of what happened, regions money order and payment systems had a glitch between oct 30- nov 7. any payment made were made to look like they were not made, while account still shows funds were sent and still on bank statement. regions district manager had to type up and stamp, exactly that. So you are waiving a late fee for? It was never late to begin with, which should be understandable. THE BANK HAVING A GLITCH WHICH IS PROVEN IS NOT MY FAULT, AND WAS NOT TOLD TO ME. I GET A PHONE CALL FROM THE RENT OFFICE AT 4:41 ON FRIDAY TO LET ME KNOW OF THIS, LIKE WHAT CAN I DO AT 4:41 TO FIX IT. The month before that,  my boyfriend had to pay the rent with a money order for me because I am not able to leave work and get it, he forgot to get the bottom half the money order for the receipt, he went back to get it wasn't able to get it and I even called the office 3 times the day after and the day after that. Just to be told, I had to wait and that if they got it, I'd have a receipt in my mailbox. I did, a few days later, the notorious call, that they didn't receive my rent. HOW!?!?!?! WHEN YOU PUT THE RECEIPT IN MY MAILBOX. HE HAD TO GO THROUGH THIS WHOLE INCIDENT WHERE HE HAD TO RUN HIS CARD TO BE CREDITED THE LATE FEE BACK. PLEASE KEEP UP WITH PEOPLE'S RENT. I THOUGHT ABOUT RENEWING MY LEASE WHEN IT IS UP NEXT YEAR BUT AT THE RATE WE ARE GOING, EVERY MONTH WE ARE HAVING THE SAME ISSUE WITH THESE MONEY ORDERS AND THIS RENT SITUATION.

NOT TO MENTION, MY CAR HAS BEEN BROKEN INTO AND MY GUN WAS STOLEN OUT OF IT. THERE IS ALWAYS LOUD TEENAGERS OUTSIDE AT EVERY HOUR OF THE NIGHT.

name: Spectral Wolfpack Paranormal
text: About ready to start paying my rent at this dump in dead roaches. New management is a joke. PS they’re now offering gift cards for anyone who leaves a 5 star review on google. Don’t move here. This place sucks.

name: Shaquita Smith
text: It's okay but not worth the money. Maintenance sucks. I had an issue with a basically broken pipe under my kitchen sink. I literally stood an watched the man just snap the pipe back together and get up like he had done the best job in the world in ten seconds. I could have done that my self. So i refuse to even put in work orders. You'll be better off fixing your own issues because my sink is still leaking.

name: Brittany Majors Irvin
text: The pool is unexpectedly closed on unusual days and times. They send out emails letting you know of pool hours but yet they are never open at those times. You pay rent to have access to the pool and it is constantly closed. An explanation of the closure would be welcomed since you are paying for something you cannot use. I have been down to the pool on MULTIPLE occasions and it has been either locked or chained closed. I was going at like noon on these days. I went one time and a staff member questioned whether or not the pool was open and if it wasn’t she was going to open it at NOON!!! This is ridiculous.

name: Brianca Mccrary
text: Loren really was a good tourist, I came in to the apartments looking for a 1 bedroom 1 bath apartment and she showed me a perfect apartment for me and answered all the questions i needed answered. I really love the apartment atmosphere and they have really good move in specials. If i could give Loren and The Park at Deerfield  10 stars i would!!!

name: Tiffany LaShun
text: The absolute worst apartments to live in the Hoover area!!!!! I took the bug reviews lightly until I moved in and witnessed different. My apartment was completely rushed before I moved in. I moved the end of March. I signed a 12 month lease that I am currently trying to get out of because I have complained so many times since the day that I have moved in. There is an infestation of bugs/spiders/roaches etc OH AND DONT FORGET THE MOLD!!! I had a leak that completely flooded my bathroom and closet and half of my bedroom. They have yet to fix the ceiling from the upstairs leak. The storage room looks like a construction site. I hate it here!!!! Thank God I took pictures so I am looking forward to breaking my lease soon!!!

name: M West
text: My family of 5 has enjoyed our 3rd year and counting stay here, so far. Living in any apartment complex is what you make it and there were issues that needed to be addressed. We worked with management on problems which are handled efficiently within reason. I especially enjoy the ability to make payments and maintenance requests thru their online service. The front office is attentive and personable. No place is paradise unless you work together to make it the best possible situation. And that is living at The Park at Deerfield. Teamwork makes the dream work.

name: Hollie Gray
text: I stayed here until my husband and I bought a house. Awful apartments. The management staff is nice in your face, but nothing ever gets done. There is a roach infestation. Pest control sprays and sprays to no avail. They need to rip out the inside walls of the buildings because there has to be a nest somewhere. Ugh! Utility package is a joke. Water bill based off every tenant in building. Do yourself a favor and pass on these. Or sign a 7 month lease and jet after saving for a house. We sure did!

name: Dana Cade
text: The maintenance guy Jose Garcia did an awesome job repairing my sink. He was fast and got the job done!

name: Ashley Furr
text: Still got roaches. Literally everywhere. They live in the walls and the only thing they do to "treat" them is spray.... how about taking care  of the problem?. Honestly the only reason I'm here still is because I have kids (but looking to buy a house)... I'd rather sleep under a bridge, there are probably less roaches there.

name: Roderick Hill
text: We have had issues after issues since moving in this place. Maintenance is horrible and the stray cats are a constant issue. For what we pay in rent the service is subpar and that’s being nice.

name: Josh Lamberth
text: I'm the type of person who let slide a lot of stuff, but this place really bite my nerves. Don't expect privacy here. I caught management over and over coming into the apartment without me being told they were coming, cause me to have a $100 power bill and I was gone for the whole month. You share water bill with everyone. $30 monthly trash bill that supposed to have trash pickup at the your door but most of the time it doesn't happen. You are forced to get cable and internet. They don't do repairs and if they do it takes forever. Cockroaches. You pay a monthly pest fee but they never came in once to spray. Lease office hours are never true. Workout center is dangerous the last time I used it. Only good thing that happen is I left that place.

name: Whitney Causey
text: Pool ALWAYS closed. Roaches everywhere. Even though you have to pay for pest control, it DOES NOT WORK! We had to buy our own pest control! Mildew everywhere! My husband has asthma and mold is not good for him. The rent is too high for these issues! They make you pay for cable and internet that is always spotty! You HAVE TO PAY FOR VALET TRASH, when you can take it yourself! Even though they pay you for referrals, I never will. When our lease is up, we're out!!!!

name: Mr. Wilson
text: Air vents and ducts should be cleaned out. Water pipes spit out nasty water; nasty enough to leave the white painted bathtub, with brown stains from dripping water, the electrical is probably from the 70’s, my hot water heater may get you through a quick shower, but I always have to check to make sure the breaker hasn’t popped. Hard wood floors? More like cheap stick down. The brand new fridge had the ice maker cut out of it??? Trash has gotten better, but it’s only the end of May, and I’m already seeing roaches everywhere. And for some reason, some of the residents like to play their music at full blast while driving through at all hours of the day, some even like to park and just let it beat. Been here 8 or 9 months now, getting out of my lease early and can’t wait to leave. Their utilities package through “ConService”, sounds good, but it sucks and they screw you there! The name says it all.

name: ALEXANDER REFUGIO
text: i live here and the paint in the bathrooms is awful and in the kitchen by the sink by the light it is soo gross i saw a spider their .

name: Rachel Figure 8
text: I LOVE DEER FIELD APARTMENTS BECAUSE WHEN YOU CALL THEM FOR ANY EMERGENCY THE SHOW UP ON TIME MY KIDS HAS TO ATTEND ROCKY RIDGE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.THE LADIES WHO WORK IN THE OFFICE ARE VERY SWEET THANKS AGAIN

name: Xiomara Simental
text: Enjoying my stay. I was a little paranoid about living in the lower part of the complex but I haven’t had an issue. Great accommodation and friendly staff.

name: Tyler Pascascio
text: Have only been here for my 11 month and had a infestation of roaches that was supposed to be taken care of by pest control. Not only has that problem not been taken care of they have now multiplied. The problems do not stop there, I also had issues using their app which did not inform me that after sending me a confirmation that the money was not pulled out of my account and got threatened with a eviction notice and did not even understand what had took place for me to even get that notice! But last not least had my apartment get filled with smoke in the air, smoke sectors went off because there is a problem with heating system and now all my clothes and the house smell like smoke... worst place I have ever lived EVER! So now I’m trying to get out of my lease and I’m still encountering issues! PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM LIVING HERE!!!

name: Jennifer Allison
text:
Long waits on work orders, requires pestering
Poor pest control plan
Unnecessary utility package (all I use is Netflix and Hulu)
Poor quality craftsmanship and appearance
Poor organization of garbage and recycling
Poor landscaping standards

Polite office staff and great pool facility
Safe to go walking at night with my dog
__________________________________________________

I've lived here for almost a complete year. It has come to be my conclusion that the original builders took many shortcuts in the building process and that apartment complex standards are to "get by".  I do enjoy living in my apartment, but I am finding myself doing repairs or upkeep myself. And in some ways, it can be nice due to the location and price of rent.

I am beginning to find more and more roaches and holes that allow them to come in. Pest control is a one time spray after you call. I have told them twice in the past month, and have not seen any confirmation that pest control has been to my apartment. I have sent work orders in asking them to fix the holes in cabinetry and panels, but have not seen any results or return communication discussing my situation.

I recently deep cleaned my pantry and found corners that had roach feces, then had more that had been painted over (prior to me moving in). I've had a nest in my microwave, coffee maker, and a game console.

My husband and I are trying to start a family, but I don't think I would raise a child in this complex due to some questionable loitering that takes place.

Very minimal landscaping in front of apartment buildings. The entrances and office/clubhouse look nice with flowers and pine straw. Apartments look forgotten and a little dilapidated. Trash litters the ground near bushes and often stays there for a very long time.

name: Dee Means
text: I have only been here if a couple of weeks and the trash is running over and has been since the 26th of February. The rent office is blaming Aws and they say it’s them. But you want patios and balconies clean and presentable but you have trash coming out the trash compactor running over!! That’s a eye soar as well!! I wish I would have read the reviews before hand. I think I have made a bad decision don’t get me wrong I love the apt. And the space it gives but getting things done around here is a serious problem!! And the roaches is Also a problem and I don’t want the response from the owner to send me some sorry txt and the problems doesn’t get fix. This is why people report to fox 6 on your side.

name: Khadijah Clark
text: Worst place to live....roach infested also. Big holes under bathroom sink and tubs peel cause they paint over them. Rent is 1,000 for 2br 1 bth too pricey.

name: Cynthia Nicholson
text: If you a maintenance issue, or other general question, you can forget talking to anyone in the leasing office when you call.  When you call the leasing office, you are directed to a 24 hour call center.  At first this might seem great, however, they are unable to answer any questions about the property or your "account" and can only forward messages to the maintenance crew or property manager.  It takes 3-5 business days for anyone to return your call (if you even get one) which can be problematic in the event of a more pressing issue.  Going to the office doesn't help as the staff is rude and unless you are signing a lease, don't want to give you the time of day.  Calling the corporate office does no good either, they don't return calls or handle issues you have with the property.

name: JORDIN FENNELL
text: We have been dealing with this same problem since we arrived, Roaches and yall can never fix it.

name: Shelby Jordan
text: I've lived here for a year. The roaches have just gotten worse and worse no matter what we try to do. The sink isnt even connected to the pipes and hasn't been since before we moved in. When we moved in, the place was nasty and we had to clean it upon moving in. The ceilings have obvious water damage and leak if it rains too hard. The matience guy broke one of my mirrors. The drain in the bathroom sink doesnt drain. They include internet in the rent, but it hardly works. Overall, just don't move here. Its not worth the money.

name: Tye Shairo
text: So far so good! No complaints really

name: Jasmine
text: Do not be fooled by these photos. This place is s high priced ghetto! The place is full of roaches and mold. Roaches are even outside in the grass! I was a resident for a year. I was suppose to get a 2br 1ba and the day I was suppose to sign the lease they told me something had happened to that apartment and I was going to have to take a 2br 2ba and I HAD to pay the increase in rent. At this point I'm basically homeless and had no choice but to sign the lease. When I go to view the apartment it's still dirty, ROACHES EVERYWHERE. I requested weekly pest control but they never did it. Bath tub was painted over instead of replaced so the paint peeled whenever you showered. The previous renters had a dog and the carpets smelled like dog pee. I asked them to clean the carpet, but they only  sprayed it, and it did not get rid of the odor. There was mold in the ceiling and I'm guessing that mold is also in the roof because there was a moldy odor in the apartment that I could not get rid of no matter how much I cleaned. The neighbors below me smoked weed, and when I reported this they acted like they didn't even care. This place is disgusting and unkempt. Do not stay here!

name: joseph macharia
text: Had a couple of stuffs that needed repair, stuck doors,clogged sink and bathroom,AC problem etc...in my apt.Right after I reported Jose Garcia maintanance guy showed up did a very good job and within a short time everything was fixed and was back to normal.Thank you.

name: Morris Lane
text: How can you run a  apartment complex with no washer and dryer for your tenets to use. If I stay in a apartment where there is no washer or dryer connection and I want to go wash my clothes they don't work. They put in all this time to make sure the landscaping is up to part lol but you can't fix the washers. Then they lock you into this conserving bill that they clearly told me before I moved in that I had the "option" of enrolling in this package that was going to only be $150.00 a month lol, "lie" because every month it's different.

name: Kia Lavender
text: All I can say is this apartment complex is horrible. Stay far away from it, do not rent here management is a joke. They don't answer phone calls, they don't return phone calls you have to go by there to get a response. Nasty neighbors who throw trash every where but in the garbage. Mold that they paint over and it's still visible. Apartment has unpleasant smells like mildew. Neighbors are loud and when you complain nothing gets done. The walk way is disgusting where the valet trash is being dragged instead of picked up daily .I would not recommend to my worst enemy you will have problem after problem and nothing will ever get resolved. They need to fire everybody in the office and get a real management company!!

name: Ashley Furr
text: Love my apartment, love the staff. Just wish they were there when they say theyd be there. Or have buisness hours posted. And be there when they tell you a time to meet them back. 4 seperate parties waited outside the office this morning. A staff member told one party to be there at 10am. Alsmost 1030 rolls around and everybody leaves.

name: caitlyn hampton
text: This is my first apartment me and my boyfriend hate it here we have only been here for a week we got our apartment changed a day before move in we had to change the address on everything we were not able to see the apartment until we moved in. The place was filthy when we moved in and it’s filled with roaches!!!!! I just woke up to a roach crawling on me in my bed I can’t believe this is where I have to stay for a year. There is a big hole in the wall in the bathroom that has not been fixed. Pest control came once and it did nothing.

name: American Patriot
text: I've lived here much longer than I should have or planned on. This place sux. It's quickly becoming the ghetto of Hoover. Trash all over the complex left by idiot tenants who have no pride in where they live. Loud music at all hours of the night and day by idiots who have no respect for their neighbor's. There have been issues with my apt since I moved in and when I've tried to have them fixed it has literally taken weeks, sometimes months, to be repaired. They've gone up on my lease. The conservice (a joke of a utilities package) and valet trash suck. The pool always has some issue where it's closed. For your own sake please don't ever even consider living here.

name: David Massengale
text: Very reasonable rent, cable included! Management always addressed concerns, and were very helpful, especially Tammy!!

name: Annie Hawkins
text: The Park @ Deerfield is one of the worst apartment complex ever!!! I moved in on May 2017, But in June the unit above me had a CrAzY leak for 3 days, maintenance did absolutely nothing. That leak damaged my cabinets and flooded the floors which caused the walls to swell, mildew, and rotten. I reported this issue almost every other day, I sent pictures of the damage to Mrs. Tammy Lane which is the property manager and nothing was still done. It took literally 8mths for them to repair and paint my cabinets after calling corporate over & over, getting on their nerves. My lease is about to end in 3mths and I had to go 8mth without utilizing 3 large kitchen cabinets because they didnt care to do their job. I had to find other ways to store my dishes and etc. The old saying is "You pay for what you get" so please explain why I pay $950 every month on time, and couldnt even get that issue taken care of in a timely manner. On top of that their is always trash all over the ground, my children have to constantly clean up our breezeway because the tenents have no pride in the area where they reside. And they allow their animal to poop everywhere, even on the sidewalks. Kids can't even play at the playground w/o stepping in dog s**t. I honestly feel that these apartments are entirely too expensive to have poor upkeep and they never compensate you for any inconvenience on their behalf... Really!!! RUN RUN RUN!!! Save yourself the mental anguish and frustration...

name: Linda Laffitte
text: Management at these apartments cannot be humans.  You pay to rent an apartment here and the apartment on top of yours bathroom floods and raw sewage come through your ceiling the light, bathtub, walls and floor is full of feces. They sent someone a day later to use a water hose  to wash out the tub. What about the smell and unhealthy that is? The renter that apartment flooded left.. I talked to management guess what she said "I have been renting apartment for 25 yrs and stuff like this happens when you rent an apartment on the first floor". Thank you God for phone with cameras  and recorders.  Management needs much Prayer and I did tell God all about it.

name: Mohammed Obaid
text: I've been living here for about a year and a half. It's a 2bd1bth, I pay $765 for rent and the utilities package that they said was "optional" is around $240. They are now increasing my rent while leasing the same apartment for $690, how is that fair?

name: Change is Good
text:
1st - I have nasty nasty neighbors who think they live in the projects where leaving your trash everywhere is acceptable.  There is no street lighting at night so you can't even see to back in a parking space. Water pressure sucks in master bath and bugs (who don't pay rent so why should they be able to live with me for free) coming in and out of holes left by the inadequate maintenance staff.
Sorry trash valet pick up causes more problems than they know, bambi running through the parking lots (which I kinda like) and please please CUT DOWN THAT DANG BUSH AT THE FRONT ENTRANCE!!! If I get hit by oncoming traffic trust you will be apart of my lawsuit for allowing an intentional hazardous overgrown bush blocking drivers vision of street/traffic.

name: Andrea Payne
text: 2nd night that I get off to come home to a completely dark breeze way. I hope and pray that my family, my neighbors and I don't injure ourselves in the dark. Btw, there are stairs that we can't see. Maintenence request submitted over the phone recoding last night when i realized that the resident portal no longer allows for request to be submitted online.

name: Tremaine Sudduth
text: There was water damage I'm my whole apartment and had a bad slug infestation and fruit flies and it smell like a wet basement and mold. This place is horrible and the lease office doesn't even answer the  phone at all. I wouldn't recommend these apartments to anyone.

name: Anthony Welshans
text: Since the buy out they have removed all lines of communication.  No website,  no phone number that anyone answers. Literally sitting in my bathroom watching water come on from the ceiling and have no way to get ahold of any maintenence.  At least before the buy out there was a 24 hour hotline it could connect you to.

name: Kendy Morales
text: Terrible the place had dead bugs and the floor had old paint

name: Michael REALTOR
text: Mold in a clients unit which was not remediated properly. Very poorly run complex with no care of the people who live in building. Major mold is not something you can just ignore and cover up.

name: Jason Lamay
text: The most unprofessional business I've ever come across. No communication even if you go to the office in person.

name: mercedee gulley
text:
This apartment sucked!! it rained inside of my apartment, then it formed
mold,.. and they did not do anything about it

Not to mention, the area was full of leaves and trash when I moved in. There needs to be better communication between the landlords, so this problem does not happen. I will say the representative I spoke with was always professional and pleasant. However, it is extremely frustrating to be charged for something you were explicitly told did not have to be cleaned.

Ms. Williams.

Thank you for your review.  With your rental application you recently authorized Watts Realty to obtain an investigative consumer report from AppFolio, Inc., who provided us with the information regarding your credit history.  Because of privacy laws we cannot discuss in detail regarding your complaint in a public forum. However, you will be receiving a letter in the mail regarding this decision and contact information for the reporting agency.  You have the right to obtain a free copy of the report if you submit a written request to AppFolio, Inc. no later than 60 days after you receive the notice in the mail.  If you do not receive the letter providing you with the information indicated, please contact our office direct.

resp.text: Free Forme, thank you for your comment. Our company takes allegations of this nature very seriously. We provide equal housing opportunities to all people, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status, national origin, sexual orientation or gender identity. Our staff are trained to be responsive to our callers at all times. Very rarely, a caller becomes verbally abusive. If this happens, our staff are empowered to warn the caller about any abusive language used before disconnecting the call. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

text: I do not recommend this place at all scam artist to the max I done contacted this office soo many times about so many issues done had they contractor come take pictures of mold in my house bees nests etc none has been done son got stung he’s highly allergic that’s when they finally came to do something I have this huge while in my ceiling from the rain owner is trying to swap the dates and lie about a bunch of stuff even though there been paper trails witnesses etc etc place is just something else so I’ve been paying rent for a place i can’t even stay at smh management should be ashamed of themselves

name: Hollie Deaver
text: I submitted an inquiry email last week for an online listing at 5:30am. I received a response from each of the employees I emailed. The first response at 8:34am, and the second response came before noon. The experience I've had is flawless. Kaitlin and Michael are both extremely professional, viewing the unit was completely hassle-free, and every step in the application process has been clear. I highly recommend Watts Realty to friends, family, coworkers, and the public.

name: Xuan Huang
text:
We highly recommend Watts Realty Company.

Mr David Watts was our agent when we started to search for commercial property in downtown Birmingham. We were extremely picky in what we want, and because this was our first real estate investment, we were extremely cautious - for every property that interested us, we made multiple visits. In other words, David was not having an easy job being our agent, however, he showed great patience and understanding toward us. As the first-timers, we had A LOT of questions about properties, inspections, regulations, property management, etc, and David Watts always gave us satisfactory answers or referred us to other professionals. He assisted us in every step and met with us as soon as we sent in requests. With David's help, we found and purchased a property we loved, and it may not have happened if we worked with someone else.

Last but least, we are thankful the the entire Watts company crew who helped us arrange the meetings, look up some paperwork, buy the insurance, etc. We highly recommend Watts company and we are thankful that David was our agent.
