text: Even after dealing with predatory management in the Tuscaloosa student housing scene for the last few years, the people at Watts Realty somehow managed to be even ruder and disrespectful than I could have imagined. It was nearly impossible to get into contact with a property manager while wanting to view an apartment (I called at minimum of 10 times and was never able to get on the phone with her once). The receptionist(s) is rude as well and always tended to rush me off the phone. When I expressed interest in talking to a property manager to the receptionist, without fail, the excuse was either that the PM was either "not in yet" (at 11 A.M., sure), or "on the other line." I will never rent from these people. Check the other reviews if you want more horror stories.

name: Cynthia Wilson
text: I went down to the office at the end of March because the apartment i wanted was available April 1. I had already seen the apartments due to a recent tenant and I like what i seen so I  put in a application to the address 705 1st St. S  in titusville. I used my real name which is Cynthia Jenkins. The lady at the desk informed me that the apartment wasn't ready yet but I told her that was  aware and just putting in my application early so it could be processing because I had really needed the apartment. I put in my application that morning and around 3 the same day was denied the apartment by a lady in your office. She told me they would be sending me the papers why i was denied and never received them. Very poor customer service skills need a better staff I would recommend them to no one also was told to edit my review and did because apparently now i'm lieing on the company and don't know where i applied to. Just ridiculous

resp.text: Ms. Wilson (Jenkins), thank you for providing us with your "real name" so we can address this issue to you. Our application process usually takes approximately 48 hours to complete. As such, we do not deny applicants on the same day.  We mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application. That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report. You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great people, committed to doing a good job

name: Dawg Fan
text: On behalf of Bailer & Brock Investments, I would highly recommend Watts Realty. We are small company with several rental properties to supplement our professional income. Watts offers responsive, thoughtful, personalized (even for smaller clients), and wise advise to help protect our substantial investment. From natural disasters, to terrible tenants, to market knowledge, for almost 10  years, Watts had us covered.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Amanda Johnson
text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. Stuff that was not even in the lease. I figured keeping my deposit would be enough but no they want more money.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

name: Amber Lese
text: Never recieved callback for property management. Gave info to two different receptionists, both said they'd call me back....Still waiting....

text: Been renting from Watts since 2009. I appreciate the rapid response to necessary repairs.

text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

12/2020 update:  still love it here. Moved in 8/2020 and haven’t had a single problem besides tiny maintenance needs (expected with old buildings) and they are SO FAST to fix anything. Not sure I would rent from anyone else really. Rent from these people!!

8/2020 : This has been my first rental experience ever - and I’m SO happy we decided to go with Dwell. I have friends who use them as well and I have heard nothing but good news. Such a relief after touring multiple other properties in the area with no luck. They are super quick to try to resolve maintenance issues, they’ve even reached out to me to make sure things were resolved before I even had the chance to contact someone. We moved in 3 weeks ago and are so in love with the place. The entire process was pretty simple, our neighbors are great, the neighborhood is wonderful and really haven’t had any trouble with parking. And they’re pet friendly! I love coming home from work and seeing everyone’s cute puppies and cats lounging in the windows 🥰🥰

name: Benjamin Kidd
text: Dwell Properties is a rare gem in apartment leasing. The staff are quick to respond. The property and amenities are top notch and affordable. A+

name: Brandon
text:
I've lived at one of their apartments for 2.5 years, Joseph is great and always super accomodative and understanding. He actively took steps to get out of a contract with a terrible ISP during the first year of my stay,  very open to you making your apartment your own with aesthetic changes, and he is always very easy to get in touch with.

The apartments are great. They are older so expect higher utility bills and some noise, but they are kept in good shape and I've never had any problems that weren't immediately addressed. In these 2.5 years, I've also seen the fewest pests/bugs inside than anywhere else I've ever lived.

resp.text: Chris, while we’re glad you like the upgraded features our lofts offer, we’re sorry your experience hasn’t reflected our goal of 100% satisfaction. While many of our residents enjoy the close proximity to Birmingham’s nightlife, we understand ambient noise can be frustrating. We strive to ensure all potential residents understand there is a nightclub on our first floor and advertise its location on our website. We apologize if there was any miscommunication. We only offer tours inside our lofts during regular business hours but are always happy to answer any questions regarding our homes. We would like to improve your experience and invite you to email us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net at your earliest convenience.

text: I can get any information about this dwelling. The website is poorly documented. The telephone contact is a recorded machine. A visit to the place is a locked door.

We strive to provide swift communication to anyone interested in our loft apartments and apologize if you feel your needs are not being met. The contact us page of the website includes a convenient form where anyone can submit questions or request a tour. You’ll also find the hours of operation and office address, located at our sister community, Thomas Jefferson Tower. Voicemails are promptly returned, but the team is unable to reach out personally as you did not leave a message. Keeping our door locked is a feature provided for the peace-of-mind of our residents, but we happily schedule tours for anyone interested in one of our available apartments. We would be delighted to provide a tour if you reach out via the contact us form or through voicemail. You may also reach us by emailing goodallfixplaylease@spm.net or by visiting us on Facebook or Instagram.

text: Loud, hallways often smell like cigarette and cigar as people walk Inside with smokes lit up. Their response to Chris was bs. They NEVER said there was a nightclub and even said they NEVER had complaints about noise. There are residents who have been complaining for 3-4 years about it....

resp.text: Bill, while we appreciate your review, we’re disappointed your opinion is unfavorable. We are sorry if residents have had issues in the years prior to our current management, but they were not brought to our attention. We are always happy to address any report of unpleasant smells or noises for our residents. The two recent complaints of a smoky smell were addressed by our manager and found to be the result of a misdirected duct from another business in our building. This has since been resolved. We advertise the piano bar on the first floor on our website and have not attempted to be dishonest with any potential resident regarding their presence. As we do not have you listed as a current resident, we are unable to reach out to you personally. If you would like to discuss these issues further, please email us at GoodallFixplaylease@spm.net.

If you would like to see inside our lofts, please contact us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net or call at your convenience. We would love to show you the five-star lifestyle we provide at Fix Play Lofts!

We understand the importance of service with a smile and will pass along your kind compliments. Please feel free to reach out if there is anything you need!

name: Mat Boutin-Delisle
text: Worst apartment experience I've had. They will lie to you about everything and the bar underneath is so loud it's shaking the walls and floor.

resp.text: Mat, we’re sorry your lifestyle at our apartments hasn’t been enjoyable. Our goal is always your satisfaction, and we understand the importance of straightforward communication and a peaceful living environment. Our manager will be reaching out to you to better understand the issues you’ve encountered, and learn how we can improve your experience. If you would like to contact us, please email us at goodallfixplaylease@spm.net.

name: Scott Spearman
text:
I was offered a job and found out I was moving to Birmingham in November of last year. The problem was, I knew nothing of the "Magic City" or its neighborhoods. But on the same day I received the offer for the new job, I realized I needed to find a place, and fast. So I downloaded an apartment app and started searching. I had decided on one criteria. I wanted to walk to work.  That should be easy, I thought, there are a tone of loft apartments downtown. The problem is that the large majority of them were black boxes. To this day. I don't know how one would go about taking a look at and discovering availability on these lofts. Without being overly conspiratorial, I will say that to this day I have doubts about the ethics, motives and business practices of so many of these downtown apartments. I still don't know how to crack those black boxes. There was one huge exception. There was a company that managed a couple of downtown lofts that were located less than a five minute walk from my workplace. When I called them and left a message, they called me back in less than 5 minutes. So that same day, I arranged to meet with their guy, Andrew, who would show me some two-bedroom lofts available at both Goodall-Brown and Fix Play. I immediately fell in love with the 3rd floor loft that would become my home for the next year. I loved the rooftop lounge and the apartment's Modern Amenities with exposed brick, 14 ft ceilings with exposed pipes and ducts and beautiful original hardwood floors, as well as my favorite feature, "the stairs to nowhere", which became my meditation space, is all I needed to remind me I was not living in an apartment "complex". I was home.

I would be remiss if I didn't mention the fact that as someone with a less-than-perfect credit score, Goodall-Brown lofts management company, SPM, was great to work with to get my contract through and approved, as they provide options that most companies do not. They also offered me free rent for the remainder of the month, which I totally took advantage of.  In a few weeks I was moved

Although I am not a dog owner, I have really enjoyed getting to know my neighbors and their furry friends. They both, the neighbors and their pets, were amicable and friendly as we constantly ran into each other in the elevator.

I also think the  Goodall Brown Lofts are in the absolutely best location to make the most of downtown living in Birmingham. Within 1 block you can walk to El Barrio, Bamboo, Atomic Lounge and Collins bar. Heck, the Wine Loft is in the SAME BUILDING. Within 4 blocks you can add more than a dozen other fantastic bars and restaurants, like Queens Park, Paramount, East West, The Florentine, John's City Diner, The Essential, Pilcrow, Cayo Coco. I have drank or dines at every one of these places and have yet to be disappointed.

In regards to the management company, I'll never forget that time a few months that I accidentally dropped my keys down the door crack  of the elevator shaft. (Don't ask, but I could hear them banging all the way down to the first floor) Sheepishly I put in a maintenance request on the website and then followed up with a  phone call the next day. Only a day later, Paris, the delightful general manager for SPM, who is a busy lady responsible for a handful of properties, knocked on my door, my keys in hand. She had had to call the elevator company to retrieve them.  I asked her how much I owed her for that service. She waved my question away. "It's fine", she said. Needless to say, they are a responsive company when it comes to service calls

I decided in October that I wanted a bigger place and preferably a house. So I found the perfect place and have moved out of Goodall-Brown  as of early December. I know that it was the right decision for me, but that doesn't change the fact that I miss my beautiful loft and the fun of downtown living.

We know you had many choices when looking for your first home in The Magic City, and we couldn't be happier knowing you enjoyed your time with us. Our team would like to offer their sincere thanks for your kind words regarding their service. It is always our pleasure to provide prompt and meaningful assistance to our wonderful residents. We are often told our ideal location is a favorite feature and are delighted you found it convenient for work and play. Though we were sorry to see you go, we wish you the best with your new house! If you are ever looking to return to loft living, we would love to welcome you home. Please feel free to reach out anytime.

name: Jennifer Piatt
text: I'd give a negative star rating if the option was available! Customers beware!  EXIT realty in Gulf Shores is a JOKE!!! My husband and I rented a home for 1 year from them and the entire process was a nightmare.  The day we arrived our house was a disaster,  even though they were expecting us. There were paint cans every where,outlet covers were missing AND there were containers of rat poison sitting around. Needless to say we had to get a hotel the first night...fast forward to plumbing and HVAC issues that took a week each to get fixed until we moved out, no one showed up to do a walk through with us and then, a month after moving out, we were told they were keeping our deposit of $950 because of a couple crayon marks on the wall and 2 new toilet seats that had come unhinged...the moral of my story is they have poor customer service, they're dishonest and not dependable.  You have to follow up numerous times to get an issue resolved.  Judy who works there is rude and unprofessional. I was charged  $950 for literally a couple crayon marks, we don't live in poor conditions, it was normal marks from living in our home. I will never rent or purchase a home through EXIT realty again.

text: Love my home! This company was very helpful and never waisted my time.

name: Bryan Long
text: Highly reccomend! Friendly staff with knowledgeable, timely service.

name: Jeff Lean
text:
We were extremely disappointed in our experience with Exit Realty and agent Tommy Stanton.  Being a former Realtor myself in Tennessee, I'm aware of the responsibility an agent has to their client.  When we hired Mr. Stanton, we were pleased with his feedback and demeanor.  As time passed the feedback, both from his weekly calls stopping and the review emails from the property viewings, slowed down significantly, however we would still consider it satisfactory.  Throughout listing our property with Mr. Stanton, we provided him with all of the information he requested.  However, 36 hours from closing, we were told that we would have to pay our property pool assessment to the tune of $4700.  It was our understanding this would be assumed by the new buyers.  At first he said that he didn't want to go around and around if we told him or not (which we did upon hiring him), but he was aware of our other assessment, so the logic of knowing one but not the other makes no sense.  As I stated in an email to him, even if we pretend that we didn't pass along the information, he's presented himself as one of the most knowledgable and successful agents in the area with lot of experience at the Gulf Shores Plantation.  How would an expert agent who does business there all the time, not be aware to ask about an assessment that began a year and a half ago, which all units there had.  He then proceeded to tell us that he checked on it and the assessment was non-transferrable and could not be assumed by the buyer, which we double checked with our HOA and that was untrue.  We had to pay it because our agent didn't negotiate that on our behalf in the contract.  We gave him a grace period to do something to make it right and were basically told that it just was what it was.  Instead, Mr. Stanton tried to force the situation/closing like everything was common practice.  Had any effort been shown to correct this or any financial responsibility whatsoever been taken, we absolutely wouldn't have posted reviews on every website we could.  As we indicated to the company before closing, with this not happening, we felt like we needed to let our HOA, others rental services and the general public know our experience with Mr. Stanton and Exit Realty.

One of their brokers/owners stepped in to call us to see what could be done and apologized repeatedly, saying he believed it was an honest mistake and that it has changed how they will do things in the future.  He said on all future transactions, they will have a disclosure form for things like assessments.  First, I am shocked that's not already common practice as I know in Tennessee everything has a disclosure.  Second, I am glad that this error may have changed how Exit Realty does business, but it was at $4700 of my expense.  We hope this helps anyone who is looking to list or buy in the future and will assist you in assuring the same thing doesn't happen to anyone else

name: Warren Helmer
text: I live 5 1/2 hours from Gulf Shores. A Realtor that I work with in Mobile referred Janise Brocks. I called her on a Wednesday night, and she said that she could show me condos on Saturday. I drove down early Saturday morning, and she spent that day driving me around Gulf Shores.  I was able to find an investment property that day, and bought it.  Needing a property manager, she introduced me to Cindy Burns who is also a member of Exit Realty, and our relationship has been stellar. I ask a lot of  Cindy, and she is incredible. Tenants love the condo, but rave over Cindy's customer service. I could write a book about how happy I am with Janise Brocks and Cindy Burns and the remarkable customer Service they provide. All of my future real estate dealings in Gulf Shores will be with them.

text: I wish no stars were an option in rating this team. I am highly disappointed in this real estate firm. We were left to look at homes on our own. No mind you, I am coming from out of town (military family) I had to pay for a road trip, hotel stay, and dog kenneling. Lastly, I called because there was a home we wanted to rent came from that firm. My phone call was ignored guess they knew my zip code; therefore, I called from my husband's phone (different zip code) and to my surprise they answered that phone call. As mentioned before, I am highly disappointed. As Veterans in our Veterans day month to not be taken seriously is extremely unprofessional.

text: Our house has been destroyed under the (mis)management of this company twice. 2018 we paid $35,000 to repair damages and now, in 2020, it will cost another $5,000-$6,000. This does not include the months of rent we are owed. The "manager" has never checked on the home nor have the attempted to collect past due rents. The house, which was 2 years old when we turned it over to them is now dilapidated and infested with mice and roaches. The head of the agency is shady and refuses to accept responsibility for his neglect as the person being paid to manage the property. The neighbor's dog could have done a better job of managing my house and I regret ever entrusting our home to this agency.

text: I have mostly good things to say about Tapestry after having stayed here for almost 2 years now. It's safe, the staff is prompt and accommodating, and I have had no issues with loud neighbors. I dread having things delivered because I know the drivers will be lost when they try to find my apartment, assuming they even make it through the gates. So that's why I am giving 3 stars. If you are considering moving here and you get a lot of stuff delivered, please take this into consideration, or better yet, swing by and see for yourself how confusing this place is.

text: lived here for 2 years. this is NOT a gated community, has closed gates maybe for 2 days because it takes months to fix it? unsafe area, multiple cars broken into (I should have read the reviews before). no sense of security at all my entire lease. pool is rarely cleaned, has been green for the past week...it's the middle of July we would want to use it. way too overpriced for not even getting all the amenities. be careful here. And in response to Tapestry who left the message underneath my review... I’ve already contacted your office and the person that I spoke with (I won’t disclose her name because it’s not her fault ) basically said there’s nothing that can be done because the person who gave me this info doesn’t work there anymore but I have a paper with all the information this person gave me and it mention nothing about the $20 fee for trash only the $30 fee for valet.
