name: Annabelle DeCamillis
text:
Every unit has different prices, and each year they’d raise our unit up by at least $100 a month, even after we switched units to avoid the raise. While they look like pretty luxury apartments, everything is very cheaply made. We had 2 doorknobs completely fall off in both units. In the second unit we lived in, the doorknob to the bedroom was already hanging off completely. Maintenance isn’t great. While they’re nice, they don’t actually fix anything until they have to. We had the heat and AC break at least 12 times before they finally replaced a part to actually fix it. Often in 90-100 degree weather when we were trying to work from home.

The management had maintenance keep up the grounds to an annoying and unnecessary degree. Ive been power washed when stepping out of my front porch. The halls reek of gasoline once a week so bad it comes in the apartment bc they leaf blow constantly. They are obsessed with keeping up appearances but don’t actually fix the important things.

The gates worked ONE day in the 2 years I lived there, no joke. We chose that place because it was a gated community. It is not a gated community, and it is not safe. There were constant break-ins in cars and apartments. One car was set fire and literally reduced to ash. The management would do nothing. No security, no cameras, no gates. They would however send an email every once in a while explaining that they aren’t liable for breaks ins and they keep up “certain security measures.” And that any breaks ins are our responsibility? Also there are no security measures, as I stated. They also are terrible at managing packages and deliveries.

They charge you $25 a month for valet trash, but they only take one bag and often skip MANY days, and the dumpster is usually full. So we’ll get an email saying “don’t leave your trash outside the door, the dumpster is full and valet isn’t coming.” so we’re expected to keep bags of trash inside for days? No one would, of course.

They don’t let dogs off leash and yet put tons of large obstacle course things in the one, TINY area for dogs. So now dogs can’t even run around in there. No one’s dogs would do obstacles of course, so no one goes to the “park” (tiny fenced in area) anymore. There’s no nearby roads good to walk dogs.

Neighbors are mostly med students living of their parents money. Seriously. Everyone drives very VERY fast through the property, even though there’s always someone walking their dog. People tail you like crazy, everyone’s just pretty rude. I’ve also seen a couple of med students just swing their car door open and hit the car next to them without caring. It’s a pretty stuck up community.

Oh, and there’s hardly ever available parking. The lot is almost always full when you come home at night. Very hard to find parking.

The management is not helpful at all. While they are friendly, it’s absolutely a front. If you ask for help, they suddenly become cold and unreasonable. Very two-faced. They just don’t care and are actually pretty rude if you ask for ANY help.

Definitely the worst management I've ever dealt with. And this was supposedly the fanciest place I've lived. Not worth it. Not safe, just exhausting.

resp.text:
Hi Annabelle,
Thank you for your review.  I am so sorry that we did not live up to your expectations. We strive to provide everyone a positive experience, We would love to talk with your about your concerns.  We invite you to call us at 205-599-5599.  Thank you again.

name: Tristen Finch
text: nice grounds with  fast acting staff.

resp.text: Thank you for your 5 star review!  Our team is happy to take care of our residents and provide a great place to call home!  Thank you again!

name: Jaye Hughes
text: Loved living here at Tapestry Park! It was very painful saying goodbye. The office staff and maintenance team were absolutely amazing which made me enjoy my living experience here even more! Forever in my heart!

resp.text: Thank you, Jaye, for your kind review we truly appreciate it!  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your experience and hated to see you go!  We hope that you will keep us in mind if you should need an apartment in the future! Thank you again! Lisa A.

name: Daniel Brake
text: My wife and I have lived at Tapestry Park for almost two years now and have had a great experience. We have lived in two different units during our time here and have loved both of them. The staff at Tapestry is incredibly helpful and have addressed any maintenance issues quickly and graciously. I have recommended Tapestry Park to several friends and will continue to do so!

resp.text: Hi Daniel,  Thank you for the review! We are so pleased that you are loving your home!  If there is anything we can do, please do not hesitate to let us know!  Thank you for recommending us to your friends.  Best, Lisa A

name: Roy ORR
text: Nice apartments.

name: Scott Fayard
text: Modern look, upscale! Good location

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! Please let us know if we can help with anything in the future.

name: Kristian Cottle
text: Currently live here and my roommates visiting friend had her car broken into and my bf had his car broken into and stuff stolen. So much for a gated community. Def can’t wait to move out of this overly priced, no security guard, rude neighbors, apartment complex!

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  I am so sorry that happened.  Please contact the office at 205-599-5599 to discuss.  Thank you, Lisa A

name: William Standeffer III
text: My wife and I moved to Tapestry 4 weeks ago and are loving it! The leasing staff has done a great job helping us get settled into our apartment. They were a huge help answering all of our questions regarding available apartments before we signed our lease. Highly recommend!

resp.text:
Hi William,
Thank you for your kind review!  We are so happy that you and your wife are loving your new apartment!  We are excited to have you as part of our community!  Please know that our staff is here to help you have the best living experience possible.
Kind regards,
Lisa A.

name: David Ullman
text:
I've lived here 4 years.

Pros:
1)Excellent location if you work at UAB

Cons :
1) Overpriced
2) Break ins

In an attempt to fix Con #2 the gates have been "fixed". As outlined in the attached diagram. My advice, if you do move into these apartments do not move into the apartments in the back. Unless you enjoy driving lengthening your commute by 5 minutes driving in a circle.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review.  We apologize that you have had problems with the gates.  We will be opening the front gates during high traffic times to lessen any backups.  If you have any additional concerns, please do not hesitate to stop by the office.
Thank you again,
Lisa, Community Manager

name: Danice Carlisle
text: I recently renewed my lease for the third time. I can’t say enough positive things about my experience with the leasing manager, Lisa, and her staff. The maintenance department is always willing to go the extra mile to accommodate me. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained and I most definitely enjoy the salt water pools and the gym.

resp.text:
Thank you for your kind review!  Our residents make our community a wonderful place to call home.  We are committed to providing the best experience possible. Thank you for continuing to be part of our community!
Lisa A.

name: Macy Spry
text: We have lived here for almost three years and the gates have only ever been closed for about 3 days. Apartments have been broken into as well as multiple cars broken into, but have seen no progress on the gates. Pools are great and well maintained; however, these gates have also been broken for multiple summers leading to the pools becoming very overcrowded with people who do not live in the complex. Great location and large apartment with responsive maintenance staff, but you could probably find something better for the price given all of the property issues

resp.text: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback.  You are right, we have a great location and team.  We have had some issues with the gates.  We have some exciting changes coming in the next few weeks!  We are adding barrier arms in addition to the gates.  Please stay tuned to the community emails that we will be sending out with details.  If there is anything that I can assist you with, please know my door is always open.  Thank you again, Lisa A.

name: Kayla VanEtten
text: My best friend has lived in an upper level apartment here for about 5 years or more. Really nice gated community. The apartment has a great balcony overlooking some woods and two awesome spa type bathtubs. Nice sized kitchen and the bedrooms and closets are big. Also has a great outdoor pool area in walking distance. However sometimes finding a parking spot at the apartments is a problem and the three flights of stairs are less than convient when you have anything to carry especially if you had to park far away. But other than that no complaints it's beautiful every time I visit her.

resp.text: Hi Kayla, thank you for your review! You are right, our apartment homes are nicely appointed with very spacious rooms and the spa bathtubs are amazing. Our salt water pool is centrally located in the community.  Friends make the best neighbors!  We would love to have you as a part of our community as well.  I invite you to stop by the office for a tour! Thank you again, Lisa

name: Michael Pitt
text: After living here at Tapestry for almost 4 years I would absolutely recommend living here. The staff are always professional, friendly and on the ball. Maintenance request are taken care of within 24-48 hours almost every time we've needed something fixed or looked at. They're very good about following up on issues and letting you know the status of whats going on. The office staff are always empathetic to your situation and generally will immediately act on your issue. All maintenance staff are polite, professional and honest. The complex is full of greenery and always kept up by either the maintenance staff or the landscaping crew. We've also been very lucky with having respectful and polite neighbors.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review! We are thankful to have you as a part of our community and are pleased that you love your home! Our team strives to provide the best service for all of our residents. We want to make sure everyone has a positive experience while residing at Tapestry Park. Thank you again for taking the time to review our community!

name: Slade Methvin
text: Great place to live! The rooms are spacious and well designed. The staff is great and very helpful with anything you need. Location is awesome too.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review! We are so pleased that you are enjoying your new home! Our staff is committed to providing the best experience possible for our residents.  You are right, our location is awesome! Thank you again!
Lisa A.

name: Maria Gramma
text: I have lived at The Tapestry for almost three years. My first comment would be...there is no place perfect...but...The Tapestry is as close to perfect as you will get. And, I have had an opportunity to review all the comments; and, I totally disagree with negative reflections regarding The Tapestry. As I said, nothing and nowhere is perfect but I can say to all that it is a pleasure to call The Tapestry my home! I commend the entire staff; as well, as a HUGH SHOUT OUT, for the maintenance team. They do an outstanding job to exceed every expectation to keep things working for all of us...they are always on! They make a commitment to fix something; they keep me updated and follow through to make sure all is done to meet my satisfaction. The Tapestry is a very welcoming community and I look forward to each day as I call this my home! I hope you can too!

resp.text: Hi Maria, Thank you for your 5 star review!  We strive to provide a positive experience and are so pleased that you are proud to call Tapestry Park home! We hope that you will continue to be a part of our community for a long time to come. Thank you again!

name: Edwina Farrow
text: I have had a great experience so far, been here just over a month and love it here! Much better than my previous apartment complex in Inverness!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Tapestry Park. We are so happy you love it here! Please reach out if we can help with anything at all. You can reach our office at 205-599-5599.

name: Emily Vansandt
text: my sister lives here and got her package stolen from the front door along with many other people’s packages, while the management watched the man steal them/was aware of what the man was doing. Also, they do not keep the gates closed like they should to prevent this. Poor management

resp.text:
Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback.  Our team filed a report with the police department regarding the packages.  All package delivery services have been notified and arrangements have been made. If you have any further questions, I invite you to contact our office.  Thank you again.
Lisa A.

name: Jesse Nagy
text: Always loud neighbors above. Paper thin walls and ceiling offer no rest for the weary. I would aside from issues independently mine, not a bad place, I wouldn't rely on the trash pickup or going to bed before the zoo above.

resp.text:
Hi Jesse,
Thank you for your review. We would love to speak with you directly regarding any concerns you may have. Please stop by the office and let us know what we can assist you with.  We are happy to help.  Thank you again.
Lisa A.

name: Richard Crum
text: I'd give zero stars if I could. This place was absolutely horrible. Don't believe the advertised prices and don't believe that this is a gated community. I lived there for 13 months and the gates worked for a grand total of 2 weeks. The gym is not maintained and they only clean common areas once a year. They also horde packages in the front off where you can only pick them up during their tiny windows of working hours. These are only the most frustrating items, there are tons more reasons to look elsewhere.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Tapestry Park. We are sorry to hear your experience was not positive. We value feedback and are always looking to improve our service. Please reach out at your earliest opportunity, you can reach us at 205-599-5599. Again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to speak with you soon.

name: John
text: Nice place

resp.text: Hi John, thank you for your 5 star review.  We are so pleased that you enjoy your home here at Tapestry Park!  Thanks again!

name: Hailey P
text: literally the worst management. takes a week for a simple work order to be noticed and still not complete. called front office and rude staff just hangs up after saying they'll look into it. its been another week and no progress. ALSO rates for the same floor plan WILL change and even be $300 cheaper every MONTH for another identical unit. huge scam. apartments are huge though but definitely not as advertised. elevators are not even in the apartment buildings for example. unless you sign for the cheapest rates, this place is not worth the hassle.

resp.text:
Hi Hailey, thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear your experience has been less than exceptional. In regard to the pricing, our prices change everyday based upon the market, and the availability. We have one building that has an elevator, because it is four stories.  We apologize for the issue with your service request.  No one on staff should ever be rude, I am very sorry for that happening and will address it with the staff. If you would please contact me at the office so we can discuss this further, it would be greatly appreciated.   Thank you again for your review.
Kind regards,
Lisa A.
Community Manager

name: Deborah Austin
text:
Beautiful apartment! Tall ceilings, large porch, easy parking, convenient location, trash pickup- love it!

The staff are so friendly and quick to respond, very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our community! We are so pleased that you are loving your new home and are thrilled to have you as part of our community. Please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do to further better your experience here at Tapestry Park.

name: Justin Lucas
text:
I submitted an application 2 weeks ago and have yet to hear back. The first money order was lost and even though I sent a photo of the receipt, it still hasn't been found. I then mailed another money order. Guess what? Wasn't found!!! It was delivered by certified mail and shows delivered. I'm now out of $100 and still no word. I haven't received a reply to emails or a call back. I've sent Lydia and Jessica over 6 emails. Not one word.

I'm sure management is unaware of these issues and I still want to live at Tapestry Park, but I think the office staff definitely needs approving.

name: Tommy Townsend
text: These apartments are super nice on the inside, kitchen islands, laundry rooms, his and her sinks. No idea how much it costs, but money being no factor I'd want to live here

resp.text:
Hi Tommy,
Thank you for your kind review!  We would love to have you as part of our community!  Please come out for a tour to find out more information.  We look forward to hearing from you soon! Thanks again!
Lisa A.

name: SeantheSwede
text: Great staff and apartments but very pricey. Would recommend.

resp.text:
Hi Sean, Thank you for your recommendation!  We do have great community and staff!    The best part is our residents, they are who make the community feel like home!  All the best,
Lisa A.

name: Corey DeLoach
text: Good luck getting an appointment at this place EVEN IF you’ve booked an appointment. We setup an appointment and were never seen. In fact, people cane in after us and were seen before we were. Not impressed.

name: L Johnson
text: Great location, beautiful apartments, maintenance is quick to respond to work orders, and the staff are nice and friendly.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review!  We really appreciate your kind feedback. We strive for everyone to have a positive experience and are so pleased that you are loving your home!
Kind regards,
Lisa A.

name: Haley Walters
text:
UPDATE: lived here for so long and can't remember when the gates actually work... so much for safety. building next to us literally got broken in and had tv stolen. hallways are gross from spilled trash stains = bugs... needs a pressure washing asap. beware of loud dogs living near you as well. gym could use more equipment its tiny. at least the apartments are a little more on the modern side
UPDATE - it is now november.... therefore way past summer, management still has not taken care of the problem with washing breezeways. gates are not closed, not our problem if they cannot handle outside issues, just would like the slightest bit of consistent safety for once

resp.text:
Thank you for your review.  We apologize that your experience has been less than exceptional. We are working to have the gates up soon and for solutions to help prevent them from being hit as often.  Now that summer is slowing down we will be pressure washing all the breezeways. I invite you to stop by the office to discuss any other issues.  Thank you again for your review.
Lisa A.

name: Kadykooo
text: I recently went on a tour at Tapestry Park since I have been thinking of moving locations in Birmingham. I was blown away by all the 5 star amenities and the central location of the apartment complex...not to mention the absolutely apartments are STUNNING. Would highly recommend

name: Ashley Dixon
text: The site is amazing, the area is also. The hospital is across the street, which I love. I just recently contacted them today about leasing information via internet (inquiry) and I am currently waiting on a response. I can't wait to hear from them...

name: Jessica Pickering
text: I was SO sad to leave these apartments! They were the nicest place I’ve ever lived and I would move back in a heartbeat if I ever relocate back to Birmingham. The office and maintenance staff is PHENOMENAL! If there are any issues they try their best to have them addressed and fixed as soon as possible. The location is amazing as well! You are just close enough to downtown to enjoy the perks of being 10 minutes from anything you could want, BUT you don’t pay a downtown price! It’s the best! An Uber ride is only about $8-$10 to downtown, Avondale, Lakeview, etc. It’s wonderful! You won’t regret living here!

resp.text:
Hi Jessica,
Thank you for your very kind review!  We have a great community that is very centrally located, especially to the downtown area!  The Tapestry Park Team is always happy to assist our residents to provide the best experience possible.  We wish you all the best with your future endeavors and hope that you will continue to consider our community if you ever move back to the area.   Thank you again!
Lisa A.

name: Ellen Davis
text: DON'T LIVE HERE! There are so many problems with this complex. Maintenance takes weeks to respond to requests, they charge you for trash pickup, but they never pick up trash, there are extreme mold and bug problems, and there is literally dog poop everywhere. Don't expect your packages to ever get to you. I've had 3 packages stolen in the past 2 months. Front office wont do anything about it. This is the WORST apartment complex i've ever lived in. STAY AWAY!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any issues you have been experiencing. We invite you to stop by the office so we can discuss and address any concerns with you. Our office is open 7 days a week for your convenience. We strive to provide a positive living experience for all our residents and are available to help in any way possible. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you again.

name: Johnathon Palomarez
text:
I am a new resident to Tapestry Park, and I love it here! The staff they have on hand at the office have been really easy to work with, and friendly. The maintenance staff will get the job done in a reasonable about of time and make sure that you are completely satisfied.

The apartments themselves are great, I love the location being minutes away from downtown Birmingham. It is also quite peaceful, I feel like I’m the one making all the noise when I am at home watching Netflix and my TV’s volume is on 10…

Overall, I would say that choosing to live at Tapestry Park has been one of the best decisions I’ve made in 2017 thus far.

name: Ray Grossman
text:
Outstanding service, outstanding facilities, and altogether an extremely pleasant place to live.

The staff is extremely friendly and has resolved any maintenance issues as soon as they occurred, and the apartments themselves are extremely nice and fairly close to downtown.

name: Katherine Joyce
text: I absolutely love living here! Tareka is by far the best leasing consultant I have ever met and is always so professional. And the property manager Lisa? Hands down the sweetest thing! They are always so helpful and kind. I was a little nervous to tour such a nice place when we came to look at the apartment, but everyone's just so nice! The mailman, the maintanence guys, even the neighbors! I really love living here. I encourage anyone who's looking for a great place to live, with an awesome property, and super friendly staff, THIS IS THE PLACE!

name: Bella Davis
text: When will the breezeways be washed? SO many stains going up to my apartment and not fun seeing it right in front my door every time from previous owners (about a year ago). Will the gates ever be closed for more than a couple days out the year? Will the light fixtures be actually working when driving in at night? Slow management.

resp.text:
Hi Bella, thank you for your review.  We are going building by building to pressure wash all areas. We have some exciting changes that we will be making to the gates this year. We are hopeful that this will elevate some of the issues we have had.  I invite you to stop by the office so we can discuss how we can improve your experience. Thank you again.
Lisa A.

name: Elizabeth Garriga
text: If I could give Tapestry no stars I would. We had a mold issue that maintenance would not fully address, as well as pretending it wasn't mold. When we first stated this problem, Tapestry refused to acknowledge it, and before we left apparently half of the buildings had some form of this problem. Additionally, the lease terms are unreasonable. Rent increased at least $100 every year with no improvements in quality, and the termination fee clause makes it impossible to get out of your lease with out breaking the bank.

name: amanda lopez
text: yep read the reviews before signing a lease here. full of false promises and blaming corporation. ive already talked to management multiple times throughout my year of being here, don't have the time or patience for it again.

resp.text:
Hi Amanda, Thank you for your review.  I am so sorry you had a less than perfect experience with us, we strive for excellence in all that we do and we are so sorry to hear we have fallen short.  I would love the opportunity to chat with you about how we could have made your stay in your apartment home more pleasurable.  Please let me know how we can connect to discuss opportunities to improve our residents’ experience.
Lisa A.

name: Matt Taylor
text: We had a good time

resp.text: Hi Matt, thank you for your review!  We are glad that you enjoyed your time at Tapestry Park! Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you.  Best, Lisa A.

name: Bailey Covington
text: overpriced for what you get. the experience with them has been exactly how the other reviewers said, especially in regards to service. issues brought up to management just get delayed for months because their hands are tied? wish they cared more for their residents.

resp.text:
Hi Bailey.  Thank you for your review.  I apologize for any issues that you have had.  I invite you to stop by the office or contact me so we can discuss and resolve any issues.  We are happy to assist you and want to do all we can to improve your experience.
Lisa A.

name: Robert Daniel
text: I moved in about a year ago. Best apartments I have ever lived in. Maintenance guys are friendly and knowledgeable. The office staff is always super polite. Lots of pretty people live here. Lol. The best is our leasing agent Tareka. I vote her to be the Employee of the Year!!!! Also Ms. Lisa the property manager has helped me get some things fixed that I could not fix myself(i.e. my crazy water bill).Thanks so much Tareka and Lisa. Yall help to make this a great place to live!

name: James Baker
text:
If you're looking for an apartment complex that operates like you expect one to operate, this is the is the one.
Of all the apartments I've lived in across Ga and Al this is by far the best. We've had an ac problem once but it was fixed immediately. They even replace light bulbs when they go out - within the hour most times. The maintenance staff is always available and always doing great work post haste. Many apts that say they do things like this but never actually do them or at least not in a resonable amount of time.
Tareka was our leasing consultant and has been awesome from day one. She has been helpful with all questions or concerns and has always conducted herself very professionally, yet warmly.
We recently had a problem with our water bill where we were being incorrectly charged for 4k gallons in a single day. Lisa the property manager stepped in and got the previously unhelpful company to correct the error. This is after we were told that they could not be wrong multiple times and ways.
The entire staff here has been overwelmingly great. Some very good descisions were made in the hiring of these folks. They do an exceptional job in the managment of this property.

Now, hit the call button, ask for Tareka and set an appointment today.

Thanks- from one happy tenant.

name: Nick L
text: Great place. Really friendly

name: evelyn kelley
text: I'm excited about the outside and from the photos that was shown I Love them. I need some prices

resp.text: We would love take you on a tour of the property. Please call the office at (205) 599-5599 to set up a time that is convenient for you. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

name: Hettie Yarbrough
text: I like to live there!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so pleased that you are enjoying your home. If there is anything we can do, please do not hesitate to let us know. Thank you again!

name: Ramiro Monrroy
text:
(Translated by Google) Excellent place

(Original)
Exelente lugar

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your positive feedback. Please reach out if we can help with anything in the future.

name: Vladimir Jefferson
text: Work with Michelle Baker in Huntsville, she’s awesome. Super responsive, fast and handles everything you’d want a PM to take care of seamlessly. Could not be more pleased!

name: Jamaine Williams
text:
AHI properties has great service and responds very quickly. I would recommend this company to anyone looking for a property manager. Astria , Tim and Philip will go over and above the call of duty to assist you in any way.

JJ Williams

name: Lindy McCullers Carmichael
text: We lived in our rental for two years. We signed contracts to move in early November for a move in date of mid December. When we got our keys the house wasn’t cleaned, gross utensils, cups and dishes were still in the cabinets and dishwasher. The walls were disgusting and had stains all over them. We had to cancel our movers and push them a week, and extend our other rental a week longer to clean the house so it was move in ready. There were numerous issues with broken cabinets, doors not closing properly, door knobs being broken, basement flooding twice and all requests were ignored, or we had to submit multiple times these issues to get fixed before a response or it took weeks for someone to come out and just look at it (never actually fixing it). Fast forward 2 years to move out time and not getting our deposit back because they charged us to fix the things WE REQUESTED to be addressed. We also are being charged to repaint the whole house when it was never painted for us to move in and was disgusting already from previous tenant. Another ridiculous charge was for not pressure washing the front side walk. If we knew that needed to be done we would have done it but NONE of these things were in our contract. I’ve worked in customer service for more than 20 years, and I’ve never worked with a company / persons as awful as AHI Properties. Do not rent from them and as a previous homeowner of a rental DO NOT use them as your management company. They will treat good tenants horribly and screw the homeowner over because tenants don’t want to deal with their BS.

name: Michael Allen
text: I’ve been at this property for only 3 months and I’ve had a terrible experience the maintenance manager Phillip is lazy and rude and tries to find everything he can not to do his job. My gas wasn’t on when I moved in and didn’t get turned on til about a week later. I told them my complaints over the phone and the things that needed to be fix and now they deny me telling them that but remembers me saying something about the gas not being on and then when I asked for a supervisor to talk to he refused to give me a way to contact them not all the employees are bad and some tried to help but this is the worst experience I’ve ever had renting

name: Patrick Fisher
text:
Well I am not yet a tenant. But I will be once everything is finalized, I just want to say AHI Properties is a amazing and wonderful company there response to my application and getting my approval to move in is amazingly  very quick. They are so polite and professional  I really  would recommend they services
Weather you a tenant  or investor.  Shout out to  Cheyenne Camacho & Kenna Eason for there fine work and diligence in getting  me and my family  and approval  for there beautiful home. I look forward  to long term relationship I will  have  with AHI Properties. And the whole team.
Thank you,
Everyone

name: John McDonald
text:
Rented from this company for 2 1/2 years. They’re terrible. They once called to tell me that they were calling the police if I didn’t lower the volume from my party. This was 3pm on a Saturday, and it was my 13 year old daughters birthday. She had a classical quartet playing because she is blind and enjoys Bach.

Asked the neighbors which one of them complained about the noise, and it was the guy two doors down who claims his “Third Reich memorabilia is just heritage, not hate”. He also rents from them and has a lower price than me per month, even though his house is more updated and more square footage. Nice to see the company favors him.

name: Jonathan Cook
text: Even as an employee at AHI I am shocked everyday at how our team is not only the most professional PM's in Birmingham, but also a truly caring group of individuals I am happy to call my friends.

name: Matt Rhodes
text: Never dealt with a worse company.  Very unprofessional and chauvinistic.  If this is how people want to do business, by all means, give them your money.  I’d rather deal with some rat infested all bills paid motel than go through the ringer with these clowns again.

name: Shea Edwards
text: The management is terrible. The staff are even worse. 1 star for the worst work environment that I've ever experienced.

name: L C
text: Horrible management company. communication / response to work orders go ignored. When it comes to move out and getting deposit back, they lie about items so they don’t have to pay you back. Overall horrible experience and don’t know how they’re still in business. Do not do business with them!!

name: The Overstreet’s
text: We rented from this company for 2 in a half years. They wanted us to pay for brand new painting of the home after leaving. This was not in the lease agreement and we had proof of before and after pictures. They took our deposit for paint damage that they claimed we caused. I do not recommend anyone to rent from them! They never gave us a call back only emailed us after we’ve sent numerous of emails to them( very unprofessional). The men that are over the maintaining of the home always had an attitude when I informed them of things that were messed up in this home. I reported a tree that had fallen down in the back on the fence to protect their property to send someone to remove it and his attitude was very nasty!  When we first got approved for the home in Hoover, only one lady was friendly ( Ashley) the property manager was not friendly at all. We are military and have rented several properties and have never had any problems until this company! We also own a home and would never want to get over on them but again they asked us to pay for something we didn’t do!

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had negative experience. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Customer service is a top priority to us and we apologize for any inconvenience or misunderstanding. From what I understand our team presented your security deposit dispute to the homeowner. They have declined to modify the disposition. They did want to offer some clarification. The charge for the labor was our minimum labor charge and includes the time to go and purchase the materials needed. The costs charged for materials are the actual costs we incur. A copy of the receipt was attached in the e-mail for the drip pans showing the cost and a picture of the stove with no drip pans. The light bulbs that were out were in the master bathroom.

The ceiling that was painted was the ceiling in the middle bedroom. It had a number of scuffs on the ceiling as well as ribbons stuck to the ceiling. When those ribbons were removed, it took paint off the ceiling. I’ve attached a picture of that as well.

The charge for painting was a prorated charge. The chart we use from the International Association of Certified Home Inspectors gives interior paint a 10 year life span. The house was painted 6 years ago. That would mean the damage cost 4 years of life of the paint. The total cost of the paint was previously discussed with you. We only charged you for the one ceiling with ribbons on it.

There was no charge for any cleaning or replacement of carpet or other flooring.

If you would like to discuss the issue please feel free to call us at 205-682-9106 and we will  provide you more information.

name: jimmy Martin
text:
AHI is a true team of professionals. I have two investment properties managed by AHI and the support has been exceptional.

Honored customer,

J. Martin

name: Matt E
text: Ahi is a well structured and mature property management company.  They have been very responsive to all my request and the requests of my tenant.  I would put them at the top of your list if you are considering hiring a property manager for your property.

resp.text: Thank you so much Matt for the awesome review! We truly appreciate you.

name: A CV
text: Worst place ever! Do not rent from them. Do not let them manage your company. Horrible to work with!!

name: Charles Doublet
text:
We have been so happy since we switched to AHI Properties.

Their thoroughness, professionalism, and proactive care has given us peace of mind.

resp.text: Thank you so much Charles for the awesome review! We truly appreciate your business.

name: chris phillips
text: Philip Barnes is by far hands down the most vigilant and attentive property manager I have ever worked with.

name: Adam Aldrich
text: A company that has lost it's way. We used AHI for 4 years to manage our home and were very happy with them for most of that time. Unfortunately the last year things have changed with them. They are mismanaged and don't care about their customers anymore. They take weeks to respond, they won't admit fault when they make mistakes and just pass the blame. We even talked to the President and he just kept trying to pass the buck. In the end we had to take over our housing project repairs ourselves to get anything done. I will never use AHI again to manage my properties and you shouldn't either.

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had a negative experience. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Customer service is a top priority to us. As the President of the company, I spent 30 minutes on the phone with Mrs. Aldrich talking about her concerns. I acknowledged that we failed in communications with you that did not live up to our expectations and I apologized for that.  I also addressed her concerns that the scope of work was not completed.  We did notify you on two different occasions by email that the quote did not include replacing the carpet on the stairs. I again apologized that our communication may not have been as clear and concise as it needed to be.  I found no written communication that they requested that he carpet be added.
During the call, I took full responsibility for our shortcomings.  We might not always agree but we do care about our customer's concerns.

name: Don Brannon
text: I couldn't be more pleased with how you taking .Thank you for the great job.

name: Jimmy Russell
text: Run if you see this name on your lease.

name: Altaf Afroze
text: Overall, AHI Properties has a very good team of professionals serving the client needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much Altaf! We truly appreciate your business.

name: Adam Aldrich
text: I’ve been using AHI for several years and really enjoyed working with them. They have a great team that quickly finds qualified renters for us. They handle all the details and stress that comes with owning rental properties and allow us to focus on other things. If you are looking for a company that cares and has good people that know what they are doing, then I would recommend taking a look at AHI.

resp.text: Thanks, Adam! We appreciate your kind words and positive review. We're delighted to work with you as well!

name: Keishawn Berry
text: Have not had any discrepancies since AHI have taken over the property currently being rented. Excellent customer service, Paige Sweeney have worked well and efficiently with me during personal issues/situations. Paige is definitely customer friendly and shows concern for others and their matters of importance.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback! We truly appreciate your business.

name: Bob Pace
text: AHI held our security deposit for almost 60 days but finally sent it ....as per our lease we were required to have the town home and carpets cleaned  including treatment for fleas ( we had a pet). We used the vendors recommended by AHI , presented receipts to AHI as proof that this was completed, but they still shorted our deposit for not cleaning the carpet? Have made inquires to AHI regarding the funds owed, but cannot get any response.  Poor customer service !!!! Never again.........

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know. Alabama allows landlords to process security deposit dispositions within 60 days of the restoring of possession to the owner. In reviewing the deductions it appears that the only deduction was for a flea treatment and not the carpet cleaning. One of our staff members was covered with fleas upon entering the home. Please feel free to reach out to us with any additional questions.

name: melanie wlodyga
text: This is the best Home rental company locally! Everyone is very helpful especially Paige Sweeney!! She has been a pleasure to work with!!! Communication is great! Property is great! The payment portal is great! Nothing negative to say! I highly recommend this company!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Melanie!

name: Ruei-Jiun Hung
text: Good communication bridge between owners and renters

name: Tiffany Adams
text: AHI did a great job in securing a tenant that took care of my property. I love their screening process and procedures. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable . I was kept informed about everything concerning my property every step of the way! Thanks AHI for easing the stress and allowing me to have a great LL renting experience. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a company to manage their property. Thanks for your help!

name: Deidre Chaknis
text: My husband and I had a terrible experience with AHI and finally terminated our relationship with them. We rented our home in Birmingham after an out of state job transfer and hired AHI to manage the property. There was little to no communication about maintenance issues until the deposit of our rent would be short at the end of the month. Billing was done months later about repairs we weren't told about. I sent email after email to the maintenance team and wouldn't receive a response for months, if at all. We asked for the house to be inspected every six months - that didn't happen either. The one time it did (nine months after the initial request) we were told everything was fine in the house, specifically that the carpet and walls looked good. When our tenants vacated 60 days later, AHI came up with a laundry list of issues that needed to be addressed. When I asked why the discrepancy, we were told that some tenants try to hide damage during inspections. But the things AHI recommended addressing were the carpets and painting the walls in the entire house! How was that "hidden" during the inspection? This was the final straw and we terminated our relationship with AHI. Now that we're selling the house, we have to spend even more money to repair issues AHI never told us about. I don't trust the judgment of the maintenance team and would not recommend AHI to anyone.

name: Mr. Sanders
text: AHI can be a good company as I have a house under contract with them, but a common denominator is their lack of communication, very inconsistent, several phone calls and e-mails never answered or returned. I wonder if they are under staffed and can’t handle the load? I wanted them to manage a new property I just closed on in Alabama but they don’t answer, or send the documents to sign, it’s as if they don’t want the business or don’t care, causing me to look elsewhere for a PM. No company is perfect but come on, a quick response or phone call doesn’t take that much effort.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're very sorry we did not meet your expectations and would love the opportunity to earn back your business. Please reach out to one of our managers directly at 205-267-1005. Thank you and we hope to be able to work with you again soon.

name: lawrence haas
text: AHI is the worst company I have ever done business with. They managed our house in Hoover, Alabama for 1.5 years, and they are very slow to move on repairs and to communicate with my husband and I. We had a sewer back-up in December/January that they didn't tell us about, then it happened again in March and it backed up into the hall and 2 bedrooms. The laminate floor in the hallway buckled and the carpet was nasty as a result of the back-up, so I told them that I wanted the plumbing and flooring issues fixed, and multiple emails later they stated the repairs would be done late May-early June, meanwhile the tenant found some law in Alabama that allowed them to move out if the house is "under construction". I called one day and the maintenance guy said the tenant had moved out, and I was like "what?!" Anyways, none of the managers would field my questions and only the administrative staff and maintenance workers would call me back, and I'm not a difficult person, the management here is just extremely poor. When they made the repairs and did the cleaning after the last tenant moved out, it was so bad I had to redo everything, and on top of everything I had the worst flea infestation of all time. Find another company if you are looking for someone to manage your property.

resp.text: We're very sorry that your experience with AHI was not a positive one. We understand the insurance company was also involved in this situation and would like the opportunity to make it right. Please call our corporate office and speak with the principal broker at 205-682-9106.

name: Nathan
text: Great company to work with!

resp.text: Thank you Nathan!

name: Chris Gerard
text: For several years, I have totally relied on AHI Properties to take care of my rental house in Mobile. I live in China and I am not easily reachable. AHI properties has pro-actively addressed issues with the tenants. Their response time is phenomenal. Not only are they courteous, but they are always cheerful and polite. Their thoroughness and dedication makes them an easy choice over the other companies. I highly recommend people to choose AHI Properties.

name: Maurice Smith
text: We want to thank all of you for your help in managing our home. In particular Phillip and Tim who have been of great help to us in keeping the house maintained.  As well as you (Joe), Mark, Julie, Christine, Priscilla and Brook in keeping us legal and paid. I will bet I left someone out that helped us over the past 4 years.

name: Tara Heis
text: The AHI staff made our rental experience a great one. They made sure the house was immaculately cleaned before we moved in, they quickly addressed any problems, and they were very helpful in the moving out process. There are no surprises with AHI, because they are professional, courteous and efficient.

name: Peter Foster
text: I feel very fortunate to have AHI Properties managing my rental property. I am confident that I chose the right management company as they have provided top professionalism and service. It's always good dealing with them and my tenants have good things to say too. I highly recommend them if you're looking to hire a good property management company.

name: Norman Alexander
text: AHI Properties has been excellent. We appreciated how quickly our house sold. Highly recommend to others.

resp.text: Thanks Norman!

name: Eric Aubd
text: The people at AHI Properties are responsive, professional, and very nice. They have been my property managers for a long time and they do a GREAT job. I have referred a friend of mine to AHI Properties, and he has been happy with the management as well. From finding great tenants, to keeping me informed of finances, they do it all.

name: Khadijah Kendricks
text: Very poor in communication and assistance. Called due to the online payment system but it continues to have an issue every month which I was told wouldn't be the case. Then called for a week straight to have their maintenance people come out and they STILL have not made it. I know it's up to the owner of the home to choose these companies but I've been here 4 years and if i have to deal with this headache every month, I would rather move.

resp.text: We value your feedback and apologize for any confusion during the changes and transition of management companies/new company ownership. We offer several options for payments and online payments. We will be happy to walk you through the steps of setting up an account. As we do with all of the properties we manage, maintenance requests are addressed in the order they are received. We do have procedures and policies in place for having maintenance requests approved and scheduled, however we work diligently to have them addressed promptly. Please call Paige Sweeney on Monday to discuss your account. We appreciate you as our resident!

name: A.D. C
text: THEY SUCK

name: Tammy Sanders
text: Paige and the rest of the team at AHI Properties have been great to work with. They have found excellent tenants, handled any minor issues so I have not had to be involved and communicate timely. This is the way rental property management should work, I do very little and receive a check each month.

name: Sonya Steckler
text: Excellent response to my request, and with follow through. Since I am an owner who lives out of town, I asked them to drive by my property and take pictures of the exterior and email them to me so that I can see for myself the current condition of my property. They did exactly as I asked, and said they will be happy to do it again.

name: Joshua Jones
text: Thank you so much for letting me a part of your life and this house has been amazing. I am going to miss the house and the neighborhood. Thank you!!

name: glenn bond
text: No show

name: Aaron Rhodon
text: My experience with AHI has been great!  Priscilla D, my property manager, is a valuable asset and she has always been on top of things and very helpful.  She is always the first one to notify me of any changes that are happening, and keeping me up to date.  Thank you!

name: Jennifer Robertson
text:
We needed a furnished apartment for one month while we wait for our house closing. Management company personnel has been wonderful and very helpful.

The apartment they put us in is beautiful, great location, wonderful amenities. The problem is the apartment is on the bottom level. We called and asked to be moved or a refund, nothing could be done. So, for two weeks we have heard nothing but stomp stomp stomp, toilet flush, cell phone calls, and vacuum every day!!  We're wearing air plugs day and night so we can hear ourselves think.

Recommend you see unit before you sign anything!

name: Valerie Williams
text: AHI yard sale today. I was there early when it started, but dissapointed only to hear they had a family and friends day yesterday.It was advertised for the public for Thurs and Friday but there wasnt really anything left.You can tell it was already gone even before it started.They use to have the best sales.We use to look forward to the sale every year and tell others we knew.Maybe next time.

resp.text:
Hi Valerie,
We apologize that you were disappointed with the yard sale this year. We offer our employees the opportunity to review the items prior to the sale as part of our appreciation for their assistance in the yard sale, however each yard sale changes with how many and what kind of items are available. Please follow our schedule on Facebook @AHIyardsale for any information on future yard sales.

name: Patrick Ibarra

resp.text: Diana - We are so glad you enjoyed your time with us and that it was easy for you! We appreciate your business and hope to work with you in the future.

name: Alan Farmer
text: These guys are professionals! They are by far the best property management company around. They have excellent customer service and we highly recommend them if you need someone to help you rent your home or if you are looking for a home to rent.

text: I first used AHI Properties back in 2009 and decided to recently come back because I loved their services so much. They handle everything with ease and professionalism, some companies can be a true nightmare to deal with! I am so please with the staff at AHI, I will continue using them as long as I need to!!

name: Kyle Lupo
text: The experience has been good... The accounting area has been easy to work with and very responsive. Thank you AHI Properties!

resp.text: Kyle - We appreciate your review and are so pleased that you had a positive experience with us! Thank you for choosing AHI!

name: Lenny Ferguson

name: James Villa
text: The people we worked with were responsive to our questions. Supplied us with answers and good advice. Always there when we needed them. Thank you!!!

resp.text: Thanks James!

name: Michael Titus
text:
I just wanted to take the time to thank AHI Properties for the stellar work that they have done on my behalf in the property management realm. This is my third property management company and I cannot begin to talk about the difference in the work that this company has done for me, compared to the other property management companies that I have used in months and years gone by.

First, I want to say thanks for having me at a near 100% occupancy rate and a mid 90% collection rate and for handling the tough calls on the nights and weekends that my previous companies either did not handle, did not handle well, or did not handle with the finesse required to keep my tenants happy. I have found the staff at AHI to be extraordinarily professional and willing to rent properties in neighborhoods that other companies have chosen to whine and complain about. Not only have they rented them, but they have collected the revenue that others said they could not collect.

Their software program has allowed us to see every transaction in a transparent way and to know where every dime of our rental proceeds is going, at the moment that it is going there. I think that this company will continue to grow and I am very fortunate to have found them.

I told them that if I could ever serve as a person to recommend this company, I want to be such a person. My kindest regards to everyone up the chain of command at AHI Properties.

name: Belinda Johnson
text: Very Friendly staff Joe levino was very nice and attentive to our needs.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words!

name: Jaylah Ramirez
text: AHI Properties has been excellent. Always responsive to my tenants and my needs. Thank you!!

resp.text: Thanks Jaylah!

name: Jamison Andrews
text: I have been using AHI as my property management for over 6 years. I have nothing but good experience with them. I hihgly recommend them!!

name: Kathryn Coleman
text: Whenever we have had needs or questions, the staff at AHI Properties as been very helpful. Their help is not given grudgingly but with a smile even over the phone

name: Nassib Khanafer
text: I have been using AHI as my property management for over 6 years. I have nothing but good experience with them. I highly recommend them

name: Cody Sarrazin

text: I would rate each category as the best. These folks do a great job. I appreciate the help that my agent provides and the timeliness of service.

name: Jesse Peroni
text: Over the years, I have been very pleased with the outstanding services that I have received from AHI. Their organization is a class act. Very thankful for having the opportunity to work with them.

name: Milton David
text: The staff at AHI has been nothing but professional and has done everything in their power to make sure the house stays rented to a very good tenants. we have been very pleased with everyone at AHI.

name: د.ليلى الخياط
text: Bad company, when I rented the home and moved out they took all my deposit money and asked me to buy more than 2500 to makeover the house owner and then the owner offer it to sale . The owner changed the wood floor without I damage it and paint the whole house because she want to increase the house brice... from my deposit money.. I recommend don't rent the houses that rent by this company. They will give the deposit money to the owner to makeover the house.  Even though, the house was as the same condition that when I rent it... this is not fair!! They don't care about the renter. !! If you are a renter don't rent their houses...or you will regret. This is only my own bad experience.

name: Dorothy Taylor
text: Everyone from the facilities manager to the front desk receptionist to the property manager has been incredibly helpful and very responsive. Absolutely do not have to worry about my property at all.

name: Harvey Thomas
text: The staff at the Mobile office do an outstanding job. Keep up the good work.

name: Jeff Jones
text: They have a good furniture  sales (yard sale)  prices  are very good

name: LaBirdia Brown
text: My experience has been really great renting from AHI Properties

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review!

name: Lorena Bastion
text: AHI Properties has been great to me for the many years I have lived here. I loved the new carpet when I moved in and ever since things have been great.

name: Janet Phillips
text: I appreciated the screening process for prospective tenants. AHI was very responsive and professional. I would recommend them!!!

name: Charly Aby
text: Very attentive over the years. There service seems like they improve more and more each year. I have recommended family and friends to AHI.

name: Annie Russell
text: Very helpful in answering any questions.

resp.text: Happy to help, Annie!

name: Brian McCormick
text: My experience with AHI Properties has been outstanding. They have been great to work with and they do an excellent job. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: StrikerJ
text: Service was lackluster. Maintenance was a chore to actually get them to come out. They never fixed the initial problems on move-in with outlets/broken drawers in bathroom. Granted we didn't bug them about it but we shouldn't have to. When we signed the lease there were many things different in the contract than we were told when meeting with an AHI representative, like needing professional cleaners upon move-out. No big deal but it seems like a large entity like AHI could just bundle it in with their own contractors for a better total price, instead of leaving it up to the  tenants to find them. Instead AHI will charge the tenant double of what it would cost to do the same job, then add fees to take away from the deposit. Just seems like a sketchy deal, thankfully we avoided these fees at the warning of some friends who got out of the properties a little while before we did. We won't be using AHI again.

name: Scott Dobbs
text: Renting and leasing a home is easy. The HORRIBLE part is dealing with ANYTHING pertaining to maintenance. We've been waiting on our garbage disposal to be fixed and the person they hired has 1) Forgot what part he was supposed to order after two weeks 2) Rescheduled due to the part being late after 3 weeks. The people AHI uses for maintenance absolutely HATE returning voicemails and listening to phone calls apparently...

name: Kristina Oliver
text: I have been renting from AHI for several years and always appreciate the help and kindness of their Office Manager.

name: Gavin Donn
text: The staff has been very responsive from my first call, and continue to be since then through the rental process and now as a tenant. Everyone here has been friendly and professional. Service here is great. Definitely recommended.

name: Aldo Joel
text: AHI Properties has been excellent. They are really awesome! Especially Paige!!!

name: V MP
text: The initial impression is OK but if maintenance is needed the support falls off.  Call backs are none existing. When the maintenance group finally calls back they are rude and condensing. There seems to be intent due to the manner in which they handle all maintenance issues. As a landlord the question of do they real have your best interest is very concerning. A landlord should be concern if there are maintenance issue which are not resolved. Small things turn into costly headaches. Beware is the message here. Most renters that call with issues are normally ones which have the home owners best interest those that do not call could be hiding issues.

name: Ellie Taylor
text: All of the property management had some very crucial reviews. But Ahi looked pretty decent we met up and decided on all of the prices, got work done on my home before we rented it out. They had it posted within hours later and found a tenant within days. I am so happy we chose Ahi, I recommend them for anyone looking for a property management agency.

name: Timothy Ferrell
text: The staff is professional and responds quick to owner and renters needs or concerns. Highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Thanks Timothy! We are always happy to help!

name: Gabriel Agnew
text: We have been very happy with AHI, they handle all the challenges of property management with professionalism and efficiency, they are well worth their modest fee. Thank you!!

name: Asuncion Bradford
text: I truly enjoy working with such professionals as the AHI Properties staff. Although I live far away, we have communicated very well and overcome all the sensitive problems we encountered in a timely manner.

name: russle meadows
text: Working with Vicki, Phillip and Matt makes owning investment property a pleasure. They have reliable professionals to make repairs and always meet the highest of expectations as a property owner.

name: Ben Willits
text: Very satisfied with the services that AHI provides.  Responsive, professional, courteous.

name: Loving me
text: This company's communication is horrible!! I had to constantly contact them after I paid a $10 fee just to view home which is ridiculous. I was shown a home by The Montgomery Office that had a big pile of bugs (more than 20) on the floor in the living room.. I felt as if the property should not have been shown in that condition and it caused me to not want the house at all. Horrible service

name: janice pedaltons
text: I truly enjoy working with such professionals as the AHI Properties Staff. We have communicated very well and overcome all the sensitive problems we encountered in a timely manner.

name: Barbara Jones
text: Whenever i have a problem a staff member addresses it immediately to resolve the situation. The service has been excellent working with AHI properties.

name: Robert Deering
text: Have used AHI twice. Highly recommend!

name: Chad Mickens
text: Paige is very responsive and gets things done quickly. Thank you.

name: Lester Dicoma
text: Overall we had a great experience working with AHI. If a problem has come up, we've gotten a quick response and things have been handled professionally and in a timely manner.

name: Sarah Corby
text: We had a great experience with Renters Warehouse! The approval process was quick and easy! I called the main number and spoke with Al. The home we were inquiring about had just been taken off the market, but Al was quick to find us something comparable! Cindy took over from there as it was her house and she was super helpful and friendly!  I definitely recommend Renters Warehouse!

resp.text: Sarah, we are delighted to hear that Al and Cindy were able to help you find your new home. We love what we do, and getting word that we are exactly what you were looking for makes us beyond excited. Our goal is to have everyone experience the sense that we are part of their family. Thank you for taking time to share your opinion with others.

name: Jason Ryu
text:
Do not expect to get your security deposit back. RW does not protect tenant's security deposit.
They let my landlord withdraw my security deposit, without giving me any contact or information about deduction, even after, I contact them more than 15 times and it all happens after I go through moving out inspection and evict.
I requested refund or the evidence of maintenance which I'm obviously not responsible(Can't even tell it really happend), every single email or call I make them, gave me the same answer(check posted photo).
So basically, if you rent place through this company, land lord can make up some reasons after you evict, and before you receive your security deposit, they can simply withdraw it without your authorization, and just ghost you, wonderful experience!

resp.text: The property owner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the move out. Our disposition manager spoke with you after you had concerns with the charges that the property owner assessed. You provided our office your written dispute of the security deposit. The disposition manager was able to send your dispute to the homeowner for their determination. Upon review, the property owner feels the amounts withheld are justified and no adjustments will be made. This is the property owner’s final decision and, unfortunately, there is no further action that Renters Warehouse can take on your behalf in regards to this dispute.

name: Jay Baxter
text: Today I sat down in front of the TV to eat some breakfast... and that's when I discovered a tornado and dangerously strong winds had hit one of the places my family purchased rental properties.  We were in panic mode since we have wonderful tenants and nice properties there.  I called Maria Guevara at Renter's Warehouse... and, in less than 2 hours, she was able to help me confirm that all of my tenants in those 8 properties were okay.  Maria, thank you so much for removing my family's migraine and ulcer this morning, we sure do appreciate you and the rest of your team!  Please stay amazing.

resp.text: What a wonderful surprise! Your words of encouragement, Jay make us feel proud of what we do. Businesses are mainly about people connecting to people and knowing that our team is on the ball makes us proud. It is great to know that Maria was able to provide you with the highest levels of service and peace of mind.

name: Tiffany Parham
text: I had the pleasure of working with Melissa Morris, and she was everything we needed, plus more! Friendly, and proved that getting my family into the home we were interested in was a top priority of hers. She was always helpful and supplied all information promptly. I would most definitely recommend her to anyone else looking to rent. Thank you Melissa!

resp.text: WOW! Tiffany, we can't begin to tell you how nice it is to hear words of encouragement, appreciation and praise.  We want every single customer that gives us the opportunity to serve them, to experience the same level of service. We are so happy to hear that Melissa is committed to our customers, making them top priority! Be careful

resp.text: Hilary, our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience. I am sorry to hear that you experienced these issues. Your lease began on April 1st. On April 6th you contacted us with complaints about the smell of mold and the condition of the water heater. We considered this to be an emergency case and immediately contacted the homeowner. A vendor was approved to visit the property. Upon inspection the tech found no odor that would be related to organic matter. The home was in need of a good cleaning but there were no visible signs of organic matter as well. The water heater was unable to be checked due to no power being on in the home, the tech did check for leaks and found none in its current state. Other issues throughout the home were noted and included in an estimate, the owner approved for all repairs to be made at your earliest convenience. You refused to schedule with the vendor and requested to terminate the lease. The owner approved your request on April 15th, we are currently in the process of closing your account. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948, we will be happy to assist.

name: miles gamble
text: 1st account manager scammed my tenant out of a $950 deposit that should've gone to me. After firing him I was assured the money would be refunded after the eviction was completed. After months of following up I never received the deposit.

resp.text: Hello Miles, you had a tenant placed in the home on 2/8/2018 and they were evicted from the home on 10/4/2018. After they were required to vacate the premises the disposition was proceeded with. The charges assessed to the past tenant exceeded the security deposit funds. The security deposit totaling $950.00 was to be sent to you as the homeowner. However, this balance was applied towards the outstanding balances on your account. The following charges on your account were the following; $55.00 for an estimate fee, management fees from June - October, and a portion of your re-keying of the property. Please be advised, their is still a balance owed on your account for this re-key of the property. Please submit a payment for this outstanding balance on your account. If you have additional questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to assist you.

resp.text: Our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience, Ashleigh. We are sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with your showing and application process. Our agents do have busy times and typically do not answer their phones while showing a property. They are good about returning calls when they are available. Scheduling a showing is also available through our website. Each rental property will continue to be shown and accept applications until an applicant has been approved and hold funds have been submitted. At that time, the home is no longer shown. Each individual homeowner determines whether or not to accept an applicant.

text: Turns out that RW will take a double deposit for a 3 year contract, then return NONE of it when the tenants walk out after a year. Home owners and investors beware; Renter's Warehouse is not on your side!

resp.text: Hello Daniel, the homeowner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the disposition. In the event that you have unpaid rent at the time of your move out, it will be deducted from your security deposit. All charges have been outlined within your formal disposition notice. If you disagree with the amount(s) charged, please submit your formal written dispute to our office. Once we receive a dispute, we will forward it to the homeowner for their determination. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to help you.

name: Tarraina Turner
text:
I’ve lived here for almost 3 years so since before the transition to new management. Took almost a year to renovate but everything is beautiful. However, the transition to a new wifi had left me unable to work from home or do schoolwork because of the terrible connectivity. I can barely even watch tv on my Xbox since they switched the network. I have called white sky and nothing helps. They installed the wifi in a terrible place so I can’t even connect a router to extend the signal. White sky person came and recommended that I run a cord from the kitchen to the other side of my apartment. Never had these issues when we had Xfinity and it was much nicer. The apartment is overpriced for students not to even have good wifi and there aren’t any Ethernet ports to hardwire internet. It is not a hardware issue. My TVs and Xbox are brand new and I had NO issues with xfinity for the 2 years we used them. As you can see in my pictures sometimes the connection drops just minutes between.

UPDATE: The owner of my condo is now trying to move us out. The office has sent people up here AGAIN to work on the WiFi and they said the issue was not the WiFi but my usage. However, when I had all devices off as they suggested, other than the one I am using, and I’m still unable to work on school or remotely effectively. I try to meet with people in the office, and they treat me with disregard. I have lowered my rating due to the lack of understanding when it comes to the WiFi.

resp.text:
Tarriana,

I am sorry to hear about your issues with our WIFI connectivity.  I have asked our Accounts Manager Tyler Low to look into the situation further and he will be contacting White Sky.  Unfortunately, the switch to White Sky was authorized by the Condo's home owners association and we did not have any control on the switch but we are looking into how we can fix the problem.

Thank you,

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: mclain Beaulieu
text:
I have lived at Vie for around 7 months and I have had nothing but great experiences here. The staff is very friendly and attentive. If you have any issues a quick call to the office will solve it. The complex itself looks great and is very clean. The apartments are spacious and comfortable which make you feel like a king. Amenities are top tier, I myself use the gym a lot and its always kept in perfect condition. If you are a student or local resident Vie should be on the top of your list of places to consider.

- Conrad Beaulieu

resp.text:
Conrad,

Thank you for sharing your comments about living with Vie at University Downs.  We strive to provide an amazing experience for all of our guests and we are very proud of our community.  If you ever need anything be sure to stop by and see me in the office.

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: Penelope Featherington
text: I cannot say enough good things about University Downs! Every single amenity is top notch! The staff in outstanding! There is one guy in particular that stood out the most, Kyle Orabone! HE IS FANSTATIC!!! He made me feel right at home. I would even go as far as saying he is the reason I made University Downs my HOME!!! Don't miss out on this awesome place, or Kyle!

name: Patricia Moore
text: Had a very nice visit. The staff was amazing. They were also very helpful at any questions I had. Management was awesome.

name: Colton Kuykendall
text: I'm loving my experience as a resident of the Downs. Great friendly staff, Nice community, beautiful pools and Clubhouse.

name: Emma Milianta
text: I love living at vie on the apartment side! My boyfriend lives on the condo side and that’s how I found out about vie! I love the amenities and maintenance has been super quick every time I needed them!

name: Sebastian 9
text: Lived here for a year water pressure was terrible, you couldn’t have two water appliances running at the same time or else they wouldn’t work. You have to walk your trash the other end of the apartment complex. Frequently had bugs and the upstairs neighbors stomped all year. And all of this was way overpriced. Just overall not worth what they charge.

name: Brooke Owen
text: Me and my roommate have perviously never lived in apartment before. We had many worries of living on our own for the first time but within the first week of living here, it has been nothing less than perfect. We have never felt unsafe while living here, we don't have any kitchen appliances break down on us and most importantly, if is worth every dime to live here. We have friends in other apartments who feel like they are paying way to much to constantly having their dishwasher break down, or feeling like it is too dangerous to come home after 11pm. My roommate and I both highly recommend living at UDowns. Between the pool when its hot out and the weekly giveaways (such as pizza, movie nights, wings, trivia nights, etc.) this was the perfect place to spend our last year as students in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text:
Brooke,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We look are so happy you enjoy living here as your first apartment complex. We hope you choose to stay for a very long time. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to continue to make your experience great!

Thanks,
Vie Management

name: Sarah Amjad
text: The pool is awesome and they have lots of fun perks for the residents

name: Christopher (Topher) Fryzel
text: Great place with amazing amenities!  Friendly staff, too.

name: Rob B
text: I’ve lived here for over 3+ years and I’ve been pretty happy with it until recently. The new owners have made the “genius” decision to take away our cable/wifi we had with Xfinity and replace it with something called “whitesky”. Due to this, hundreds of channels are now gone and I no longer have access to several channels I rely on for sports. But hey, at least now I have three different versions of MTV and the cowboy channel... Glad to see they appreciate their residents. (Extreme Sarcasm)

resp.text:
Rob, Thank you for your review and we do apologize for your frustration. The HOA and the Board agreed to transition the cable and internet to WhiteSky because of the service that was being provided with the previous provider. The HOA has provided the channel line up, which includes many sports stations including ESPN, ESPN2, Fox Sports, SEC, ACC, Golf, and others. If you continue to have issues with the new transition that increased the internet speed significantly and adjusted the channel line up please let us know and we will notify WhiteSky to see what we can do. We look forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Vie Management

We have another son leaving home soon and are confident that he will want to rent a place there, too.

Thank you so much for your positive words and feedback. We work hard each day to create a great experience for all of our residents and parents! text: I NEVER leave a review on the places I stay but, THIS one is necessary! As a travel nurse, I have stayed at multiple places, however, this was, by far, the most memorable, unforgettable stay and I do not mean that in a good way! The initial phone conversation was impressive, but the “arrival” was way different. Due to covid-19, we have to be quick, ready and on the move as the demands of healthcare request….Cons: Management took no responsibility! Every concern was put off as someone else’s issue. Work orders were not completed, and I still had to pay for ½ service for a full month that I am no longer there. I had to pay for leaving 3 weeks early but did not even get a refund of the unavailable amenities (at least). Pros: they wish me luck on my upcoming assignment!
