name: Madison Ehmann
text: Vie at University Downs is the worst management company I have ever worked for. After delaying their management takeover by almost 4 months, they made promises they were no where near capable of keeping. The staff I worked with was great until Vie and their employees came to Tuscaloosa and acted like everything would be better for everyone. The renovations that should’ve been finished weeks ago are just being completed. Or, in the case of the gym, these renovations haven’t even started, which will prove to be a great disadvantage to the new residents moving in in 2 weeks. Not only has this been a major problem, but the raise is rates is absolutely ridiculous. Changing a few appliances and putting wooden floors in the bedrooms is not worth an extra $150, especially when many residents provide their own furniture. Lastly, Molly Daniels, the regional manager at Vie, had been anything but helpful in this process. She was the main person to promise all of these renovations and upgraded amenities, yet left our staff as soon as she could to return to her other company. Vie Management is a complete joke. If you can live anywhere besides University Downs, please do!!

resp.text:
Madison,

We are so sorry that you feel so negatively about your experience. We also were not excited about the closing of the property being delayed, however we have great renovations that are taking place and all of the apartments will be completed in advance of move in, which is what we communicated and promised. We have many residents already enjoying the great new environment and experience. Please feel free to reach out to our Employee Relations Manager, Jessica Drucker, to discuss your employment further.

Thank you,
Vie Management

text: University downs changed management in December 2018 and boy is it noticeable. The assistant manager told someone on the phone to "f**k off" after they got an earful. Totally unprofessional. Newsflash folks: if your bank isn't in town it's really really hard to find a way to pay rent, which is why the direct pay option was heavily used. Lots of maintenance problems too: the air filter in the apartment I stayed at probably hadn't been changed since the place was built because it was completely clogged. First floor apartments have bugs too. The kitchen counters are warped and starting to break, the carpets are nasty, and the cracked window in the bedroom still hasn't gotten fixed either. There's also this huge pothole in the pavement that has been there since they started using a university bus after their broke down. The list goes on and on... The rent might be relatively cheap but you definitely understand why after living here for awhile. Save yourself a headache and rent somewhere else.

name: Tarnese Price
text: Before we moved in we had to pay rent on the 1st but couldn’t move in until the 15th because they had to “clean” the apartment. We waited just to move into a dirty apartment. Nothing was prepared for us. The mailbox key was the wrong key and the mailbox was broken so we couldn’t get our mail, and of course we were waiting on something important to be delivered. We didn’t have a gate opener so we had to use a code that worked half the time. When I finally received a gate opener it didn’t work because they didn’t activate it. The gate is trash and stopped working. Then our laundry room was flooding b\c of the air conditioning. We had to call them 3 times before they actually fixed it, just for it to happen again months later. We paid rent EVERY month ON TIME but they would put all the rent either on my account or my room mate’s account so we would get eviction notices. This has happened at least 6 out of the 9 months we have lived here. Then they decide they want to take up the carpet and replace it with something else while we’re still living here!! They kept changing the date so the day ends up being on a week where I have worked three 16-hour days plus I have back issues and need an operation so I’m having to try and move all my stuff out of my room and closet so they can do something they could’ve done after we leave this place!! Which just made my pain worst. For a month or two they had no groundskeeper so there was dog feces all over the property!! Everywhere you stepped you were likely to step in it. The tub is made of horrible material and is terribly hard to clean. The faucet in the bathroom has been leaking since I moved in. The walls are thin and you can hear the people upstairs. The dryer is trash and you have to dry your cloths twice just to get them dry. There’s no button for the garbage disposal. This place is trash for the cost!! They only care about the money not the residents!! If you like to throw away money then this is the perfect place for you!!

resp.text: Dear Tarnese, Thank you for letting us know about this. Your feedback helps us get better. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business and team. Although we can’t fix the past, we are committed to improving the way we serve every customer we have. Please accept my sincerest apologies on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. Do not hesitate to contact Garrett Galloway at manager@vieatudowns.com if you wish to discuss further.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give us a review. We appreciate all the feedback that you have given and will continue to make sure our residents are happy with the property and management.- Thanks Managment

name: Chayton Mowrey
text:
There are so many choices for apartment living in Tuscaloosa and from what I’ve experienced, no place will be perfect in every single way. My overall experience here was above average and I did enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, but it was a roller coaster. The staff is AWESOME. Nothing else to say there, they are all really good people and willing to help. I moved in fast and it was very easy, especially from a gentleman named Rulondo who helped me numerous times during my residency. Also, I want to emphasize how impressed I was with the security in the complex. There are numerous guards roaming and keeping watch, I felt very safe here.

In the units, the floor layouts are nice and the rooms are pretty spacious, the living/dining room especially.

I did however, have a few things I’d like to share. The first negative experience I had was after I was all moved in, I realized my apartment’s living room and dining room was unfurnished. I was informed that when the new ownership took over earlier in 2018, they furnished every unit with furniture. The one I lived in however, had a resident who had been in there prior to the change in management and had personal furniture already in his room. They told him that In order to get the living room stuff: couch, chair, television, tv stand, dining room table, chairs (basically everything one would need in a living space), that he must also accept the bedroom furniture. This meant he had to move all of his stuff out of there. Since he already had everything he needed, he declined.
Ironically, the other two bedroom units were furnished but the living room was still left empty. I tried numerous times to get furniture in this apartment but it felt like the staff really didn’t care about doing this and just didn’t want to deal with it. I was told numerous times that because we had already “opted out” of receiving furniture months ago, there was “nothing they could do.” Also, I know for a fact there was a plethora of extra furniture available. I let it go because I only signed a short term lease but to me this was unacceptable and simply just laziness on the management’s part.

In October, the whole complex underwent a network change to a company called Single digits. In summation, we were without internet connection for about two weeks and even after everything was “fixed” I still experienced issues. I discussed this with the staff and I can vouch for them that they did everything they could to get it up and running as fast as possible. However, I don’t know if they made the correct decision going with this company.

Something minor, but I felt necessary to be addressed is there are a lot of bugs. I am aware this was a problem a long time ago and the staff has previously addressed this, but I still had numerous experiences. Ant infestations: One in my bedroom from the trashcan and one in the kitchen pantry. This was fixed easily by a few and traps but still gross and took a while to clean up the dead ants. I am not sure if the property had been treated for bugs but mine definitely wasn’t, not to mention that there were roaches in the kitchen, often.

After seeing what other apartment complex’s are like. Yes, I had a few complaints, but I want to make sure the management can see these because feedback is a great way to improve. Vie at University Downs does have a lot to offer and it was a nice place to live. With a few fixes and changes, this place has the potential to be a top notch choice for living in Tuscaloosa, but changes definitely need to be made. They are upgrading the clubhouse and I assume it will be very nice.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your useful insights. We are thrilled to hear that you are happy to live here, but I also wante to let you know that we are constantly striving to improve these aspects.
Best regards,
Management

text: The girls in the front office were the nicest, most helpful, friendliest group of people I've had the pleasure to meet. They went out of their way to help me and I greatly appreciate it. Oh and Jade was pretty cute too😉

text: I've lived here for 3 years and highly recommend it to people looking for a place to live. The current staff has taken it upon themselves to personally help me with any issues and they take the maintenance of their amenities and properties very seriously. As a pet owner too my dog loves being able to stretch his legs and run around the gated park.

name: Cade Jones
text: I have lived here for four years and love it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Safe community. Fun atmosphere. Perfect for dogs!!!! A lot of land for the dogs to run around.

text: University Downs is a phenomenal place to live. The location was fantastic and even allowed me to bring my pets. The staff was nothing but helpful and I will miss living in this community very much. I just hope a complex as amazing as University Downs will welcome me in my future endeavors.

resp.text: thank you so much for these kind words! We can't tell you how much we appreciate hearing from you and knowing that you've been happy during your stay with us. We are going to miss you too!! Thanks again!

text: I had such a hilarious tour with Freddie. He was so eager to tour me even though he has a broken leg.

resp.text:
MaryClaire,

Our office staff strive to make everyone's experience the best possible, no matter what it takes. Thanks for coming by!

Kindly,
Management

name: Taylor Saenz
text: I didn’t mind living here until just recently. With the new renovations for those who are moving in is literally outrageous. They are making it such an inconvenience for me to place my dogs somewhere while they do the renovations. I work in Birmingham and I don’t have the luxury of just rehoming my dogs for the day. And on top of that they are trashing and damaging my apartment while the do it. And all they do is tell me to take a picture of it and email to the company like I’m gonna get refunded for the stuff they damaged. They are doing the renovations on my dime. They should’ve compensated those who still live here the rent for the month of July. The new staff sucks and just blows you off. Like I said I liked the place until just recently but the way the company has been treating residents is awful. Do yourself a solid and just don’t live here.

resp.text:
Dear Taylor,
Thank you for sharing your feedback and for bringing this matter to our attention. I am very sorry we failed to meet your expectations. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. You may reach us anytime at manager@vieatudowns.com. Looking forward to hearing back from you shortly.

name: Dishon Ballard
text: Its Crazy How Something As Simple As Wifi Stopped Me From Renewing With This Apartment Complex. We Been Having Wifi Problems For 3 Months And It Still, To This Day, Has Not Been Resolved. So If You Are A College Student, Dont Expect To Have A Reliable Internet Source Because The Wifi Goes Out Every Week And The Front Office Will Juss Tell You They Are “Working On It” But In Reality, They Dont Seem Like They Really Care.

resp.text:
Dishon,
We are very regretful for your experience, and our team has been working diligently on ensuring the internet/ cable is functioning properly moving forward.
Please stop by the office and ask to speak with Garrett Galloway if you have any questions or concerns.
Best regards,
Vie Management

name: Grace Costello
text: I lived here for two years and couldn't be happier! After my friends saw my place, they all ended up moving here the next year also! Great location, and great staff to help you at all times if needed! Id highly recommend these condos and apartments. i have nothing bad to say about them.

resp.text: Grace Costello, thanks so much for the positive review.  We are so happy you are enjoying your stay here and truly appreciate the referrals!  If there is anything we can do to assist you, please do not hesitate to reach out to us!

name: Justin Chavez
text: I love University Downs! The apartments are very cozy and just what i need. The pool is a great time during the summer. They also have a gym and tanning beds. The staff has always been very helpful, too! I 100% recommend the UD!

resp.text: Hi Justin Chavez, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at University Downs.  We're happy we could meet your expectations!  Please let us know if we can do anything else to make your stay more enjoyable!

name: Barry (Bj) Briggs
text: The staff is amazing,however,  the management doesn’t seem to care at all about their employees. Their singular focus seems to be getting people to sign leases.

Thank you for your feedback! We truly appreciate all of our team members and all of their hard work. Please let us know if you have any other concerns.

name: Samantha Quraishi
text: My niece lives here and I absolutely adore going to visit her! This property is always kept clean and their front office staff is always on top of things. I'd recommend this facility to any young adult looking for an apartment.

resp.text: Samantha Quraishi, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team.  We love referrals so please tell your friends and help spread the word about how great University Downs is!

name: DJ Lovoy
text: I loved living here! All of the staff was extremely nice to me, and the community in general is very friendly. Maintenance does a great job of actually fixing your problem when they come in to the apartment. The pool is awesome; probably the best apartment pool that I have had in Tuscaloosa out of the four different places I had lived in. Not to mention this place is a great place to live if you're a dog owner, with a dog area to let your dog run around in and play with other dogs!

resp.text: Hey DJ!!  We are so happy to hear you have loved your experience living here! We make it our priority to make sure all of our residents are taken care of!!

text: The building numbers are not well marked, especially building 700 which makes no sense the way the rooms are lined out. The parking lots are not lit well everywhere either

resp.text:
Hi Nicholas!

Thank you for your feedback. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Andrew Fernandez
text: Just perfect. A friendly and efficient staff like yours is what separates you from the pack. Will definitely be recommending to friends and relatives. Great location, quality development, and an all-around lovely environment to live in.

resp.text: Andrew Fernandez, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at University Downs!  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can do anything to make your stay more comfortable!

name: Daniel Skehan
text: Sydney has been one of the most helpful and customer oriented rental agents with whom i have ever dealt. Not only was she easy to work with, she was easy on the eyes. Always energetic and colorful, Sydney has made this experience the picture of what renting should be!!

resp.text: Thank you Peter Pettigrew for sharing this experience with us!  It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We look forward to your next visit!  Take care!

name: Madison Fincher
text: LOVE University Downs!! Super clean, great pool, & great staff. Sydney is my go-to because she is always more than helpful!! Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

resp.text: Thank you Madison Fincher for sharing this experience with us! It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Olivia Acker
text:
management company = 0/5 stars.

New management has decided major renovations will be completed while current tenants still occupy their apartments. The schedules provided for renovations are incorrect and they expect you to remove all furniture from rooms so flooring can be replaced and to remove everything from walls so the apartment can be repainted. Not to mention the "minor" renovations they don't even feel obligated to give notice of (ex: replacing your door and painting the new one - leaving it wide open all day).

Love the unexpected 7:30am knocks on the door "I'm here to do XYZ." Don't worry if you don't hear them or you're not home - they'll let themselves in! It's thrilling to come home and see your door wide open and people coming in and out! No telling how many different people have been given access to our apartments with no management supervision. As I type this there are people in my living room/kitchen playing music while doing heavens knows what to the AC unit.

Bringing concerns to management is useless. They are far more interested in getting these apartments updated so that they can charge future tenants $300 more in rent than they are in listening to current tenant's concerns.

resp.text: Good afternoon Olivia, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. I apologize on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM, Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further? Thank you.

name: Zhichao Hao
text: Withholding deposit for almost two years without any explanation! Nowhere needs this money to fix at all! Expecting to live here? Prepare to lose your money and even staffs there don't know why! All they could tell is we will work on it. Then? Your money lives in their pocket forever! I even stopped by the office and contact the Peak Campus for several times! Without any surprises, they've been making excuses all the time! Also my other friends who live in apartments provided by Peak Campus have the same experience! NO MORE UDOWNS & PEAK CAMPUS! KEEP IN MIND!

resp.text:
Zhichao,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January 2019. We hope that we will be able to assist you with your concerns and create a better living experience for you. We will be doing many renovations and strive to provide great customer service for all of our residents. Please reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com if you have any concerns that we can address today.

Regards,
Vie Management

name: The Regipea
text: University Downs is a great place to live. I have been living here almost a year and have renewed my lease for next year. I was looking for one bedrooms, and they offer the best bang for your buck, the great thing is the gated community because sometimes living alone can be scary, but with the gates closed at night, I feel so safe and at home here. I really love it. The new management has renovated a lot of things and it looks great!

name: Connor Galloway
text: Wow!  I applaud the staff, and the communities management for their due- diligences in making this community top tier. I am sure the availibility  is slim, call today for your new home!

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you have found this to be the case during your time with us. We truly value your feedback, If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Catherine Gore
text: I have lived here for a year now, and it has been great. The staff have always been helpful, approachable, and welcoming, and the apartment grounds are consistently clean and peaceful. I also love that the pool is right here and well-kept, and the gym is open 24-7. The computers and printer at the Downs was also super helpful during the school year.

text: My child has lived there for a year. The staff has been great, the complex is spacious, yet quiet. The common areas are kept clean and repaired. Plenty of parking for the residents. And the complex has a dog park!

name: Nicki Conlon
text: Vie Is unprofessional, With no credibility at all. Prepare to be disappointed if you work with Vie.  No one at Vie has a brokers license, and they have no respect for the  leases/contracts, as long as it benefits them. They do not manage every condo, check with Spaces and other property managers who manage some third-party condos at University Downs.

resp.text: Good afternoon Nicki, Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention. We always aim to deliver a great experience. We are gutted when we miss the mark! We will use the feedback to make us better. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Please feel free to reach out to Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further.

name: Virginia Carnathan
text: Close to campus and pretty quite. New management is great. Maintenance is pretty quick. Air company comes in frequently to check the system and make sure everything is working properly. Overall great place.

name: Tony Kirk
text: First off if i want to say university downs is not a bad place however I was put in a bad situation by them. I moved in late September to a 3 bedroom unit. However my garbage disposal has constantly went out every month, my hot water heater leaks onto the floor in the washing room and the dryer has to be rigged to keep running and this is just the beginning. I was moved into a unit that was already occupied in which it states on our move in lease if you moved in during the month of august you have 72 hours to get the lights in your name. So I think my apartment already has a power account attached to it that I just have to pay on. I gave something one month however in the month of December my power has been turned off due to it not being in someone's name. I was never notified of ANY of this and to make matters worse neither one of the two people I live with will reply to my text messages nor my calls. I'm just ready for my lease end honestly. If you already have roommates maybe it's not that bad but this is a very unacceptable situation. And to make matters worse the best option the leasing office could give me was to pay the start up fees and bill for Alabama power and bring in the bill and they will charge it to my roommates accounts. First off I shouldn't have to handle this myself, second off why would I want to continue staying in a unit where I can't get a answer from either one on A matter as serious as this. I'm the one without power right now while both of them are gone and nobody is helping me fix this

resp.text:
Hey Tony,

We are so sorry that you are having problems with your power. Please give us a call at the office at 205-752-3232 whenever you get a chance, or email me at tduncan@peakcampus.com

Thank you,
Taylor Duncan

name: Preston Schaulin
text: I went in four a tour got to see all the rendering of the renovations.Im ready to hang out in the pool all summer

Preston,

I'm very happy you liked what you saw. Please come see us again when ever you get a chance.

Best regards,
Management

name: Shannon Ryan
text: Love it! The staff is great they treat everyone like family and are always very cheery to talk too. Getting things fixed is never an issue if need be, the rooms are spacious, and the amenities are great! Highly recommend

I will be sure to share your feedback with the entire team. We are always here to help so please never hesitate to call us!  Sincerely, University Downs Property Manager (205) 752-3232.

name: BJ Robertson
text:
They had to redo the paint scheduling because one of the group of painters had got fired for stealing. The day they painted my apt, they stole some money from me. The way my money was put up(in a crate under a bunch of books), they had to been rambling through all my stuff to find it. [Smh if your 1st instinct is looking for something to steal, u don't need to be working for any company that requires coming into someone's home.] I walked up to their truck to confront them about my money missing, I notice them smoking/getting high off the money they stole from me. Of course, I reported them and they were fired immediately.
My only issue now is that it is Saturday noon and I'm just now getting my first call about roommates moving in Monday in mid July..

resp.text:
Good afternoon BJ,
Thank you for your review. I’m sorry to hear you had such a frustrating experience, but I really appreciate you bringing this issue to our
attention. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com? We’ll work with you to resolve any issues as quickly as possible. Thank you again for your feedback.

text: These apartments are old , outdated , moldy , haven’t been updated in 20yrs. The carpets are dirty , bathrooms haven’t been remodeled or recaulked in 10 plus years . Thank you for your feedback. You may or may not know but Vie Management purchased the community at the end of January and we are making many different changes to the apartments. We will also be updating and renovating the amenity spaces to make your living experience better. If you have any concerns please fee free to reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com. Vie Management

text:
No more amenities, not much maintenance, in fact, it's turned from a premier place to live into one where things are slowly being taken. I guess this comes from those of us who have lived here for 6 years.

Office is known to close earlier than the hours listed on their door/website which is inconvenient for those of us who work, or interested people traveling from out of town. name: Tiffani Greene
text: I was beyond overwhelmed at the end of last spring semester with no place to live due to an unfortunate event with previous living arrangements thus leaving me with no options as to where to go for the coming semester. I went on about thirty different tours of different complexes in Tuscaloosa to view one bedroom apartments as this was my only option due to the issues I had leading me to needing a place. To say the least a majority of the apartment options in this town are sketch especially when its last minute last chance in May. However when I came to the downs, Bronson took me and my mom and sister on a tour and it was a great experience. I wanted to see the type of unit I would actually be living in as opposed to just a model unit and they understood my concerns so they made it happen. One of the other employees, Jade, let me go into her apartment and see what it was like since that would be the layout I would ultimately end up with, without hesitation or second thought. I ended up signing for this current year and have been here since August. I have nothing but great things to say about the office staff especially Andrew who truly makes anyone's day each time you see him. Being so far away from family no matter what year you are in is always hard but the staff always is so welcoming and caring. When you read other reviews they talk about disasters of maintenance and such where their needs aren't attended to but I have not seen where that's an issue. Like normal there are always going to be household things that need fixing no matter where you live, its just a part of life and being a tenant. I have had my fair share of unwanted critters (yikes its ok I am alive still) or leaks/minor breaks but no matter what the office always responded fast and urgent for me. People fail to forget that its usually just one person, Ryan, doing all the repairs so they need to cut him some slack and be understanding that the issue will be addressed quickly but maybe not immediately. As far as safety goes, I feel secure at the apartment and the one incident where I was nervous about someone near my apartment I called the office and legitimately a golf cart, and I am talking like one of those extended ones, full of staff came zooming in and investigated and checked in on me to make sure I was okay, including Taylor Duncan the leasing manager too. I find that the staff really makes the living experience worth while at apartment complexes which is why I gave 5 stars overall. I had a few hiccups here and there with maintenance or billing like I mentioned but those issues were resolved to a level of satisfaction which is the part that matters most. Now that this novel of a review is over have a great day and if you are in a predicament where you need not just a house but a home stop on over here at UD!

name: Zach Twigg
text:
Absolutely the worst experience I could've ever imagined. When I first began paperwork with them they were undergoing renovations, which at the time was exciting to see. When I came in a couple weeks later to finish my paperwork they had lost it! Papers that had my entire identity plastered all over them as well as my co-signers (parents) info! This happened TWO more times. When everything was finally taken care of I had signed during an incentive to get a $600 dollar gift card or use it as credit towards my first months rent, so being the poor college student that I am I put it towards my rent, well when it came time to pay first months rent they told me I couldn't use that incentive because I was in a privately owned unit. Why would you assign a resident who signed during an incentive special, a condo that's privately owned therefore cancelling out that incentive?

It's just one inconvenience after another with these guys. Probably because they can't get a property management company to stick around long enough for things to flow smoothly. University Downs has gone through three ownerships since I've been involved with them. The staff is almost entirely undertrained or under-qualified to be handling the responsibilities they're supposed to take care of with ease. Nearly every question is answered with "I'll have to check with my manger when they get back". Which then leads to nothing because the manager is never around.

Also if you're planning to live on the condo side rather than the apartment side then please know that all those inclusions they promise like wifi/cable or Google Chromecast are NOT included. They didn't share that until after we had signed or lease.

Truly an awful experience. Please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for housing. Aside from the awful management the condos are higher quality builds than most of the newer places, however be prepared to do all of the move-in cleaning yourself, I've never seen such a gross move-in room. There was dog hair on the walls and black mold in my toilet.

resp.text: Zach, thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any trouble you may have had during your stay at University Downs. I hope that you are aware that we are now under new management with Peak Campus. We think that there will be all kinds of improvements for our Residents in the months to come, and we are excited to be a part of the University Downs family. Please feel free to contact us directly in the office at 205-752-3232 if you have any additional questions or concerns. Thanks again!

name: Colton Palmer
text:
It is atypical that I write reviews, especially negative reviews. However, my experience with University Downs in Tuscaloosa has been an absolute nightmare. The experience has been so negative that it warrants more than just a bad review, but also legal action.
After the new management company (Asset Campus Housing) bought the complex from Ellis-Trick, all of the services went downhill. From trash pickup to rent payment every facet of life at UD changed for the worse. Most importantly, the management staff (not necessarily the office staff) has been unhelpful, incompetent, and downright rude.
First, even though my name was on the lease (I am looking at a copy right now), my name was NEVER put into their system, so every time I called they couldn’t speak with me (or pull up my lease apparently). Furthermore, they never put any of the emails on my lease into their system. When my roommate wrote a check for $785 instead of $795 on accident, we were never notified of the “late payment” either by phone or email – even though they had both. So they after a few months that $10 charge grew into hundreds. They then had the audacity to place an eviction notice on my door. So they can walk to my apartment to threaten eviction but they can’t notify me of a $10 dollar payment??? Needless to say I paid the $10 dollars I owed them, but not a penny more! And I wished it ended there…
When I moved to a different city over the summer (and paid two rents because I didn’t want to sublease!) they actually moved another person into my apartment!!!! I found out about this when I went back to my apartment on checkout day (to turn in my key) and there was someone else living in there with all their stuff! I have had two UD employees acknowledge this, but they don’t see a problem with it at all – even though I was still paying rent!
Finally, after months of phone calls, emails, and weeks on end of no response, I still have not received my security deposit back. They have acknowledge – finally – that they owe me the security deposit, but now they said they “mailed the check.” That was over three weeks ago. This is on the point of ridiculous. The managers at the office do not care. They are rude and completely unprofessional. I have friends who have been through similar experiences at UD! And you should understand. I took pride in my apartment. It was always clean inside and out, and well taken care of.
I could go on for another page or two…
I am going back to Tuscaloosa in a few years, and they could not PAY ME to live there.
Finally, apparently the complex is being purchased by a new company in 2016. Don’t live there!!! They are keeping the same rude and unprofessional managers – so nothing will change. In fact, it will probably get worse.

text: If I could put ZERO stars I would.  My daughter moved out of University Downs last July 2016. She has been owed a refund of her security deposit in the amount of $200. We have called so many times that I have lost count, and talked to several people to try to obtain the deposit refund. The latest person I have spoken to is Vachelle,  who has promised that she will issue the check to us. I have called her four times this week, and at this point she is avoiding my calls and messages.  I guess I have no other recourse then to secure an attorney, because I have repeatedly asked for a corporate number or contact to call to have this taken care of. My daughter has lived in numerous apartments throughout her college career,  and the whole experience we had with University Downs has been the absolute worst by far.  Withholding a deposit after you have issued a letter stating that deposit will be sent is theft.

name: wilsta22
text:
Staff is awful. Maintenance would come fix some problems and ignore others. The appliances all do not work correctly. Staff/maintenance comes in whenever (literally they will knock and, from the back bedroom, not give us enough time to put pants on and go open the door before they are already letting themselves in) to fix or change things without even telling residents. They have just come in our place numerous times this year with numerous excuses. They tell you they would give residents a heads up if they have to come in, but that is not true. One day while we had multiple friends over, they came in and said they had to paint all our walls. Needless to say, that was the final straw and we told them they could not paint that day randomly without telling us, while we had people over. We live on the second story and one morning we were woken up at 8 am bc some workers had climbed up the back balconies and were on our back porch working, of course without telling us. I have never lived somewhere where maintenance just comes in without warning so many times in a year. Our friends have a joke going on about hanging at our apartment because maintenance will probably be joining us. Also, one day when they randomly came, we had an empty cat litter box. No cat, not cat toys/food, not even cat litter, just the empty box, and then they tried to charge us $500 by saying we had a pet and kept coming by randomly to catch a nonexistent cat in our place. Even then, $500 seemed like much for a cat. Another thing, along with not telling any residents about maintenance coming to do anything in residents places, they have also decided to change the internet connection and password without telling residents. We went almost a week, a school week without internet is very difficult, thinking the internet had gone out without being fixed. We finally called and they told us it had been changed. We told them we were not happy they would do that without telling us, therefore making us go without. The next day, after we had gone the week without internet and then resolved the issue, they came by and put a paper in our door telling us they changed the internet, so at least our complaining did something, even if it was a week too late.
Overall, you will not have the privacy you want in your apartment and do not count on the staff/maintenance to do great jobs. If you can get pass that, the pools and community itself is not bad, just needs better people running it.
