name: Daniel Goforth
text: Ben has a strong personality that means  Business and is all about getting the job done and done correctly . He is always on the go doing what ever he can to keep the job or task at hand moving forward . He is great guy and will do whatever he can to help you.

resp.text: Hi Daniel, thank you so much for your positive comments about Main Street Renewal - Birmingham! We hope to be of service to you again in the future.   Warm Regards,  Kerry - Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Stephanie (Steph)
text: Mainstreet Renewal has been rude and unhelpful. We currently lease a home that was recently sold and the new property management company is Mainstreet. We have now been paying them for 2 months received no information regarding repairs lease renewal etc. Then as of this weekend received a letter they would not be renewing our lease. My husband and I have tried to reach just one contact that could provide us information on what is going on to end up with Britney who was rude and unhelpful. They should really read up on the Tenant Laws in Alabama. Would not recommend my worst enemy to this company.

resp.text: Hello Stephanie, We are sorry to hear about your experience but we would like to assist with any questions you may have. Please contact us at wecare@msrenewal.com so we can help with any concerns you may have. Regards, Michelle, Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Dani Bee
text: I have been a resident with Main Street Renewal for a little over a year now. As someone who is in the property management business, I think all property management companies have their ups and downs.  If nothing else, we can accuse Main Street of not setting proper expectations. I have found them to be very easy to work with. I have had minimal maintenance needs (2 or 3) and they have taken care of them almost as soon as I contacted them. I can also say that I have had only positive experiences/interactions with the staff in the office as well. It is always easier to post a negative review rather than a positive. People are more likely to complain, this company has to have at least 1,000 residents, but only about 10 negative reviews. I would encourage anyone looking to rent from Main Street to do their own research.

resp.text:
Hello Dani,
Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. We appreciate the kind and understanding feedback and appreciate your honesty. We understand that we are not perfect, but we strive to be and will continue to work towards that goal every day. If you have anything you need from us, don’t hesitate to reach out. We hope you have a great Friday and a lovely weekend!
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Darren Simpson
text: If you are considering leasing a Main Street Renewal property, I would highly recommend you continue searching for a property not managed by them. They have been a nightmare to deal with since negotiating the leasing agreement. Their front office is terribly slow to response to emails and most of the property are owned by out of state owner/offices so you can never talk directly to anyone you need to. The maintenance service is extremely slow and redundant.  To put in a ticket you must explain the problem in detail, then you wait 2-5 days for a main street employee to come look at the problem you explained in detail. For the maintenance guy to tell you, yes that is the problem. Then MainStreet will call a contractor to fix the problem but you will have to wait for the contractors to schedule an appointment (3-10 days later). Then the contractor shows up and looks at the problem you have already explained twice, to tell you yes that is the problem. He will not have the parts to fix it so he will reschedule another appointment to hopefully fix the issue. (3-10days later). Save yourself headaches and pick a different leasing company.

resp.text:
Hello Darren,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. These types of experiences are not something we are proud to hear of and want to work and improve these types of situations as best as we can. Please email us directly at wecare@msrenewal.com and we will happy to assist with any issues or concerns you may have.
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Kristal Gage
text: Hello, just wanted to share with you all about this company. They are by far the worst I have ever leased from. They maintenance is the worst I have been repeatedly sent request for the same problems over and over. One concern is the garage floods every time it rains and because of this  it has a mildew smell. I have holes on the exterior of the house which has allowed some type of animal to run ramped in the walls. After complaining about the lights shortage from what ever is in the walls tampering with the wires. They said they would be out to take care of the problem and that was a month ago still have not been out. This company is only interested in your money after you sign your lease you are most definitely on your on.  Not a good company to do business with.

resp.text:
Hello Kristal,
This is unfortunate to hear and we apologize for the on-going issues you are experiencing. We will have a technician reach out to you shortly to confirm scheduling options as well as an MSR representative, so we can touch base and work to get this rectified for you.
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Belinda S
text: WARNING! This company is fraudulent and the worst mistake one could ever make. I have only been here a few months and have had a negative experience from the start. The property that i am renting has had plumbing, electrical, and structure problems since the first day i moved in. These were problems that i was not able to see until AFTER i paid my deposit and rent and had my utilities turned on. After many calls and complaints to get these problems fixed, it took over a month to get someone to come address the problems. WHAT PROBLEMS? You ask? Well there were outlets throughout the house that weren’t functioning. When the maintenance guy came out to work on it, he told me that the whole house was improperly wired. So i could not use half of the electrical outlets in the house for over a month. Extension cords and surge protectors became my friends for that period of time. Next, there were leaks from the kitchen sink, from plumbing between the first and second level of the house, from the HVAC system. Water was literally pouring from those places and the company did not seem concerned with sending anyone to fix those problems until i called the health department to inspect the property. Oh yes i have videos and pictures of all of this—- even the mold and collapsed ceiling due to plumbing/ water leaks. And still months after the FIRST call about the plumbing i still have water pouring from the first floor into the finished basement area. None of these problems were apartment until i was already locked into a lease and the company is unwilling to allow me to break the lease nor properly maintain the property! And the list goes in and on about problems... yes and i have copies of all the maintenance requests as well... date and time stamped as proof of this company’s negligence and fraud. And last but certainly not least... this company has put charges on my account for late payment... and when i call to resolve the issue... they put me off by saying someone will get back with me on the issue or try and give some BS excuse for the charges to be on he account. YET AGAIN, i have bank statements showing the dates that payments were made and none of her were late. In fact, my rent payments have been made the month BEFORE they are due. This review is not a joke. I should have read the reviews before renting from this company. DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY!!! If you don’t believe me, go check out the Better Business Bureau website.

resp.text:
Hello Joyce,
We are extremely sorry to hear this and apologize for the negative experience. I will be following up on the final repairs that are open for the garage and basement areas and will have a technician reach out to you shortly with an update. I can see that we do have a request open regarding your ledger, so I will also have this followed up on as well. If other items are still outstanding, please email residentcareteam@msrenewal.com and we will have a representative follow up with you.
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Michael Harlow
text:
Ben Vinson is a great superintendent, very easy to work with, and keeps everything running smoothly

Toyia is great to work with and keeps things going she has been very helpful with anything we needed

Jackie is great to work with she is very helpful with keeping projects moving along

I have no complaints with anyone at mainstreet this is a great company

resp.text: This is wonderful to hear! This team is very passionate about what they do for us here at MSR and we thrilled others can see this as well. Thank you for sharing Michael, we appreciate you! Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Erin Meagher
text: This is by far the worst rental company I have ever worked with. Rebecca Pugh is the rudest staff member that I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with. As a current renter, and a human being for that matter, you would expect some degree of respect from the staff. This woman talked down to me and yelled at me about renting another property through them even after my husband and I went over her head to correct a continued problem! That is no way to treat a current and potential future resident! If you had to chose between Main Street renewal and an apartment complex, go with the apartment.

resp.text: Good afternoon Erin, I am very sorry to see that you have had such a negative experience with us and I would like to get some more details about your experience with us.  If you would, please send an email to wecare@msrenewal.com regarding the situation that occurred and we will have a representative follow up with you directly.   Regards, Kerry - Resident Resolution Specialist

name: Ashley And Janeen
text: I applied here in April I spoke with Rebecca I explained my situation to her before I applied because I didn’t want to waste any money on a application fee. She ensured me I would be fine and she would do the best she could do to help us. In which she didn’t try to help us at all she just got us for a 80.00 application and never called us back after she denied us when I told her the situation up front. It was a quick answer and quickly snatched my money. Every time I emailed her she never would respond.

resp.text:
Hello,
I apologize for the lack of communication regarding your application. What you have described is not aligned with our normal business practices and I would like to look into this further for you. Can you please email your contact information and the property address that you applied for to wecare@msrenewal.com?
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Angela Andrecht
text:
BIRMINGHAM BEWARE! This agency has been by far the worst experience I have ever endured. The communication is terrible all around. From Austin, TX to the Birmingham  office locally- no one knows what is going on. The system they use is apparently full of glitches. Our account has been wrong for over a month (we have substantially overpaid) and all we have gotten are empty promises to have it corrected 'by Friday' and eviction emails, along with one notice taped to our door. We have passed the Friday deadline several times at this point.
From turning on utilities to account errors and lack of communication, this place has been a nightmare.
I do not generally leave reviews, good or bad; however I often read them. This company warrants me writing a warning in attempt to save others from the experience we are having.

resp.text:
Mizbeaux

Please send your contact address and phone number to-wecare@msrenewal.com.  I will review your concerns.
Thanks
MSR

name: Valerie Maldonado
text: This was our first time renting a home. The sweet ladies at Main Street Renewal were fabulous.  They walked us thru the renting process and went above and beyond.  Anytime we had a question they were quick to respond. Rebecca and Laytoia are the best.  I would definitely encourage anyone looking to rent a home to give them a call

resp.text: Valerie , thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Main Street Renewal - Birmingham and to Rebecca and Latoyia!  We appreciate you taking the time to send this along,  and if you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!  Warm Regards,  Kerry - Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Dameon Burns
text: I've been out of a rental property for 2 1/2 months and still not received my deposit. I left the house better than I got it. Had to clean it when I first moved in. It's very difficult to reach someone, as other reviewers have said. They keep saying they'll get back to me, and that they sent it to a wrong address. The last lady was helpful on the phone. Said they were going to overnight it to me. That's been two weeks. I hate to leave negative feedback, but I hate being taken for a thousand dollars more. I guess I have no choice but to seek legal advice. This is a mess.

resp.text: Hi Dameon, sorry to hear this. It sounds like this is resolved however if not please email me at wecare@msrenewal.com if you have an additional concerns. Thanks, Adam - Resident Experience Manager

name: Avery West
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. You can't go see or talk to anyone in person. You cannot apply for any properties in person, it must be online. I paid the $120 in app fees ($40 per person) and was told the next day they can't accept our proof of income because we blacked out our account numbers and other info on our bank statements. My mom has been proving income the same way for 10 years for houses, cars, apartments, etc and all those companies accepted it. Main street renewal would not. The lady Rebecca I spoke to on the phone talked to me like I was stupid when I was trying to find ways to make it work. I had to pass the phone to my Regions banker to talk to her because she was treating me like an idiot and was impossible to work with. When he got off the phone with her he told me we need to find someone else to rent from because they won't accept our proof of income. He seemed baffled and apologized to us that we had to go through all of this. I will never try to rent from this company again.

resp.text:
Hello Avery,
We are sorry to hear this and apologize for the negative experience and want to see if there is another option for you regarding these documents. Our website has a list of documents that can be supplied for proof of income. You can find this list here, http://www.mainstreetrenewal.com/qualification-requirements/, towards the bottom of the page. If you would like to discuss the details of this list further, feel free to reach out to our leasing team directly at birminghamleasing@msrenewal.com and we will have an agent touch base with you. Hope this helps!
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Blessed
text: Reading reviews almost made me go another way. I’m glad I didn’t. I have a nice home. It’s Nicely renovated. I had some issues but the vendors came out and took care of it. They were very professional.

resp.text: Hi Daniels, we appreciate you taking the time to post a review regarding our home and services. If in the future there are any concerns you need addressed please email me at wecare@msrenewal.com. Please make sure to include your contact info and address. Thanks, Adam - Resident Reconnaissance Manager

name: Megan Brakefield
text: We have only rented from Mainstreet for a week and so far it has been a nightmare. When trying to set up our utilities they told us everything was electric when it wasn’t. Whenever we contact the office no one answers the phone. On move in day last week the AC did not work. It took all day for them to respond to the urgent maint request. Two days ago when leaving for work my garage door brackets snapped and now the top panel is completely separated from the rest of the door and they sent someone out the next day to tell us it can’t be fixed. The “urgent maint line” did not listen to what we told him and just said the door would not close. No one at the office will respond and when we follow directions for URGENT maintenance requests they are not doing anything about it. There are many other things wrong with the house but two MAJOR things in less than a week and AWFUL customer service!!!! The house was supposed to be inspected but clearly they did not do that.

resp.text: We are extremely sorry to hear this Megan as this is not the type of move in experience we want to provide. We'll have our team look into these concerns for you and we'll do our best to correct these concerns as soon as possible.  Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Lekiesha Q
text: The home we are currently renting from msrenewal is the epitome of, “what looks good on the outside isn’t always good on the inside.”  We haven’t been in this property a full six months and have had about 6 maintenance issues with plumbing.  I had to miss work today because I wasn’t able to use water in my “home” without the garage and basement flooding with sewage water.  We’ve found grout, banana peels, tampons and cigarettes backing up in our guest toilet within two weeks of moving in.  We were unable to even use the guest bathroom for a month because of these issues.  And when it was “fixed” for the umpteenth time and we finally had guests over the toilet overflowed again, and backed up into the adjacent shower, not only embarrassing us but completely mortifying our guests!  We pay entirely too much money to live in a home that constantly has plumbing issues and smells like sewage!!!!  being here we have seen so many rigged up solutions to problems.  It’s like they threw the home together to get it on the market and make money.  No time and care was taken to produce a quality product.  My husband and I moved in right after our wedding and we feel like we live in a slum!  We won’t be here too much longer and if it comes to legal blows we are ready!  I wouldn’t recommend this place to my worst enemy!  The plumbing problem still isn’t fixed and this house still smells like feces as I type!  Someone else is supposed to come within an hour to fix this issue but I won’t hold my breath..  Not one manager or person with authority has reached out to us to apologize on any level nor has anyone come out to take preventive measures to make sure this issue is completely rectified.  It’s a shame!  We are upset and disgusted!  Never again!

resp.text:
Hello Kiesha,
I apologize for these inconveniences you’ve faced regarding the plumbing system. This is not the type of service we want to provide our residents and we would like to look into this further for you. Unfortunately, I was unable to find any property details for you. If you can, please email us your contact information and property details to wecare@msrenewal.com and we will have a representative further assist.
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Loni Dew
text:
I am a current resident as of June 19,2019. I was told a preinspection done before moving in.. move in and there were leaks from all bathrooms of raw sewage going straight to the garage. I contacted emergency hotline and they sent roto rooter to the home, aftr that no one showed for 4 days. I was told via email from Michelle that me and my family had to be out of the home due to it being inhabitable from june 28-july 8 with hotel reservations and that I would be notified once repairs were complete. I have 3 kids and just moved from Fl. I explained this to them all the could do is apologize  about the inconvenience and that a credit would be reviewed once repairs were complete. Just found out today that the refuse to give a credit due to them paying for the hotel and that an eviction would be filed if rent was not paid today. I am very unhappy, frustrated and upset. This will be 1st and  last year. Im looking into other options as to what I can do about this whole situation. I advise anyone looking to rent from them DON'T!!!!

UPDATE: As of today I received a call from the local branch manager LaTonyia and she was not of much assistance. I am now waiting on contact info for a corporate Supervisor of Michelle Trejo who has stopped responding to my emails. I plan on contacting my attorney later today.

name: Maryam Elmeniawi
text: Very professional and friendly and took care of the maintenance issue.

resp.text: Hey Maryam,  Thanks for the awesome review of your experience with our technicians! We're glad to hear that they were able to resolve any maintenance concerns that existed. If you run into any other maintenance concerns, please don't hesitate to let us know by using your Resident Portal!  Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: bb 05
text: U will never get an agent on the line or someone from the rent office. My home is currently 90 degrees inside since May and no one has come to resolve this issue. From the hot water heater to the pipes busted and the electrical plug units not working preventing me from cooking and bathing and keeping cool in my home im devastated and pleading to break my lease. I have never seen anything like this in my life. I have 9 months left and im dreading this stay. Fox 6 news of Birmingham Al along with the Health department has been contacted im patiently awaiting to expose this company for who they truly are. Every work order and email complaints have been carefully documented im positive MSR will not be around for long

resp.text: Hello, We would like to help and look into this further for you. Are you able to email your contact information and property address the following email address, wecare@msrenewal.com? We will be able to appropriately assist you at that time.   Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Kalean Miller
text: I have had nothing but a wonderful experience with MSR. Everyone has been so nice through the entire process. I have been in my house one month and have had no complaints. I turned in my 30 day maintenance list 4 days ago and have already had MSR maintenance and a plumber out today. I never base my opinions on someone elses review and I am glad I didn't do that here either.

resp.text: Thank you for this feedback Kalean! We are thrilled that you are enjoying our service and your new home so far! We are happy to have you and appreciate you sharing your experience. Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Tuh-mee-kuh
text: Run! They charge a fee for every repair slow to do anything lie about everything. Don't bother!

resp.text: Hi Tamika, we appreciate your feedback. We do not charge any fees to repair items in the home unless they are declared to be a resident responsibility, as stated in the lease. I'd be happy to send you a copy of your lease agreement if you would like. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please follow up with me at wecare@msrenewal.com. Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: P Kennedy
text:
After over 6 months of begging to get things repaired, they still are not repaired. ..even after threatening placing rents into escrow  In the 7th month of our lease, however,  they sold our property to another company.
Be warned...and pay attention to the reviews. Even maintenance complained about how horrible they are as landlords.
They talk a good game before they get your money,  but afterwards dont expect service any better than you would give a fly. If you want empty promises, voicemails, lots of apologies, living conditions just barely above normal standards, or the ability of messing up your credit because you're contemplating breaking your lease? Sign up today!
If you're looking for professional and accountable service....look elsewhere.
Don't get mad if you sign up and receive the same. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

resp.text:
Hello Pam,
I was able to pull up your property details and am currently working to follow up on the current maintenance repairs you have open. If you have other questions or concerns that need to be addressed please email wecare@msrenewal.com and we will be happy to assist.
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: PïnapplePïn
text: Awesome Superintendents! I’m glad to be a partner with Mainstreet Renewal:)

resp.text: Hello Katrina, thank you; we appreciate your feedback!  Warm Regards,  Kerry - Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Michael Harp
text:
No matter how nice the property you find may be, I strongly urge you to refuse business with this company until their Birmingham leasing agent Rebecca Pugh is fired. I am a quality assurance specialist for a customer service department at a national tech company, and if one of my agents had acted in the manner that Rebecca did during our visit, I would have recommended immediate termination.

She first mentioned that she needed to shut the door because "you never know when some F bombs might fly around this place." She then proceeded to contradict everything we had been told by the wonderful contact center agents over the past two days and essentially relegated us to temporary homelessness for over a week without a single ounce of empathy or any options given for a path forward. I confronted her on her lack of empathy, to which there was no apology.

Her behavior was smug, crass, unprofessional, and mean. A true bully in every sense of the word who does not deserve to represent this company.

resp.text: Michael, thank you for leaving us your feedback about your experience at our Birmingham office. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We apologize for the lack of empathy and assistance you encountered and would like to look into this matter more.  If you have any information you would like to give us about what was being said that contradicted what you had been previously told, or how more details about the interaction, please submit that to our team directly at wecare@msrenewal.com and we will make sure that the appropriate departments are notified immediately. Regards, Kerry - Resident Resolution Specialist

name: Chabi 2.0
text: Poor customer service, poor issue resolution practices. Our application was completely cancelled after we didn't enter a nonrequired field on the application. When we called to check on the application and were told we would recieve a call Wednesday afternoon. After not hearing from anyone by Thursday, we called and learned our app was cancelled the week prior without our knowledge. Ms. Rebecca Pugh (I assume she isn't married) voiced the "importance" of said information field and it baffes me as to why their online software doesn't reflect its significance. This issue, I thought, could have been quickly resolved with a phone call or email but it had slipped my mind that we weren't working with a company that cares about its future or current renters. The lack of communication experienced when dealing with this company was concerning. Ms. Rebecca Pugh's RUDE and flippant attitude should honestly be addressed before she finds herself face to face with a customer lesser than me. After reading the reviews about problems with repair work orders, pipe bursting, and AC repairs I am so happy we decided to look into other options. Save yourself the stress!

resp.text: Hello Chabi, We appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention as this is not the experience we want to provide our clients. We will have our Birmingham management discuss this with Ms. Pugh directly and we apologize for the service your received. We understand your decision to move forward elsewhere, but if you would like to work with a different agent, we will be happy to set that up for you. You can email your contact information and the address you applied for to wecare@msrenewal.com and we will have a leasing agent touch base with you. Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Ivan Trusler
text:
Gave these idiots $3200 only to move into a house that's wasn't cleaned, toilet & sinks didn't work properly, bugs everywhere, garage doors didn't work, lights that had no switch to actually turn them on, extension cords ran into a breaker box,  no screens on windows, grass needed to be cut, kitchen sink wasn't attached to counter top, water leaks. Here it is over 3 wks later and I'm still waiting for these to be fixed or replaced.
They'll take your money and you'll never hear from the local people again.
They don't care about their clients nor do they know how to properly run a business.
Anyone reading these reviews run! The few positive reviews are probably employees trying to save their job.
° completely inept
° horrible communication
° they don't inspect homes before clients move in
° Will lie to your face

It's like they walked into a McDonald's and hired away the staff to run this place.

resp.text: We understand that move-in issues are frustrating and we do our best to resolve those as quickly as we can. Looking into your account I was able to see that we have addressed the issues with the cleaning, the sink and toilet. I have reached out to the third party vendor that is handling the electrical issues to get an update and have someone follow up with you. If you have any other issues or concerns, feel free to email residentcareteam@msrenewal.com. Thanks, Kerry – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Lindsay Godwin
text: DO NOT RENT FROM MAINSTREET RENEWAL! DO NOT WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY! They are the worst company on the planet! I will be filing a lawsuit before our lease is done. We pay almost $1300 a month to live in a home that constantly has problems. I cant even take a shower tonight because both bathrooms are flooded due to plumbing issues from a year ago.... Our lease is up in May and Mainstreet renewal will be sorry. I promise you by the time I'm done at the very least the city of calera will condemn most if not all of your properties! I cant wait to contact the federal business bureau!

resp.text: Hello Lindsay, We are extremely sorry to hear this and want to ensure that these items were handled for you. Our records show that our plumbing vendor was able to have this corrected within 48 hours. Can you please email us directly at wecare@msrenewal.com and we will then be able to further assist and investigate any additional concerns you may have. Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Angelique Turner
text: Update on my leasing experience with this company....it has been awful! 1st and foremost I never had a lease with this company. the company I was renting from sold the house to them. the worst mistake EVER! My most recent issue is I was past due on my rent l. This has been my 2nd time in my 12 month lease I've paid rent late. Things happen but I have always paid no return checks on my account or anything. At one point I was ahead on my rental by 1 month. So tried to pay my rent on 1/27 for Jan. Not even 30 days past due yet... I am unable to unless I pay by certified funds. Where? I don't even know where the office is located...again I didn't rent from them. Why? If I have never had a return payment on my account? Also added a eviction filling fee on the account for $700 Really? So your tenants can't come up on hard times? The point is the rent was due Jan and I was willing to pay for it in Jan but now I'm threaten with a eviction and a $700 charge. The rental company I signed a lease with has no mentioning of eviction before 30 days or filing fee in the lease though. All they have to say is that this is vaild and to please pay. The most insensitive money hungry rental company so please avoid! Lord forbid if you have something happen and you can't pay your rent 10 days later and now you're up for eviction and an extra $700 on top of that.

resp.text:
Hello Angelique,
We understand how this can be frustrating and apologize for any delays you have experienced regarding maintenance at the property. I apologize if this information was never presented to you, but for your records our after-hours number for maintenance is 855-239-4530. Today I show that the only outstanding repair in the lock in the washroom and this was scheduled and a confirmation has been sent out to you for documentation. Hope this information helps.
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Anthony Toney
text: A good company to do businesses with. We thank you from Design By Grace34

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to submit a review for us! We appreciate you! Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

text: I have been looking for a house .. I found msrenewal online and immediately liked the housing selection. I’m kinda SHOCKED at some of these reviews.  I had a REALLY GOOD experience speaking with Rebecca. She cared about what I was talking about .. I couldn’t get approved on my own and Rebecca went out her way to help me and tell me about a guarantor ... I got one and was approved for a really great house. Rebecca’s customer service was AWESOME. I can’t see why ppl said these terrible things about her customer service skills!! At any rate GREAT JOB GUYS .... I write reviews all the time n I just don’t think this is a bad company.

We strive to make every experience positive and really appreciate seeing that we hit the mark with your experience with us!  I'm thrilled to see that Rebecca was able to help you get everything needed to become a member of the Main Street Renewal family, and I hope we have many more positive experiences in store for you!  Thank you again for the review!  Kerry - Resident Resolution Specialist

name: Victoria Dawkins
text: Stay FAR AWAY!!!! I promise that it will not take long for you to realize that these homes are not a place for people or pets to live. Let's talk about the local customer service. ATROCIOUS. In order to get in contact with them, you will need to hop into your car, drive to their office in Bham and look them in their eyes. Emails don't work, phone calls don't work, smoke signals don't work. You literally have to go to their office just to talk with them. What about the houses? Those have to be the best right, especially with such an expensive price tag?!?!? Well they are if you like pipes that spew water at random times onto your kitchen floors, dishwashers that randomly stop working for no discernible reason, maintenance requests that aren't completed or completed incorrectly, toilets that aren't connected to their bases, or (and this is my personal favorite) gas lines that are leaking, you guessed it!  Gas leaks that the agents just happen to forget to tell you about as they accept your deposit, first month's rent and pet deposit! So while you're in your new Mainstreet renewal home, cozied up to your new GAS fireplace,  and gas stove top just think to yourself, Have I lived a good life? Have your kids and pets lived a full and enriched life, despite how short it may be?  Am I and my family ready to die because these scions of humanity FORGOT TO TELL ME that there was a gas leak  on moving day? Just don't say I didn't warn you...

resp.text:
Hello Victoria,
This is not the experience we want to provide our residents and I apologize for the lack of communication during your move in back in May. We are actively working to revamp and better our services in this area and we hope you will see these changes soon. I can see that we purchased a new dishwasher for the property and the unit should have been delivered at the end of September, is this correct? We also have a technician going by the property today to address the kitchen area, so hopefully those items will be resolved soon. If you have any other outstanding items that need to be address, please let us know by emailing our Maintenance team directly at residentcareteam@msrenewal.com and we will ensure that a representative follows up with you.
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

text: A good company to do businesses with. We thank you from Design By Grace34

name: Stephanie Snyder
text:
I don't think I have had a worse experience than I have recently with this company. Our local office seems to never communicate with the national office. We call over and over and after sitting on hold for sometimes 45 minutes we are either told they are closed (even though it was five and the message states they close at 6pm) or we have to leave a message and don't receive a callback. Our lease was over 3/2/19. We confirmed this with the company office via email and mail and even did the walkthrough with a local inspector that I had to take time off of work to meet who said the place looks great and thanked us for having it professionally cleaned. We then receive a bill for the month of March with a late fee and have been sent to collections as our local office had no idea that we had submitted our intent to move or even that we had done our walkthrough. Even though we have kept the same renters insurance the entire two years that we have been in our house, they are trying to charge us for two months of not being compliant with renters insurance! The only call we've gotten back from anyone has been from a collections agency. Someone call us back please!!!
Our two years have been awful. The house was put together horribly with stair rails coming off, sinks coming off the walls, plumbing literally put together with duct tape and each time the repairman says it's a common theme.
We initially got our house because it was a neighborhood with a pool which we requested from them specifically. However as this company never pays the HOAs we never got to use the pool. When I asked about it from the local office I am basically told that there's nothing they can do. Pools are not necessary even though my rent us supposed to include the HOA fees.
I'm very frustrated right now. Especially since after paying my rent on time for two years they end it by sending my family to collections over their mistake. Someone please contact me ASAP so this can get resolved.
*****Added -- I have called three different numbers today even a sales rep just hoping they could get me to a person but to no avail. Can someone please contact me!

resp.text: Hello Stephanie, We apologize for the frustrating and confusion regarding your move out details. We understand that our team has been in contact with you and/or your husband regarding this matter and we are working to escalate your concerns and help rectify this for you. We appreciate your patience and will be following up with you again shortly with an update. Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Sherina Evins
text: I was hoping to rent from this company, but after reading the reviews I am so very sceptical. Thank you to all who shared their experiences.

resp.text: Hi Sherina, our goal is to provide our residents with a positive rental experience. We hope you will give us another chance. Thanks, Adam - Manager, Brand Reputation

name: Belinda Johnson
text: Very friendly staff Rebecca was extremely attentive to our needs worked with in every way possible. Would recommend this company to any one.

resp.text: Good Morning Belinda! Thank you so much for your kind review. We are so happy to hear we were able to provide a great experience for you and your family. Hope you have a great rest of your week!

name: jcpull79
text: I like MSR. They have been nice, but at first they needed the right people to manage their homes. Other than some of the non MSR-subcontractors to help with the home, they have been great. The people in Birmingham office are wonderful. It took a little while to get the right employees in there, but that is the way life goes.  You can not please everybody, however. I think people should look at the amount of customers they have that are not posting negatives or ranting . That will show you the true results of the company compared to those who just want to try to ruin a company's reputation without contacting the proper channels. Nobody is perfect and no company is perfect. Some people should learn how to talk to others and maybe they might get better service. I can be very assertive without be trashy or indignant. Wonderful place, and I have already inquired to extend my lease, and my original lease is not even over yet,  GREAT JOB BHAM!!

resp.text: Hi Jcpull, thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback we really appreciate it and I will share this with the Birmingham office. Please email us at wecare@msrenewal.com if you have any concerns in the future you need addressed. Thanks, Adam - Resident Reconnaissance Manager

name: melissa Lloyd
text: My advise is to STAY AWAY from this company, if you want to actually get anything accomplished!!!They are Very slow and unresponsive to calls and emails. Do not return phone calls/voicemail. And if you do happen to get through to a live person after sitting on hold for 14 minutes, they are very disconnected and act as if they do not want to help

name: Katlyn Turner
text: Beware! This is a terrible company to lease from. I have rented from multiple different companies and landlords over the past 8 years and this has been the worst experience I have had. Moved in to plumbing, electrical, and ac issues, then the so called "maintenance' people are not even certified in there respective field. Just whomever is the cheapest. I was told by them that their so called contractor "has his story" when I asked him to leave after he missed three scheduled appointments to fix our plumbing issues. Then the head guy in Texas gave us his personal info so we could contact him with our issues. Well when we left him a voicemail, his assistant contacted us and asked why we were coming to him with issues. Please listen to me when I say, do not lease from them. They do not care about you and hire the cheapest labor and material to fix these houses up. Yes, the kitchen has granite and new cabinets but do not be fooled by the facelift.

resp.text: Hi Katlyn, we are very sorry to hear that you have had a difficult experience with our maintenance.  We strive to provide great customer service and excellent care during your lease with us.  Our maintenance technicians are trained in general maintenance issues and our local vendors are highly trained in more specific areas.  If you are still needing assistance with these issues, please reach out to us at WeCare@msrenewal.com and a Resident Solutions Specialist will be happy to help.

name: Reverend Right
text: Worst rental company ever. They purchased the house from Sayco and its been hell ever since. Numerous requests about water issues have yet to be resolved. Their joke of a maintenance team is unreal. Appears to be a boyfriend and girlfriend that are uncertified and very much unqualified to do anything other than change a light bulb. They must friends or family members to somebody that works at mainstreet. I personally think they're both drug addicts. They lie, lie, lie...and everything that they actually do attempt to fix, ends up looking like some mess a crackhead would do. Very messy work. I'm pretty sure they are very cheap labor. They'll come out to your property and say that they'll be back with what they need to fix the problem and never show. Then you'll get an email from main street talking about the problem has been fixed and the work order is now closed. There has to be some type of legal route to take against these type of practices. I'll be looking into it pronto.

Hello Reverend,
We are sorry to hear that this transition has been so difficult for you. We will be happy to assist, but unfortunately were not able to find any property details for you. name: Shanta Johnson
text: I have never been treated the way that I have been treated with this company, Mainstreet renewal. I applied for a home a week ago, only to be told that I needed a guarantor by this worker name Rebecca in Birmingham, Alabama. I did ask my aunt to sign with me if she can and he agreed. The weekend past and I noticed that my application was canceled and when I called back, I spoke with someone named Tiffany, who claims that she worked closely with Rebecca. She stated that they had to reapply me and my aunt and call me back later. I later received a call from Rebecca telling me that I was denied by her because my check stub looks fake. First I would say that I am a nurse/ csr and no one at the office had contacted my job or my aunts job. They went on to say that the companies wasn't coming up in her computer. I then asked her to call the jobs and she stated that she had made her decision and that was all she could do. I then asked to speak to a manager and she told me that she was the highest authority in the building. I asked for the corporate number and she told me to Google it. This was very unprofessional of this company. She actually said that corporate gave her the authority to do what she does. Everytime I called, she would say rude things. After waiting about an hour and calling back, Tiffany verified that there were actually 5 mangers in the office and that she lied to me. This company has got to be better. I felt discriminated against because my manager also went through this company and stubs are identical. I am going to get my lawyer in on this and he will be contacting this company. There are good people that wants to help people, but I don't feel these are the people are the ones. Please stay away because you wont be treated equally or be respected.

resp.text:
Hello Shanta,

I apologize that your experience with us has not been a positive one so far. I want to ensure you that here at Main Street Renewal we comply with the letter and spirit of the Fair Housing Act, and all applicable state and local laws, regulations and ordinances prohibiting housing discrimination against certain persons.

I have been in contact with via email and have submitted your feedback over to our leasing department and upper management within the Birmingham location and we will be happy to investigate this further for you.

Regards, Whitney - Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: PrincessJolly30
text: When your trying to rent from them helpful. Once, your in the home and have issues. They don't return calls and are very slow about fixing basic things. I'm dealing with issues from first day of move in. Be careful. Homes are new properties but the leasing team in Birmingham is terrible and will lie. The company don't return calls and only commuicate thru emails when your having issues that need to addressed over the phone. One of then worst experience in Leasing In Alabama. Advise, it's best to ask others renting from same company before signing to companies as this one.

resp.text: Hi PrincessJolly, we are so sorry that you are experiencing issues with your home and are having difficulties reaching us.  Please email us at WeCare@msrenewal.com and a Resident Solutions Specialist will be happy to assist.

name: Charis Mitchell
text: This company is horrible! I came over from Sayco in Dec was told would have to sign their lease and we could continue to stay here! From Dec to now we have had the same water leak that’s supposedly getting repaired every time some one comes out! Water bill $300 every month. Every month I’m calling asking about the new lease no answer! On June 14th I received a letter to vacate by July 9th!!!! I call no one has an explanation as to why, visit the office they don’t know what’s going on!!!! How am I to move my family under 3 weeks not happening!!! I had to get money to hire an attorney to get some help!!! Worst company ever!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
Hello Charis,
I am extremely sorry to hear this and am working to get a better understanding of your situation and what happened here. I have reached out to the managers at our local office for additional feedback regarding the notice you received. I also want to confirm that the leak at the property was taken care. Please email us directly at wecare@msrenewal.com.
Thanks, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

text: Haven't had much trouble with this company at all. Rent payments are easy, and work orders are processed fairly quickly for repairs.

We are happy that everything is working out smoothly for you! We appreciate the review and hope you have a wonderful day!

name: James Monroe
text: If you are thinking of doing business with this company, read reviews carefully in every state they do business in.  They can save you from making a mistake.  I've sent at least a dozen emails, snail mail and phone calls, with no resolution.  When I do actually get a person on the phone, they are clueless and don't care.  I'm done making attempts.  They will now be answering to the Attorney General of the State of Texas regarding my complaint.  I suggest everyone else who has a valid complaint do the same.  Document everything and file your complaint in the state of their headquarters in Texas.  It shouldn't be this way, but that is how Main Street has forced it to be.

resp.text: Hi James, sorry to hear about the negative experience. If you have a concern you can email wecare@msrenewal.com. Please include your contact info, address and complaint. Thanks, Adam - Resident Experience Manager

text: Prompt, professional, good workmanship.

resp.text: Hi Connie,  Thank you for taking the opportunity to leave us an excellent five-star review! We are pleased to see that you've enjoyed your experience with us. Please let us know if you have any questions during your time with us. Our Resident Care Team is always happy to help!  Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Karla M
text: WHERE DO I START??!! I AM SITTING HERE IN MY HOME AS I TYPE THIS WITH A THROBBING HEADACHE FROM THE CHEMICALS THAT HAVE BEEN SPRAYED ON THE TOXIC BLACK MOLD THAT WAS FOUND IN MY DEN WALLS!! TOXIC BLACK MOLD IS SUPPOSED TO BE TREATED CAREFULLY SO THE TENANTS WON'T BECOME SICKER! MAINSTREET SHOULD HAVE MADE ARRANGEMENTS TO PAY FOR US TO STAY IN A HOTEL AT LEAST THROUGH THE CLEANING PROCESS SO WE (INCLUDING A 2 YEAR OLD BABY) WOULDN'T BE AFFECTED BY MORE SPORES AND THE STRONG CHEMICALS USED TO KILL IT!!!...WORDS CAN NOT DESCRIBE HOW ANGRY I AM RIGHT NOW. EVERYONE IN THE HOUSE HAS A HEADACHE RIGHT NOW AND NOW MY THROAT IS TINGLING!...THIS WHOLE SITUATION IS OUT OF CONTROL! IF WE GET "SICKER" FROM THIS MAIN STREET WON'T GET NEXT MONTH'S RENT!!!!

resp.text: Hi Karla, we are sorry to hear that the repairs are affecting the health of you and your family this is certainly not the experience we strive to provide our residents. I am going to escalate this issue with our Resident Care Team. Please email wecare@msrenewal.com so I can keep in contact with you and provide updates. Thanks! Adam - Resident Experience Manager

Meanwhile its raining in my kitchen now no one here or called to say they on the way today tomorrow. This company needs to go out business worst customer service ever.

I finally got in touch with the property manager Tracy from Birmingham and she was very rude telling me she don't know what my rent is going up to, wait to Wednesday and call back, just really talking to me as if she really don't care about my concerns. I had to hold for an hour when the time was supposed to be 23 mins to be told my rent will be 1245 baby bye. Y'all will not pimp me for that amount when I'm paying 895.00 for the same house.

Please reach out to us at WeCare@msrenewal.com and a Resident Specialist will be more than happy to answer any questions you have during this transition.

name: Ms V
text:
Main Street Renewal purchased the property I live in and previously rented from Sayco Properties a couple of months ago.  I put a maintenance request in regarding plumbling/leak issues on 11/3/17.  No one never came out.  I put another request in fo r the same problem on 11/13/17.  No one never came.  A couple of days ago I received my water bill.  It was $383 For one month.   My bill is mormally $135.  I immediately put in another maintenance request and called them the next morning since about all my maintenance request for the same issue that had never been addressed.  They put me on hold and came back and said they contact the plumbing company,who was assigned and the would be contacting me to come out.  I still never received call.  I called back the next day and got someone different and the said the would do a new work and send it to a different plumbing company and I would be contacted within 4 hours.  Well I never got a call.  I also had the water company to come out and it's nothing on their end.  They informed me that it was nothing on their end they would be reading the meter again soon for the next bill and it looks like it going to be extremely high again.  I  called main street back this morning to let them know the 2nd plumber never contacted me.  They informed that that plumber service Georgia only.  After a extremely long hold the came back and stated that they had assigned yet another plumber and I will be contacted within a coup or of hours.  We will see how this goes.

Update :
6/20/18
Main street took over the property I've been renting back in November 2017.  My lease was expiring on 3/31/18.  I receive a notice in December stating I needed to either give them 30 days notice that I would be vacating at end of lease or I need to contact them about applying for a new lease with them and my rent would go from $875 to $1,050.  I began contacting them in January 2018 regarding a new lease because I decided we would stay another year
I never got a response.  I called and was told leasing team was in a meeting and they would call me back.  They didn't.  I sent another email I'm January, February and March.  Never got a response.  They still continued to bill me for the same $875 after March.  I have always paid rent on time.  I received a letter on June 14, 2018 that was dated June 8, 2018.  They letter stated that my lease ended on 3/31/18 and they would not renew and I had to be out by July 9, 2018, less than 30 days.  I immediately called.  They stated that the owner had decided that they didn't want to rent anymore and wanted to renovate and sale.  I explained I know they have that right but less than 30 days was not enough time to find a new home nor apartment and have funds for security deposit, 1st months rent and other moving related expensive.  I asked if they could give more time they said what the owner said goes and they couldn't do anything about it.  As I go back and look at the notice I received when Main street took over.  It names Main street as the owner not anybody else. This has really put my family and I in a bad position, I have a newborn grandson and a disabled finace and still haven't found somewhere to go as well as the money we will need to move.  I hope everyone's else experience with them will be better than mine.

resp.text: Hi Verandia, we sincerely apologize for the delay in repairs being completed and the inconvenience this has caused. Could you please email me at wecare@msrenewal.com with your address, details and my name in the subject line and I will personally look into this matter. Thank you.

name: Melody Jackson
text:
Please do yourself a favor and run in the opposite direction of this company. They’re extremely nice getting you moved in, but then once you’re in they switch it up. At my move in inspection for a BRAND NEW home there were ants downstairs, and I was stepping on them left and right. I pointed the issue out to the leasing agent and he documented it. When I asked for pest control to take care of it, the maintenance team told me it was my responsibility, even though the ants were there, in a brand new home, before I ever moved in! This company is deceptive. I would also like to note that a lot of the recent reviews that I just looked at have maintenance issues with similar responses from ARM, most of these tenants happen to be African American as well. Coincidence? Possibly. Probably not. Do yourself a favor and don’t waste your money or time locking into a lease with these rip offs.

Oh- forgot to mention that the garage at the property must be the “mini” edition, sold no where else, coming exclusively from, the biggest rip offs in real estate history- ARM. And there’s a water heater in the corner of it as well, so the most that can be parked in there is your kid’s tricycle.

name: Nichole Megginson
text: I have been nothing but happy with the service that Alabama Rental Managers has provided for me over the past few years.  I have had the opportunity to visit my properties and meet my residents.  My properties are in great shape and the residents had nothing but good things to say about my management company.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  We appreciate you as our client.  Please let us know if you need anything and we will be happy to assist you!

name: Sam Chat
text: Great houses! Beautiful homes! Easy to move into! Once you're in, they cut you loose. We had issues with several things in our brand new home. Porch post was not flushed and we were told that happens all the time. The tub would leak whenever we took baths. The tissue holder and towel rack fell off within the first week. Neighbors (also brand new home) had the same or worse issues. When we called and scheduled a maintenance appointment, we were told to be thankful we weren't being charged (all things the builders/property managers failed to ensure had been properly installed). Their office does not return calls, emails, or texts! Communication is as bad as an as is car warranty, it expires the moment you move in and they simply do not care.

name: Aaron Bibb, PMP, PMI-ACP
text:
Alabama rental managers were easy to work with over the course of 3 years.
Whenever I had an issue with maintenance or a question they always responded promptly.
I would definitely use them again if I ever needed to.

resp.text: Thank you Aaron!

name: Ashley Israel
text: I went with this company because they had nice houses and I thought why not. My first impression was nothing but amazing. My old house caught fire and they helped me as quickly as possible to help me and my four kids move in a new home. Fast forward, the home has been great however they don’t fix anything. Our toilet stopped up, the told us to call and pay for a plumber. I’m like ok, I’m renting this house not buying it. If I wanted to pay for everything that goes wrong, I would’ve purchased a home. Now there’s mold in my bathroom, they’re saying it’s from water being splashed on the floor. However, I have bath mats, and I get up all excess water my kids have on the floor. I have lived in many houses before, and never had this issue. If the maintenance team was great, I would definitely renew my lease, but due to the horrible service from them, when my lease is up I will definitely be moving.

name: Renee Yeager
text: Dalton Cox was the agent that handled my rental application. He was very prompt, thorough and friendly. He assisted me throughout the entire process and remained professional through my thousand and one questions. He helped me jump through all the hoops that was covid on my credit and helped me get into a beautiful home with enough room for all of my children and our pup, a home that my kiddos deserve. I am VERY pleased with the application process and am looking forward to leasing through this company. I’m hopeful my tenancy will be as wonderful an experience.

name: D R
text: Dalton, Pierce and Blake are very professional, proactive and was able to answer any question we had.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, D R!

Thanks so much Donetris S.

Thanks so much for all Dalton did for me.

name: Laura lee Johnson
text: Dalton was super helpful. I really appreciate all his help.

name: Satrina Melendez
text: My name is Anastacja and Dalton and the entire Staff at Alabama Rental Maagers was absolutely Amazing and a Dream to work with.. Easy process fair Pricing and a Beautiful Brand New Home.....Thank you...

name: Brittnee Jeffrey
text: This company will not fix anything you’ve asked. Leave you in the sweltering heat during mid summer. When you move out, they will not give you your deposit. After it is said and done they will send you a bill for “damages”, “cleaning fees”, “lawyers fees”, etc in the thousands of dollars. They are well known to have a modus operandi of being crooked and back end bills. Do not rent from this company. This company is awful.

name: K Swain
text: Beware! This rental management company does not care about their tenants. They don’t fix issues in a timely manner! Know your legal rights and tenant laws! Do not waste your time or money with this company! It took them over 8 months to fix one leak in the unit. The only reason it was fixed at the time was because I hired a lawyer, otherwise, they would’ve continued to give me the run around. On another occasion, there was a leak that soaked the carpet.They advised me to put towels down to soak up the water but never came to fix the problem or extract the water which caused mold! I wouldn’t advise anyone to rent from them! Service is HORRIBLE!

name: Tabitha Pierce
text: Straight garbage company, STAY FAR AWAY, or know your warranty of habitability laws really well and have a lawyer on stand by because you'll need them to get out of the lease. We have been without working septic for over a month and they'll make every excuse to avoid maintenance. The lawyer even said he's very familiar with them, sad excuse for a company.

name: Cacie colleen
text: My husband and I were in a rush to find a house, we had 5 weeks until we had to move several states over. Dalton and Kim at Alabama Rental Managers helped us find a house. Dalton helped us through every step of making sure we had a house before we had to move. We are now one week away from moving in and we are extremely happy to have had Dalton with his positive attitude and enthusiasm through this process. He has answered every single question I have had, even the common sense questions and he never showed annoyance, he is always so happy to help in any way possible- no matter how big or small. We highly recommend Dalton.

name: Trelanda Holmes
text: Everyone at Alabama Rental Mangers were very helpful and professional. I want to give special thanks to Mr. Dalton for assisting and walking me through the entire process. Job well done Mr. Dalton!

name: Amanda McDonald
text: We have communicated with Dalton almost every business day for a month. He has responded to every voicemail, he has kept in constant contact with us throughout the whole process of renting an apartment. He has gone above and beyond and been so patient. We think of him more like family now than just someone we spoke to in the leasing department. Thank you Dalton for everything you have done for us!

name: Hunter Young
text: Most people take the time to write negative reviews, but I am here to brag on the assertiveness and professionalism both Dalton and Blake have offered me through the renting process. They have both gone above and beyond with answering calls and emails in a timely manner. They never seemed bothered and were more than willing to help each time I had a question or concern. Not to mention, they helped me find a beautiful home that fits all of my needs. Will be continuing my journey with ARM!

name: Justin Childs
text: After numerous reoccurring maintenance issues, mold was discovered in the home I was renting. After weeks of arguing, they finally agreed to move me to a different property. However, I was still forced to pay $1,500 in rent fees while I was not living there because I moved out right after paying my rent on time. After move out I had the property cleaned and carpets professionally shampooed to get my deposit back. A property inspection was conducted and I was told verbally by the inspector everything was in good condition and I was encouraged to turn my keys in early. Nearly 90 days later I was refunded only $200 of my initial $1,200 deposit. When I asked why I was charged $1,000 in maintenance repairs after the initial inspection, I was told a “secondary inspection” was conducted on the property that identified $1,000 worth of maintenance that needed to be done. I’ve been renting for 15 years by far the worst experience. They do not care about their tenants only fees and penalties. Just look on Yelp for more stories exactly like mine.

name: Nija Harris
text: Definitely worth it.  Fast process the leasing and applications department worked hard and the approval process was only a few days. Highly recommend. Definitely polite, helpful, and friendly !

name: chase clemons
text: Very helpful and fast through the whole process. Would definitely use them again.

name: Nunya Business
text: DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY. THEY ARE SUPER SKETCHY AND DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS AT ALL. We were supposed to view a home and were working with Dalton, but after we scheduled the appointment he called back to rescheduled multiple days later. We had explained how we were a newly married couple looking for a home but that when we found one it was always taken before we had the chance. He reassured us that he knew what that was like and got us all excited about the house... well, that was 2 days ago and I just checked the site... the house is now deposit pending. No one called to let us know or to cancel our viewing that is now a few days away. We had gotten really excited about this home and working with a company that seemed so professional... nope. They’re out to get their money... I’ve worked in sales my whole life and would never do business with people as unprofessional and careless as these people. BEWARE. I had heard from other people that they felt “dooped” by this company and now I know what they mean. Use another reality company. I can assure you they will treat you better and actually care.

resp.text: Allison, we regret to hear of your experience with Alabama Rental Managers.  We work hard to explain our process for securing a home when we speak to prospective renters as well as include this information on all of our website listings and FAQ's.

name: jim bush
text: I love these folks! I've done work for them for years and I'm in the process of renting a property from them now. It's always a pleasure to do business with them

name: Brenda Hannah
text: Amazing staff, can't find better people than Dalton and Blake, would highly recommend this company to do business with, they go above and beyond for you. Always extremely professional!!!

name: Suzanne Smith
text: I want to tell you what a great experience I had with ARM, thanks to Dalton Cox. He was so kind, professional, prompt, and honest. He went over and above to make my boys and I feel like the most important people on earth. I hope you are able to hang on to him, because he is definitely a positive influence for your organization.

name: Shaquoria Garrett
text: I had a pleasure of working with this wonderful group of individuals. When I called, I was given informative details on how to apply for a residence. I never had to worry about the company not returning my emails or phone calls. Everyone was very nice and worked hard on making sure I had everything I needed to move forward. I would definitely recommend this company for residential rental in the near future.

name: Tim Bryant
text: Dalton and everyone else at Alabama Rental Managers have been always helpful and friendly. Seems like a very professional group and business - of which they seem to always have the best interest in mind for both the owner of the property and the renters

name: Alfred Figure
text: Thieves! Do not rent from these con artists. They will put a bandage on a item in the home before you move in but will deduct it from your deposit after you move out. They have no respect for law and reputation. I threatened to write a review and get a lawyer and they told me to go right ahead because they aren’t concerned with reviews because they aren’t losing business and they always win in court. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.

name: hien le
text: Could not have asked for better help in finding my home! No questions were left unanswered. I really appreciate the team and teamwork put together for me. If you’re looking for a team that will stand behind you through the ups and downs in finding a home, this is it. I could not say enough thank yous!

name: Papis Diop
text: Rented with this company for 3 years. An Excellent company to work with. The team is very professional and ready to work with any concerns you might have.

name: eric thomas
text:
I have had a pretty bad experience all the way around. I have a call into the owner and hope to better understand how their business operates. My biggest frustration is items that were not addressed when we moved in as well as items that we found shortly after that are not correct. A simple example of 1 item (keep in mind there are several) is an entry door handle that was installed backwards. My door can be opened from the outside because it’s on backwards. I have pictures. The company agrees it is on wrong but since it’s easy to fix it is my responsibility. The lease agreement is set to basically remove them from doing anything at all unless the roof is falling in. A rental from them is pretty much like being a home owner and not a renter. I have rented and owned so I understand normal maintenance. It’s crazy to think as a rented you have to install a door handle correctly from installation errors. As a renter with Alabama Rental Managers you are responsible to clean up the “black mildew” on the sheet rock 1 week after you move in. I am using the word “black mildew” as requested by the Director of Service. He asked me to use that word specifically in place of any other word.
Crazy to think as a renter your unit will have a pink polkadot on the carpet the size of a basketball. Crazy to be told that the carpet stain would be removed and if it didn’t come out it would be replaced prior to move in. Crazy to think we would spend WEEKS without AC in the unit only 6 weeks after moving in. Crazy to think I would be told to crawl into the attic and locate the AC unit and check several components prior to dispatching a technician out on site. Even crazier to think after 3 service visits the AC unit still did not work but luckily by this time it was fall and not needed. Just all in all I am surprised the service is so poor. Be sure to read the contract very closely as I have found the renter will pay for a lot more than I think they should.

I will add that I have pictures and time stamps of my displeasure. I will also say read their reviews to hear what others are saying. 3 star rating is what they have and someone else mentioned they have bad reviews removed. Not sure there.

All in all if you want to rent a property but pay as the owner it’s a great rental company. They expect you to come out of pocket for everything before they even know what’s wrong. I can attest to that. I also forgot to mention the AC unit when it was inspected was said to never have had a service. The technician was a third party and we found debris in the drain pan from the install. There were wore strands, wire nuts, insulation, instructions, ETC in the pan. The technician said if the unit was ever serviced the technician servicing would have been expected to clean that. I asked for a copy of previous service history on the AC unit and they would not provide it. I let it go when they finally agreed to cover the cost. Yes that’s right. They wanted me to pay to have the AC unit serviced 2 months after I moved in. Lol. Lots of pictures to share with anyone at ARM who would like to talk and review. Thanks.

I almost forgot that we asked for all the animal hair to be removed the day we moved in. The same day. Once we finally heard back from them a week later we were told it was our responsibility and do we have a pet. So funny. But no we do not have a pet. Either way we did clean the unit. Whoever moved out before we moved in should get the cleaning fee back. I have pictures of the unit not cleaned either. They offered to send someone if we wanted but this was weeks after we were in the unit. We had to clean it ourselves. I asked if I could get a cleaning credit when we moved out and you know the answer... no. I guess it is a GREAT business model. They charge you to clean it for the next person but then make the next person do the cleaning. I bet 99% of the time they get away with it. Crazy.

name: Ashley Lescure
text: Very patient, helpful, kind team to work with.

name: Debbie Waltrip
text: It was a very pleasant process.

name: Sarah Black
text: I lived at a property under ARM for a little less than a year. Took EXCELLENT care of the property and had the place spotless before I moved out. Go ahead and expect that they will nickel and dime you out of every cent of your deposit and then some. I had the carpets professionally cleaned at move out by a highly reputable company (per my lease and move-out instructions). Spent $190 on this service. They STILL charged me $150 for carpet cleaning saying the company didn’t use “a heat extraction method”... which was stated nowhere in the lease or in the move out instructions. They do NOT care about people, they care about scamming you out of your money.

name: Chase Burns
text: I worked with Dalton on a rental home. He was very professional and helpful. I would highly recommend using Alabama rental managers in the future!

name: Holly Nuffer
text: The first day a house was on the market, I tried contacting them. I tried again the next day. I tried a total of four times. I left voicemails and even a text message to Blake's personal phone and no one called me back. I see that someone has put a deposit down on that house. They only answer the phone when they want to and they don't return phone calls.

name: rottencheeseo
text: I won't spend this time bashing this company and say all sorts of negative things because each experience is different. All I will say is, if you are a tenant, it is best you read and FULLY COMPREHEND their lease and policies BEFORE YOU SIGN and commit. They follow the lease too the very fine lines and will use that to justify any action you may violate. A lease is a contract, and if you think this company will not follow their own document, than you may need to just keep shopping around. From our experience, as long as you pay on time and do what is required, than they pretty much leave you alone. Maintenance issues are up to the Owner and the company only acts as the middleman to handle issues, so don't really feel mad if they don't fix something for your rental (we never had that problem because they fixed all of our issues); you should feel mad at the owner for making the decision to not fix an issue. We fixed things ourselves mostly to avoid the hassle of begging and waiting, but when we requested help to repair an issue, they were right there to take care of it as soon as the owner gave his approval. If I could do it all over again, I think I would have rented an apartment just to avoid all of the extra costs we had to spend for the lawn care, minor maintenance issues, pest control, and cleaning the gutters. However, I would say this, treat it as a business and do your part as a tenant. Any rental house will require the tenant to do more than they would for an apartment. There are not perfect rentals! WE just made sure our calls were pleasant, we followed the lease line by line, and made sure we had the money to handle extra costs to keep up the rental, and we walked away with our sanity. Good luck!

name: lashonda crutcher
text: Blake was helpful, kind, and on point. He looked out for my best interest. He was there through the whole process. Always keeping me updated. I was never in the dark. He was also very knowledgeable. Anything i asked he had an answer for. I felt like i had a team mates through this whole process the full ARM family was amazing im so thankful. this process was easy,dast, and stress free

name: Kiva Karmen
text: I am a homeowner that allows ARM to manage my property. I see a lot of 1 star reviews and ranting but please allow me to be unbiased. Every homeowner is not a slum lord. Tenants need to understand that they have responsibilities also. If a tenant does not read the contract properly with understanding then unnecessary stress is coming; lawn care is the is one of those things. I cannot speak for other homeowners but if a tenant does not want to provide lawn care then it can be negotiated to be included in the rent. Problem solved. Yes, there is a bit of frustration with ARM not having an in-house maintenance team and yes they do their best to keep homeowners in the loop concerning such things. The company is not corporate. Sometimes I even thought of getting a company that has an in-house team, however, the costs will raise rent. Nothing is free or perfect. This is a growing small business. A tenant cannot determine the type of homeowner he/she will get and neither can a homeowner determine the type of tenant they will get; I have had a tenant from hell that had the perfect application as well as the mature and great tenants I have now. If you have never worked with the public or in public service, please try it. It is extremely stressful dealing with all types of personalities and you do not know the mental state of each person; it can be difficult to discern. My point is respect others and do your best to maintain self control because you do not know if an ARM staff member just got insulted to the nth degree on a previous call by someone who was taking their frustrations out on the staff, or if the ARM staff is trying to resolve the problem for the tenant but a homeowner is being difficult and cheap. Could ARM restructure some things, yes however the cost could be greater for everyone. Everyone desires more for less these days and it is difficult to find the ideal balance sometimes. So do your best to be kind; you truly do not know anything unless you can see the details and gain understanding.

resp.text:
Kiva,

Thank you for your review. We value you as an owner!

name: Sherina Evins
text: Alabama Rental Managers are awesome!! My entire process took all of 4 days, from walk through to finish. I met with Ms. Barnes and she was sooo amazingly patient with me. I will definitely recommend this company to anyone who is looking for their next home.
