Sincerely,

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: Karamel Kandy
text: I rented from them for 2 years. They didn’t have it ready by move in. The grass wasn’t cut. All the locks didn’t have keys. I had to buy new locks myself.  No shower curtain rod in the master bathroom. Paint in the tub. Several other issues. The carpet was worn. When you get ready to move out. Expect a move out instruction list. The list will also require that you have the carpet professionally cleaned. You must turn in a receipt within a couple of days after turning in the keys. Proving you had the carpet cleaned professionally. Pay attention to the damage list you sign. Somethings were omitted. The guy told me that maintenance was going to take care of it. I left the property cleaner than it was when I moved in. I still received a bill for almost 400.00 after they deducted my deposit. Thanks god I bought a home. I’ve lived in apartments for years. Never had to do all the things that they require. At least the apartments come freshly painted in the inside. Take pictures and make the person who does your move in inspection write down everything. Even if they say maintenance has already been notified.

name: Jessica Wallace
text:
If I could rate them a negative 1 I would. I had to move quickly. When I put my deposit down I mentioned an odor or urine near a downstairs bathroom. When I moved in they had done nothing. Told me it was because the house was vacant for so long and the sewer gas was coming up. This is not true. I found out that they knew about the pet urine and chose not to replace the carpet.

When I moved in they kept the house at 55 degrees. When I turned on the heat it activated the urine smell. I told them about it immediately. That was three weeks ago. I can’t even eat in my own home because the smell is so bad. The carpet guys came out to replace carpet today. When they pulled it up they found urine stains all into the living room. They immediately called ARM as did I.  ARM claimed that the stains are not urine in the living room. Not true. You can see the pictures. ARM is having them put the urine stained carpet back on my floor. You can see pics of what they are putting back on my floor. The smell is unimaginable. I can’t believe I’m living like this. Jordan in maintenance hung up on me. Maintenance claims it’s a quality control issue and I can’t get quality control to call me back. David is the head of maintenance and he’s doing nothing. I’ve sent pictures and they are ignoring me. I can’t live like this. Rent isn’t cheap here. These folks should stick to section 8 rentals.

resp.text:
Dear Jessica,

We apologize for the delay in response to your review, but did want to make sure we reached out. Thank you for your feedback, as it helps us improve on our end in regard to customer service. We would like to recompense you for the difficulties you experienced and contact information is provided at the end of this reply, for your convenience.
We did want to take a moment to respond about the sewer gas odor. Our records indicate that this odor was reported before move-in, and it seems that our team wanted to rule this out. After it became apparent that the odor was from pet urine, our team worked diligently to get approval for new carpeting to be installed in the reported areas of the hallway and living room, as well as replace the baseboards in the bathroom. We hope your experience has become a better one since new padding and carpeting was installed. We also sincerely apologize for the unpleasant experiences you had. If you should have any further issues, please don’t hesitate to contact us immediately. In order to be recompensed for your difficulties, please contact our office at your convenience, and ask for Sarah R. We value you and thank you for being such a great renter.
Sincerely,
Our Team

text: This is a first class operation with first class people.rite from the beginning all the way to the end ,they made my wife and I feel like we were working with longtime friends.the staff is super helpful and courteous to work with and we will recommend your services to our friends.thank you so much for all you have done for us ,we are so happy with our new home.

name: Matthew Richardson
text: Blake was awesome! He took care of our needs and responded almost instantly with any questions we had. Thanks Blake! We love our new home.

name: David Croswell
text:
This company is ridiculous and all they care about is $$$. DO NOT USE THEM! Called about a property on a Saturday and left a message to schedule a showing. Called on the following Monday and was told that the next available day to see it was the following Saturday, which was fishy to begin with, I told them I was available the day I called or the next day to see the property. They assured me that I would be the first to see the property and had nothing to worry about. That Saturday at 7:30am, 4 hours before my showing I received a text and email that my showing was cancelled. After asking for a phone call for an explanation all I got was a TEXT that someone paid a deposit that morning in the Dropbox. Yea ARM, not buying your excuse!!! I told the realtor that no one told me that I would need to put a deposit down ahead of my showing just in case. All I got was an "I apologize", yea not good enough, I scheduled this over a week ago took time out of my day. The best part they had the audacity to ask me if they could help me find another property, yea after this, I'm good!!!
From other reviews I've read it looks like I avoided a HUGE headache just to live in downtown. ARM do NOT ever ever contact me again, oh and learn some customer service, it goes a long way. When someone says call them that doesn't mean text them!

resp.text:
David,
Thank you for your feedback.  I apologize you did not have a good experience with ARM and this feedback is important to us in our ongoing customer service training.  We have two agents who show homes and both were booked up early last week due to the short holiday week.  We did receive a deposit on the home, however, they have cancelled their application so the home is back on the market.  The deposit is what holds the home off the market which is listed on our website and also on the listing description.  We would love to have you as a resident if you are still searching for the perfect home.  Please call me directly if I can be of assistance.  Thank you.
Jenny Moore
VP of Operations

name: Eddy Getty
text: Excellent Property manager. Always prompt and on time very patient when it came down to various questions asking overall very nice guy

resp.text:
Eddy,

Thank you for the five star review and the feedback. Please let us know who helped you so that we can let him know about your review.

Sincerely,

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: Brooke
text:
We moved into a house rental in May of 2018. No one ever met us at the house they just left the keys in a lock box. Still to this day I have never met anyone from the company. They never checked up, or introduced themselves.
In October of 2018 they emailed me saying they have had our address listed wrong the entire time. Our address was 14461, but they had it listed as 14451. They apparently didn’t think this was a big deal and had someone change our mailbox without telling us and none of our bills or mail got delivered to us. Our water was even shut off and we had to go without water for an entire day. I called to ask them to pay the fee to have the water turned back on and they refused. Our waste management bill never got delivered and our trash can was taken back by the city and we had to pay a fee for that as well. Not to mention all of our checks, licenses, etc. we had just ordered because we moved to Alabama.
This mistake could’ve been prevented if they would’ve double checked their records and made sure they had the correct address listed. I also don’t feel like an email was appropriate to send in such a serious accident. If they would have owned up to their mistake and offered to reimburse us the amount it took to change all of our records i would not be writing this review. I asked to speak to a manager several times and they kept saying “we already spoke to the manager and he said there’s nothing we can do for you”.
I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THEM TO ANYONE. Save yourself the hassle, they are unorganized and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Dear Brooke,

Please accept our apologies for the late response to your review. It is our normal practice to meet all residents at the time of move in and we are unfortunately, at this time, not aware of all the circumstances involving your particular situation when you did move in. Regarding the error in address: Unfortunately, we were given the wrong information in regard to the address of the property prior to construction completion and were not aware ourselves that the property address was incorrect. Four months into your residency we were notified by a third party that the address might be wrong. Upon confirming that the address was incorrect, we acted as quickly as possible to notify you of the error. Our records indicate that we provided a few options for you to get your water bill, we do apologize for any other inconveniences you experienced.
Sincerely,
Our Team

name: Janett Sanders
text: Blake took over my account at the last minute after a coworker was sick. He has done a Fabulous job of keeping me updated with any relevant information. The house is really coming together. Thank you Blake!!

name: Dramesha Jones
text:
Susie Barnes from the beginning was absolutely wonderful.

Susie came out to show me the home and was very pleasant and professional. Susie was very knowledgeable about the property and made sure she told me everything I needed to know about the property.

Susie was with me every step of the way. I couldn't have asked for a better person to work with.

name: Shatoria Harris
text: The move in process was pretty good. Blake was nice. However, after living here for 18 months, I don't recommend renting from this company. First, it started with a squirrel in the attic. It took them 4 months to get the squirrel out for good. The first few times patch work was done and the squirrel was able to get back in. It had gotten so bad my neighbor begin to complain because she could hear it scratching and running around. Second, the hot water heater went out four times. I went several days without hot water. Yes, hot water is essential! Nobody want to pay a great amount for rent and have to take cold showers or boil water. The first person came and the water went back out 3 days later. Then, the next person came and the hot water lasted a week, and back out. Then, it went out a third time. The fourth time it is back hot again for now. Yes, I have emails in reference to all of these issues and how long it took for each request. Last, the moving out process is horrible. They are scheduling viewings, while my son and I still live here. I think this is very rude and inconsiderate to have random people in and out of a place we still live in. I expressed my concerns and all I got was sorry you feel that way. Run as fast as you can!  Please look at other options! Nevertheless, this horrible experience have motivated me to become a homeowner. I am currently taking the necessary steps to be able to purchase my own home!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Harris!

name: Alison Petro
text: Horrible experience. The last month of our lease our water was turned off without our knowledge or consent (water is provided with the unit/paid along with the rent on the portal). The payments manager Krispin Watson was made aware that we were not going to pay rent for a unit where provided utilities were turned off. She didn't seem to care, and we were still charged a late fee…for a unit where a necessary utility was turned off for no good reason. She later insinuated that we were being lazy and causing issues for no reason because we wanted someone from maintenance to finish turning the water on at the unit, and she would charge us $100 if we didn't finish it ourselves. Later someone else let me know that our situation did not constitute that charge, so watch out. Robbe Gay was great and thankfully made it right for us, which was all we asked after the list of issues we experienced. For 6 months of our lease they showed our unit to prospective buyers, so half the year we were emailed and texted frequently to let in viewers/inspectors and to step outside. Our ceiling leaked in rain twice, for well over a week both times, and we had to threaten to break lease before they finally urged the owner to fix it. One of our vents was not hooked up to anything, and cold winter air could be felt instead of heat (our bill was outrageous). They told us to change our air filter to “fix it”. We had to send them a photo from an inspector before they believed us and fixed it. We got many emails the first month or so threatening our utilities, mainly to put our water in our name (which we couldn’t do because per our signed lease it was to stay in the owners name) and that if we didn’t pay our electricity bill they would turn it off (had to send them 3 pieces of mail showing it was in OUR name and WE handle that). Evidently the “owner was confused”. Bad experience from start to finish.

name: Kenny Jemison
text: Kristen at ARM has worked consistently with my husband and I concerning a rental home. I am expecting any day now and our living condition caused for an emergency  evacuation. And she has worked her magic to make sure we are seen about and she seems to care about our current situation. She has really helped make our day better.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!  We are pleased Kristen has taken such good care of your situation.  Call us if we can be of further assistance!

name: Faith Covenant Church of God
text: ARM has been a company of great service to my family. When we were relocating due to my career, we contemplated whether to sale or rent the home we were leaving. From the first contact with ARM, they provided excellent information, advice, and opportunities. Within 3 weeks, they had our home rented and prepared for a tenant to move in. From that point on, they have handled everything with excellence and professionalism. They are thorough, well versed, and very easy to make contact with. They regularly keep up with our property. Bottom line, they make life very easy for someone like me who lives 2 hours from the home they rent out. I recommend ARM and their entire staff with absolutely NO RESERVATION!

name: Savannah Rigby
text: My experience with ARM has been a series of unfortunate events. For several months, our dumpster was never taken care of. We had trash overflowing despite a number of calls from several residents in our building. Eventually that was taken care of, no explanation or offer of compensation given. Most recently, our grass was not mowed for a total of two months. I called, emailed, and corresponded with the "director of quality control" Mindy, throughout this entire time. She blamed it on HOA and never offered to hire a private service to take care of it. Our yard looked abandoned and it led to a flea infestation due to the excessive overgrowth. My dog would get swallowed every time he went outside to use the bathroom. Eventually the yard was taken care of (two months after I initially complained/informed them of the neglect), Mindy claims a private lawn service took care of the yard, but it was actually the owners of the building next to our unit who took care of it themselves. Again, no compensation was offered to the residents for this inconvenience. I am now being charged an additional $250 for a vendor coming out and checking our air conditioning because he "didn't find any problems with the HVAC." The vendor told us that the unit was poorly constructed and we would have to suffer with the heat, but he did unclog a pipe and refill our anti freeze, yet we are still being charged because he found no issues with the unit (although he did address two problems: lack of antifreeze and a clogged pipe). Despite numerous efforts to reach out to supervisors, directors, and even the owner of the entire rental company, no one has offered clarity or compensation for the ridiculousness that we have had to deal with at our time with this company. My roommate and I are both students who work full time to pay our rent and other bills and the fact that the employees of ARM have been completely unwilling to work with us or offer us explanation for a myriad of problems we have tried to address is beyond frustrating. I am writing this review to warn others not to get locked into an agreement with this company and also to maybe get a response from ARM since regular attempts at correspondence have led me nowhere. This review has also left out the attitudes we have dealt with when communicating with several of the employees of the this company when getting our lease signed/renewed and general questions we have had in regards to the property.

name: kellie jenkins
text: If you could rate in negative stars I would. We rented 6 years ago and it was a nightmare. They immediately gave the house back to fhe owner without giving us a final walk thru with them and then tagged us with a huge amount of problems even down to missing light bulbs. They kept are security deposit and have the nerve to say we still owe them money after no final walk thru!

resp.text:
Hi Kellie,

Our quality control team works hard to ensure that it is a fair process at move out for both the resident and the owner.
If you would like to reach out to us at our office to ask questions about the decisions made six years ago, we would love to discuss it with you.

Sincerely,

Our Team

name: Isabel Rowe
text: Alabama rental managers are crooks . When I notified them I was not renewing my lease the harassed me the last two month of my lease scheduling appointment to show the house before I even moved out . It got so bad I left two weeks early . They don’t manage their properties. Shortly after I moved in the deadbolt locks broke when I reported they stated I had to replace them . I explained to them the locks where that way when I moved in . They still tacked on that reposibility to me . I moved out left the property in better shape than when I moved in they tacked on miscellaneous charges cleaning charges , weed n feed charges . The only thing I can say they can justify for taking some of my deposit is for not mowing the lawn which I could not get to prior to my move . After everything they kept my deposit never took care of property . The house had no screens it was in bad condition when I moved in . I will never recommend Alabama Rental Manager to anyone . in fact I am reporting for extortion.

resp.text:
Hi Isabel,

We regret that your experience was a negative one. Per the lease agreement, if residents have given their notice to vacate and the house is being advertised, showings are scheduled with a 48-hour notification. This is a typical procedure for showing homes whether for sale, or for rent. With single-family housing, any damage that occurs after a resident takes possession, as indicated in your review, is normally tenant responsibility. We would love to talk with you further to go over your experience. Someone from our team will reach out, and provide documentation for your convenience.

Sincerely,

Our Team

name: Kaye J. Jones (Konnect With Kaye)
text: Will find the smallest issues to keep your deposit. If you go with this company, leave the place as is and don't wast your time cleaning! Also make sure the place is clean, before you signed your lease because the owner left things that we were charge for in the cleaning bill. Take pictures!

name: dona a
text:
Thank you Alabama Rental Managers, and especially,  Blake, for putting your ALL into what you're doing!  It has been obvious to me, from the very first message I left (on a Sunday evening thinking I would get a response on a day the next weekday) I left inquiring about the house I now have my very own key to, that you are not just "working" but your are living your life in a way the people who you are helping feel listened to, heard, and like you're being authentic with them, as well as really wanting to do the best you can to help them.   I can honestly say I have never met anyone, in all of my professional life or personal life who literally says what they mean and means what they say and keeps their promises any better than yourself.  Committed is just the beginning of what I would describe you as and I can't help but HOPE and somehow believe that ARM must know how blessed they are to have you on board.  If not, I hope this review finds them very proud and with the intent of never letting you leave their company!
Getting  back to my initial inquiry to see the home my little girl and I both will be calling "home," from the surprise of hearing back from you personally in response to my message the same day, on the weekend, a Sunday nite, I can't thank you enough.  The surprises of how each and every time I have needed you, you going above and beyond any "job description" and just "being there" and getting things done as well as providing a feeling of true help and support, has been beyond anything i EVER expected and I thank you, AGAIN, from the bottom of my heart!
Alabama Rental Managers, thank you for helping myself and my child get into our beautiful new home:)!

name: Deanna Blevins
text: I was charged very unfairly on the amount upon leaving. I will be glad to discuss with anyone why you should not use this company.

resp.text:
Hi Deanna,

We would love to discuss with you further.
Please give us a call at 205.440.0922 and ask for Sarah R.

Thank you,

ARM

name: Monty Bridgewater
text: Blake was friendly, helpful and always on time! He answered every question quickly. He made the process easy! Thank you!

name: Sulmorko Nightstorm
text: They company is a total waste of time. Do NOT rent from them.  If you move in go ahead and count your security deposit as a loss. The staff never returns phone calls and gives incorrect information that ends up costing YOU money in the end. Charged us rent for almost a month we didn't live there while claiming it was our fault. They charged us $200+ for cleaning the place when we had it professionally cleaned before we left. Kris is the worst. She's always got an attitude and treats people like they are criminals and below her. I will never again work with this awful company. They are the absolute worst.

name: David Gibson
text:
TOP NOTCH company! These guys did an awesome job find a renter in just a few days for me, kept them happy, and me out of having to deal with anything.  Very prompt to return calls and answer all questions... Always a great attitude from every person there.
I have and will refer them to anyone looking for someone to handle renting their home for them.

resp.text: Thanks David! We value you as a client!

name: Pamela Phillips
text: Rental Manager Melissa Gilbert was awesome! Very easy to work with and really listened to what we wanted! Always quick to respond to questions and gave good recommendations! Thank you so much for all you do!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Pamela!

name: Beth Wilkinson
text: Very positive experience!  My property got rented very fast. Blake McCranie was very professional, courteous and patient. Would highly recommend him and your company. Thank you for all your excellent work!

resp.text: Thank you Beth for your review!  We appreciate having you as our client.

name: Regina Wallace
text: Blake was awesome. Very courteous and professional. He handled all of our needs expeditiously and was great to work with! Harper was also a delight to work with!

name: Ryan Fogg
text:
Highly recommended...

Had a deposit on a rental home and signed the lease during a Thursday afternoon.  Walked around the unit during the inspection and found nothing worth noting to fix.   We showed back up the next morning to start moving stuff in and saw a disaster.  Severe flooding from some rupture or busted line or pipe on 2 floors, flooded carpets, wooden floors, and the drywall ceiling had collapsed on the 1st floor making the house inhabitable.
We thought we would be stuck with this nightmare since we literally signed the lease the afternoon prior, even though we hadn't moved in or anything yet.  They made a quick response to inspect the unit and since our other lease on the house was up in 3 days we had nowhere to move into at that time.
Jenny, the VP, took time away from the office to find homes in the same price range we needed, and got them to freeze all postings, and personally met us at the houses to look at them the same afternoon.  After finding one we wanted we were able to redo another lease and she did everything right (crediting the days we didn't stay at the old house, transferring the deposit, etc. etc.) and we ended up having a small credit line to our balance.

We received a personally written note from her in the mail wishing us the best on the move and if we needed anything feel free to contact.

ARM is the 4th rental company I have dealt with in Birmingham and this has been the most professional, fair company of the four.  Will use again if we decide to rent after this one.

name: Brennen Lummus
text: The worst communication I’ve ever experienced with a company. They also allowed our lawn to go 3 months without being done when we paid for lawn service. Overall just not a good time.

name: Donna Allen
text: The staff of Alabama Rental Managers are awesome to deal with.  From the Leasing Agents to Customer Service and the Maintenance Department, they all are helpful and polite.

name: Austin Morgan
text: I have always rented apartments until a little over a year ago and found a rental house.  I am so happy that I found this house.  My experience has been so much easier with Alabama Rental Managers than with any apartment community.  They are quick to fix any issues that come up.  I will be here until I am ready to buy a house.  I would definitely recommend Alabama Rental Managers to any of my friends.

resp.text: Thank you Austin!

name: LA Woman72
text: Our experience with Alabama Rental Managers has been mostly positive. Melissa Gilbert is always very friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and extremely prompt with her responses to our concerns. She is definitely one of the standout employees that we deal with on a consistent basis because we know that whatever issue we have, Melissa will make sure that it is addressed. Melissa is definitely a 5 star member of the ARM team.

name: Daniel Vest
text: Our agent, Blake was very helpful and knowledgeable about every question we had pre-signing and during move-in. He was a pleasure to work with on attaining my new property. Furthermore, ARM was very fast and thorough with my application process even though they had no idea I actually needed an answer back on my application quickly as I had another property in mind if it fell through. Would recommend this realty company for your next home!

name: Corie Niederecker
text: Alabama Rental Managers is an awesome property management company.  Customer service is friendly, courteous, and prompt.  I would advise users to email for communication.  We have been clients since December and have had maintenance 4 times.  They have been awesome!   The maintenance issues were normal housing issues such as HVAC and a pipe broke outside.  The team is always willing to listen and offer advise.  I also appreciate the flexibility!  When we moved into Birmingham from Chicago, they made our transition very simple.  My husband a I had just sold our home, and wanted to rent for a while before purchasing in the area, and they were able to provide information  on areas to rent and we were able to view properties within 24 hours!

name: Al S
text: My experience has really been above expectation. Susie Brown is very courteous and great at what she does. She’s always available to help when we need it! Talk to Susie

resp.text: Thank you Al for working with Alabama Rental Managers.

name: Natasha McCaleb
text: Stay away! We rented from them for a year and 7 months. In the beginning, working with them was normal. However, when my husband and I decided to buy a house and we stared the move-out process, working with them became a nightmare. I had more trouble terminating the lease than buying a house. Furthermore, we spent $200 to get a professional cleaner in order to meet the move-out checklist they send you when you terminate your lease and then spent $140 on a required professional carpet cleaning to also meet their standards. We were only refunded $110 of our deposit. They will take every opportunity they can to cheat you. They also penalized us for leaving items behind that belonged to the owner. So if you want to save money by renting, do not work with them. You WILL lose money.

name: Elizabeth Farr
text: Alabama Rental Managers is awesome!! The people are great and make the process easy... The leasing office is wonderful and Kristen was extremely informative and helpful all the way through. You should definitely use them!! 0

resp.text: Thanks Elizabeth for your kind words! We appreciate you!

name: Terri M
text: Just rented a home from them. From the agent, Susie taking the time to show us a home that we were not even scheduled to see to doing the application and moving in.  Thanks everyone for making the process easy.

resp.text:
Terri,

Thank you so much for your fabulous review! Susie is a wonderful agent and goes over and beyond for customers. She will be happy to hear about your kind words.

Sincerely,

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: K K
text: Please bring to Sylacauga, Alabama. The area is growing. Try areas Hwy 280 and Hwy 21. Maybe even Fayetteville by Pursell Farms Golf.

resp.text:
Hi Kay Kay,

Thank you for your wonderful review. We do have properties in Sylacauga. Our leasing department can help you find a home in that location. Give us a call!

Sincerely,

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: Kerri Wallis
text: This is by far the WORST rental company on the face of the planet. I will never rent from them or ever recommend them to ANYONE! I highly recommend renting from ASI properties instead of these crooks.

resp.text:
Dear Kerri,

We appreciate every review posted, as they help us improve our customer service for both our residents, and our owners. After researching, I found that our records indicate that our customer service agents endeavored to be as respectful and helpful as possible throughout every interaction. If you have any specific concerns you would like addressed, we welcome you to contact us with them so that they can be responded to in detail.
Thank you,
Our Team

name: Josh Gillaspie
text: Very good customer service! I have been very pleased with this company. They were able to ease the stress and anxiety that comes with finding a new home. I really enjoyed working with them.

resp.text: Thank you Josh!  We appreciate you very much!

name: Coby Chavers
text: I was having a tenant issue, and initially I was struggling to get the details and communication that was necessary. Within the next few days I was contacted by Kristen Lankford. She was able to clearly communicate with the tenants and with myself. Her professionalism and quick response time helped me to feel more at ease about the difficult situation. I was very pleased with the way she handled my property in this situation.

resp.text: Thank you so much Coby!  Kristen is a valued asset to our team and I am pleased she could assist you with your property needs.  Please call us if there is anything we can do in the future to assist.  Thank you for trusting us with your property!

name: Carli Bryant
text: Alabama Rental Managers is by far the most unprofessional rental company that could ever exist. They are highly unorganized, and their customer service leaves much to be desired. Please note that they will take their precious time doing anything related to maintenance. If you have a maintenance emergency, please expect to to wait years before they move a finger to fix anything. However, you better believe they will move mountains when it comes to rental payments. I am not writing as just another angry tenant. I have never even made a late payment, and I have been more than patient and reasonable with them. Nevertheless, they take my hard-earned money and move like molasses when I ask to have maintenance issues repaired. More specifically, I had an emergency with one of their rental properties, and they would not move a finger which led to costly repairs that I had to fix myself. Any maintenance request takes weeks to be looked at. Therefore, I found myself paying super costly repairs that were not my responsibility, per my lease agreement. I am looking to move elsewhere, because I am fed up. I pay too much in rent to be treated like I live under low income housing. I wish I had done some research before renting under this low grade and trifling company. Please take heed to this review and avoid the headache and unnecessary expenses that comes along with this company.

resp.text:
Carly,
We would love an opportunity to discuss your specific maintenance items further.  Some maintenance items do take longer than others depending on Home Warranty companies and cost for repair approval.  Our maintenance team works diligently to get all maintenance requests resolved as quickly as they are able.  Please feel free to call Jenny Moore, Vice President of Operations, at our office if you wish to discuss your issues in detail.

name: Janece Knight
text: I rented from them from December 2013 to December 2014 because i had to move on short notice, my garage door never worked, the bushes to my home was never cut it trimmed so me and my family always had to walk around the pathway to get to the front door, my heat went out 1 week into the stay and had to be replaced, my shower head cracked and had to be replaced, and now they are late sending me my deposit even though they say they send it within 35 days it's been 45 days and I've called numerous times and always get the run around and have yet to get a call or email back about it. Don't get me wrong the house was nice and in Hoover but there were too many issues. So if you plan to rent from them please beware.

resp.text: We apologize your experience was not a positive one. We have taken great measures to add qualified team members and new procedures to better assist our home owners and our residents. We have implemented new processes in our maintenance department since you moved out in December of 2014 which has allowed us to provide better customer service.  If you are still needing further details regarding your deposit and I will be happy to assist you.  Thank you for your feedback, your feedback is important to us.  We wish you the very best.

name: Laura Gardner
text: Being a previous renter of Alabama Rental Managers I would highly recommend their services for anyone looking to rent a home. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They always addressed maintenance issues in a timely manner.  I don't sweat the small stuff that comes with any rental home so I would say my experience with them was an enjoyable one!

name: Jacob Large
text:
Blake was awesome and made the process very smooth. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.
I would highly recommend 100%

resp.text: Thank you Jacob!

name: Courtney Jones
text:
Blake McCranie did a fantastic job assisting my family wih the rental process. He was able to meet with us the same day we requested to view the home! My roommate and I fell in love with the place, and we needed something rather quickly, so he helped to expedite our application process and move in date. He was very professional, polite, and returned all calls and texts very quickly! I would recommend Blake and Alabama Rental Managers to help you for all your rental property needs! On the administrative side, the crew at ARM was awesome! Thanks to Harper for all of your hard work and assistance. We are very happy in our new home!!!
Thanks for everything!
Courtney Jones

name: Bruce Tang
text:
This review is a long time coming. If I could give this company ZERO stars I would. Customer service is totally a lost concept with this organization. Their only concern is getting your money and nothing else.

If you have a maintenance issue you can be rest assured you won't hear from them. My first year my refrigerator went out and numerous calls (more than 10) were made to their maintenance department and ONLY because a desperate call to the homeowner resulted in getting the problem fixed (this was AFTER 30 DAYS of waiting). Of course all food/milk was spoiled! This was just the beginning of maintenance problems that never got resolved until direct calls to the owner were made. The accounting department is just as bad. We're still owed nearly $500 after having to wait 60+ days after moving out.

I personally own 2 homes and would NEVER hire ARM to handle my affairs. You're better off just managing your OWN property if you want to keep your tenants happy and willing to renew their contract with you year after year.

Update from response:

I only stayed the 5 years time due to cost (moving & reorganization). The inconveniences during that time I had to bear. Again, direct calls to the owner were the only reasons we got anything fixed. It certainly wasn't because of your maintenance department which had failed in spades.

resp.text:
We are truly very sorry you feel that our customer service is lost and were quite surprised to read this review as you stayed with us for 5 years.  I wish you would have called us to discuss your concerns while you were still living in the home so that we could have addressed any issues you might have had.

I do see 4 work orders for the refrigerator during your first year.  Each time the home owner was made aware and they only authorized repairs which were completed each time.  Unfortunately, ARM cannot authorize replacements without the home owner approving the cost for their home.  I do not see a work order that took 30 days to complete.  The last work order for the fridge was in October of 2013 and took 10 days to complete.  I only see 4 other maintenance items during the last 4 years of your stay with ARM.

We mailed you a full refund for your deposit within the 60 day time period required by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Law.  It unfortunately does take the full 60 days for us to complete this process.

We wish you the best of luck with your future.

name: Dana Trasom
text: My husband and I have been very pleased with the services of Alabama Rental Managers. They have done an excellent job at communicating any maintenance needs when they arise, our payments are always on time and their staff is very professional. Blake has been great!  I strongly recommend their management services if you are looking to lease your home.

resp.text: Thank you Dana!

name: notreace
text: Super Professional company! These guys did an excellent job finding me the perfect home.  Thanks for being so punctual and stepping up the rental business is Birmingham!  Great work Blake!

resp.text: Thank you Jimmy for your kind words! It has been our pleasure!

text: I signed my first rental lease today! Blake was awesome and very friendly ! He made the whole process very simple!! You are all absolutely amazing! Your whole staff has been so kind both Kristen and Robbe were always there to help me and answer any questions I had!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing ARM!!!  Welcome Home.

name: H. Ty Coleman
text:
Hello , My name is Ty Coleman and I am the human rescource director for a mid size company . When I hire candidates from out of state I recommend Alabama Rental properties. I rent form them as well and they have been wonderful to me and my new hires who need help on housing. Terri , is a true blessing and really cares about helping people. I can not make any higher recommendation than ARM and especially when working with Chad and Terri.

Thanks ARM !
Ty

resp.text: Thanks Ty for your kind words and all that you do!

name: T D
text: This company, ARM, is a complete joke.  Fake phony ‘have a great day’ and ‘thank you for your business’ are meaningless words they say.  They have no control over the owners of the properties they “manage” and have violated my lease agreement on many occasions so far in the one month I’ve been leasing.  I’ve spent hundreds of hours texting, emailing and speaking to completely incompetent employees and owners at all levels of ARM. Run for your livelihood, because the constant incompetents and messages from ARM will surely drive you insane and not allow you to just live in peace.  I wish upon all wishes, that I had never heard of, nor rented a property from this company.  Steer clear, way clear or you will regret it for years to come.

resp.text:
Dear TD,

We regret that your experience has been a negative one with certain aspects of the rental process. After reviewing work requests, we found that we were in communication with you whenever an order came in and notified you when the owner was sending a contractor to take care of any reported issues. It is our process to email and text residents for maintenance repair requests or other maintenance issues that need to be completed by owners. It is also our process to educate our owners regarding proper owner/resident etiquette. We thank you for bringing to our attention any concerns particular to these areas and are working to iron out the wrinkles. If there are any additional concerns, please contact us. We value you and thank you for being a great renter.

Sincerely,

Our Team

name: M
text: ARM is definitely not the worst experience I have had renting, but I would try and find something else if you can. They just are very disorganized and have a lot of weird practices. Firstly, the security deposit was ridiculously high. I have never paid more than $350, and theirs was $850. After paying this I was surprised the state my unit was in when I moved in. It was disgusting. They forgot to even paint the backs of the doors, and I was definitely misled regarding the size and general appearance of the neighborhood. There is trash everywhere, and there is no maintenance basically. My tubs back up, but the third party maintenance makes me so uncomfortable that I don't ever want to open a ticket. I will be very glad when my lease is up. I have always paid on time, but nothing about the lease is negotiable. I work for a company in their contracts dept, and ARM uses classic language that traps renters and leaves you with little to no options for negotiation. Again, I will be very glad when I can get out from their trap.

name: Jacob Large
text:
Blake was awesome and made the process very smooth. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.
I would highly recommend 100%

resp.text: Thank you Jacob!

name: Jodi Tucker
text: The whole process was smooth! Alabama Rental Managers worked with me to meet my desired move in data! Blake was available to answer all of my questions and very good to work with!

resp.text: Thank you so much Jodi!  Happy Holidays!

name: Melvin B
text: Don’t waste your time with this incompetent staff and inept leasing agents. Particularly Kristin.  She has no clue about property management and the customer service is absolutely horrible. They can’t answer basic questions concerning a termination of a lease. She kept saying “the lease is written to be followed, not broken”.  What kind of statement is that? I’m relocating out of state for a new job opportunity & and I understand the repercussions of the lease termination. My only question is, the reletting fee does not stipulate a time frame when its to be paid, and that is not outlined in the lease.  However in the letter I received after my 60 day notice states it’s due immediately. That’s all I wanted clarity on and she took offense and was absolutely rude. At any rate, my attorney will have this from here on out. Word to the wise, DO NOT RENT HERE. SAVE yourself the headache of incompetent staff.

resp.text:
Melvin,
Thank you so much for taking the time out to call me to discuss your concerns.  Please feel free to call me anytime if you have future questions.  I wish you the very best with your upcoming move.
-Jenny

Melvin,
I am very sorry to hear of your negative experience.  Please call me directly if there is anything I can assist you with for the remainder of your lease.  I will be happy to assist you with any questions you may still have.
Thank you,
Jenny Moore
205-824-5008 ext. 111

name: Jordan Gable
text: I never write reviews, but I had a great experience with Kristen this morning. I acquired online and got a call back almost immediately. She has a great spirit and I felt like she was very knowledgeable and efficient about everything I had concerns about. I definitely recommend this company if you are renting a house.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback!  We appreciate you.  Please call us if we can be of further assistance.

name: Kelli Bates
text: My husband and I have two houses rented out through ARM and have been extremely pleased.  They take almost all the work out of having rentals.  We have used them for about 6 years and never have to worry about our homes.   I would highly recommend and have recommended others use their service if the need arises.  Their employees are highly professional, I have had great communication with them and am confident in their abilities to take care of me and my property.

name: Dallas Blakeney
text: ARM has been excellent in the handling of my investment property. Paige, Sydney, and Cindy have all been extremely helpful. They have excellent communication with the owner of the properties and definitely keep you in the loop of any issue that arise. From what I can tell they are working with the tenants very well to ensure maintenance issues are resolved in a timely manner. The Direct deposit to my account makes payment from the renters seamless. I did have one tenant that was having an issue paying, but that tenant was evicted and I received payment for past rent in a timely manner from Paige and the attorney. Arms even waived their tenant finder’s fee for the next tenant to compensate for the inconvenience. I have recommended ARM to my brother also since he lives out of state. It didn’t take ARM long to find a tenant for his property either. They really do make having an investment property easier as I have done it by myself and have something to compare too.

name: kenyata harris
text: It does not matter who you call or when you call....you will never get someone to answer or call you back....I'm done calling.  I am filling a report with the BBB today, this place is sad.  Don't ever let them manage your property

resp.text: Thank you for choosing ARM!!!  Welcome Home.

name: Shanen Tolbert
text: Blake was so helpful with everything and made the process go so smooth. He helped us get into our new home as quickly as possible! Thank you for everything!!!

resp.text: Thank you Shanen.  We appreciate you!

name: Hannah Marie
text: Blake was extremely pleasant to deal with and very kind when we were running late because of traffic. The entire experience was awesome!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.

name: Matt Carrier
text: Unprofessional. I will leave it at that. Good luck doing business with them. Be prepared to get screwed over.

resp.text:
Dear Matt,

Our customer service representatives strive to provide the best service possible for everyone they interact with. We appreciate feedback that helps us improve in this area, but it would be helpful if you could provide specifics so that we know what was “unprofessional”. Please give our office a call at your earliest convenience, and ask for Sarah R. We would love to discuss the details of your experience.

Sincerely,

Our Team

name: Danielle Foy
text:
Jenny,
This shows how much integrity this companies lacks.The application fee was not the initial issue so I believe that we should correct ourselves on the truth.When you have a website that states, "We strive to be upfront and transparent with our clients", but  a company like yourself are able to pick and choose what documents are verifiable after the application fee has been paid is very amusing.I could continue in details about my experience with ARM and its unprofessional staff but I will allow others to form their own viewpoint  about your company.I wish this company the very best.
With Blessings,
Danielle Lockett

resp.text: Thank you for your recent review of Alabama Rental Managers!

name: Feyna Advani
text: I will never rent from them again. Required us to clean and do lawn care before move out. Still charged us for cleaning and lawn care. We made sure it was spotless before we left. Office staff is rude, and barely responds to calls. Would not negotiate an earlier move out, rented it and still charged us rent. Just not good to deal with.

name: Phillip Standridge
text: Great experience. Excellent staff. Blake McCranie was my agent. Also, Melissa Gilbert is a delight to work with as far as handling your maintenance needs.

name: Daniel Bennerson
text: Blake was an amazing agent very informative and help. Made the process very quick and easy. Would highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you Daniel!

name: notreace
text: Super Professional company! These guys did an excellent job finding me the perfect home.  Thanks for being so punctual and stepping up the rental business is Birmingham!  Great work Blake!

resp.text: Thank you Jimmy for your kind words! It has been our pleasure!

name: M
text: ARM is definitely not the worst experience I have had renting, but I would try and find something else if you can. They just are very disorganized and have a lot of weird practices. Firstly, the security deposit was ridiculously high. I have never paid more than $350, and theirs was $850. After paying this I was surprised the state my unit was in when I moved in. It was disgusting. They forgot to even paint the backs of the doors, and I was definitely misled regarding the size and general appearance of the neighborhood. There is trash everywhere, and there is no maintenance basically. My tubs back up, but the third party maintenance makes me so uncomfortable that I don't ever want to open a ticket. I will be very glad when my lease is up. I have always paid on time, but nothing about the lease is negotiable. I work for a company in their contracts dept, and ARM uses classic language that traps renters and leaves you with little to no options for negotiation. Again, I will be very glad when I can get out from their trap.

name: Chris Williams
text: Renting from ARM was a terrible experience. Like most people said the customer experience we received from them was non-existent. I couldn't believe how unprofessional they were. They'll treat you like royalty up front until you sign the lease, then as long as you're paying your bill you won't hear from them not even if you're trying to get in touch with them. They never answer or return calls. Move out was a hopeless experience. Our house was in better condition than when we moved in and they still kept half our deposit. And would you believe it they won't return any of my phone calls in protest of the charges they made up. Ridiculous.

name: Kellie Ashley
text: Susie was very nice and informative.

resp.text:
Kellie,

Thank you for your five star review and your feedback. We are thrilled to have Susie as a member of our team and are happy to know how helpful she was to you. She works hard to help clients!

Sincerely,

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: Sheri L
text: Great customer service -  the agent answered the phone on a Sunday and she helped us get an appointment to see the home we were interested in quickly.   Can’t beat that

Thank you for so much for your feedback. We are glad you were happy with our service, and able to get scheduled to view the home you are interested in.

Our Team at Alabama Rental Managers

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
My family and I lease a home that ARM manages, and thus far and regardless of other "negative" reviews, we have been happy and impressed and have had zero issues with the level of service we have received from them. Maybe you get back what you put out into the world. I have no issues with home inspections, I was glad to have them do it. Then they can see how well we take care of the property; we've even improved it at great expense.
We had to move on the spur of the moment, so leasing a home was the only option, and it was made simple and easy with Alabama Rental Managers. We take care of a home as if it were our own (as I would wish for a tenant to do if I were leasing my home) and do improvements and repairs ourselves as much as possible, so we haven't had to contact ARM very much, but when we have, it was easy as pie, and we were helped very quickly. For others that I know who are looking to possibly lease a home, or who need a property managed, I always pass along information about ARM to them.
Thanks for all you do!

resp.text: Thank you Amanda!  We appreciate your business.

text: I worked with Blake McCranie on finding a house to rent and he made it so simple. He was great and worked with my schedule to help me find what I was looking for in the time frame I had. Everyone was great during the whole process.

name: Ryan Parish
text: Absolutely one of the worse leasing companies I have ever dealt with. Their only concern is $$$$. They truly do not care about their renters. Mark my words, FIND ANOTHER COMPANY. Hell, half of the time they don't even answer their phones.

resp.text:
Ryan,
I received a call from you yesterday at approximately 1:30 pm.  This is the first phone call I received from you.  We apologize if you tried to call and received our office voice mail or a busy signal.  As we discussed at length yesterday, you and all other lease signers of your lease agreement signed a release form that states "It is understood and agreed that any refunds or charges will be paid or charged to remaining Lessee(s) upon termination of the Lease.  (names omitted for privacy reasons)  Upon completion of our call you thanked me for my time and stated you understood.  You stated that you understood you would need to receive payment for your portion of the security deposit from the incoming roommate.  The security deposit is not income for Alabama Rental Managers.  The security deposit is placed in an escrow account for the duration of occupancy.  Please call me directly if you still need further clarification of this process and I will be more than happy to assist you.

text: Alabama Rental Managers has been most professional, responsive, effective and dependable property manager in every aspect. Experiencing Hurricane damage, managing any repairs, handling vacancies, taking care of turn overs and all has been a breeze, any of which can be a disaster for an owner. name: Ashley Dunn
text: This company is awful. They promise yearly inspections. My tenant told me they did not inspect for over 2 years. The home had major water damage from a leak that could have easily been repaired if inspected. This company cost me 5k in damages. I refuse to use them again. I have switched companies and feel my home is priority and not a dollar sign.

resp.text:
Ashley,
We are very sorry that you did not have a great experience with Alabama Rental Managers.  Our records indicate that you were made aware of the issues with your floors in 2013.  The floors had still not been repaired by you when the home was removed from our inventory in October of 2016. Our management agreement states that "periodic inspections" are completed and my records indicate we were in the home twice in 2016, once in January and again in August.

We do wish you the very best with your new management company.

text: They manage properties for me.  On multiple occasions I have not received checks for the rent even though the renters have paid.  They claim the checks must have been lost in the mail. Over and over, I begin to think that they are managing cash by not paying and that they are pocketing the stop payment fee.

name: Joe Dunnam
text: We rented a home sight unseen...our fault.  At the initial walk through the house was in terrible shape.  We were told the person over the property was aware of the issues so we did not have to list everything that was wrong. We built a home and did not renew the lease and got a checklist that was extremely detailed with costs if items were not addressed.  I called to voice my concern that the check in list was very vague but the check out list was very detailed.  It was set up to find a way to keep our deposit.  I was told by the VP that was their policy.  They are fine with putting tenants in filthy conditions but want it spotless when you leave. I was also told they will not process refunds for 60 days.  Beware.

resp.text:
Joe,
When you and I spoke several weeks back, I explained our security deposit refund process which typically takes 45-60 days to complete. The Alabama Law allows up to 60 days to return deposits or an itemized list of any deductions.  This time is needed to complete an inspection, complete any work needed and collect invoices for that work from outside contractors.

With that being said, I reviewed you final inspection and there should only be 1 minor charge for cleaning items which were not notated on your move in inspection form.

Please be sure our office has your correct forwarding address if you have not already done so in order to expedite this process.

Thank you for being one of our valued residents.  We wish you and your family the very best with your new home!  If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call us.

Best,
Jenny Moore
Vice President of Operations

name: John Pellerin
text: They are impossible to get a hold of I have had nothing but a terrible experience. I have rented different properties for over 6 years and I have never had a late payment. They were the first company that made me feel the need to never lease again. The lease for a house that I had recently rented through them for two years was not renewed. The owner wished to sell the house but still wanted tenants. I settled on a month to month lease and Alabama rental managers made this a terrible experience. The owner eventually asked for the month to month lease to be terminated due to the fact that the house was not selling. My roommates and I moved out at the end of the month even though there was never a date given to us in the "official" termination letter by the company. After we moved out a prorated rate for days/weeks in the following month were charged to my account. The company not only knew we moved out at the end of the month but they also inspected the house on that date. They spent three months to give us our security deposit back and it had all of these charges attached to it. Meanwhile they are impossible to get a hold of and anyone you do talk to doesn't have any answers. If you manage to get a hold of Jenny then she will be as rude as possible the entire time and not help you out at all! I would never recommend them to anyone and I feel sorry for any of the other tenants who have felt victimized by there horrible management!

We inadvertently ended up speaking to the owner of the home later on and needless to say, he was NOT pleased with how we were treated either. The staff here is rude and extremely inconsiderate. Terrible experience.

name: Jennifer Lewis
text:
I never leave reviews but after my horrible encounter with this rental company, I had to inform the public. This rental company and the employees I dealt with are pathetic. This is the most unprofessional disorganized company. I found a rental I liked but when I went out to look at the property alone to make sure it looked good it was nothing like what they had pictured on their site. So I decided to call and discuss this issue. Well, when I called I spoke to a Kristy or Krista something like that who is absolutely worthless. I assume she's new bc she couldn't answer simple questions and got extremely rude and aggressive when I called her out on it. I will be calling the owner of this company and informing then how I was treated when I called to inquire about rental properties. The girl lacks class and needs a serious course in customer service. Who runs this circus??? What a joke. Now as I read threw the reviews I see exactly what kind of people run this company. Whoever replies to the reviews needs to be fired immediately. What kind of business owner/employees tries so hard to make the reviewer look bad and claim they are innocent. I wouldn't rent from this company after everything I've seen, heard and  read. It's obvious the problem is with the company not the renters. I hope they realize how bad they make themselves look by the responses they give. They respond like immature kids who have gotten their feelings hurt. Someone needs to come in and train these people. I've owned a business for 30 years and if I had employees like the one that answered the phone she would be fired immediately as well as whoever replies to the reviews. They are the reason this company is getting such a bad name. There is a certain way you deal with people when you work at a business like this and the way they handle things is pathetic. This company obviously cares nothing about it's reputation. If they did the would've gotten rid of the ones that most of the reviews are about. I see a increase in good reviews which it's obvious to anyone what's going on there. Its almost laughable how awful this company handles business. I've read thru the reviews and some of these people should've sued this company. I will personally be reporting this company. This is no way to do business. They lie about the condition of their properties. They obviously don't hold up their end of the lease agreement either. To the girl who had the neighbor who kept threatening them. Take the police reports to an attorney along with picture's, you have a viable lawsuit. Wow.....

Update: I asked around about the best rental companies in the area and almost ever person I spoke to told me not to deal with Alabama Rental Managers. They have a worse reputation then I first imagined. The employees are spoken about in a terrible way.

name: Hak Je Kim
text:
Our family moved out at the end of October. I knew we were getting back the security deposit after 60 days. I called them in February since we STILL haven't received it. They said they sent it on December 30/31 to the old address because they didn't have our new forwarding address. Being so exhausted with moving, I faintly remember writing down the new address on a sticky note when I returned the keys and garage remotes back in October. HERE'S WHERE I HAVE A PROBLEM. They said that I didn't put down the new address. Okay, so it was my bad that I didn't 100% MAKE SURE I put it inside the envelope.
1) WHY would you send it to the old address when you CLEARLY knew we moved out of there TWO months ago?!?! YOU HAVE MY EMAIL AND PHONE NUMBERS ON FILE.
So you saw there was no forwarding address on file.. is it really that hard to reach out to me and ask for our new address??? You simply just had to call or shoot me an email before mailing out the check.
2) I got in contact with the owner of the old address; he never received the security deposit check from ARM. Called them back and they said the check still has not been cleared so they are reissuing another one.. BECKY from accounting asked for the forwarding address last week on Feb 21st, and I quickly replied to her email 34 minutes later. Never heard back from her so I called yesterday to touch base. RUDELY says I didn't give her the information. uh, you had the info you needed like 7 days ago? NO NEED TO BE SHORT AND SNAPPY with me when you're the one who didn't check your email.
It's March now and I'm picking up the check this Friday so I'll find out what the other deductions are then.
[I get that I must have "failed to give a forwarding address" but we were with you guys for almost three years.. Yes, I should've called and tripled checked to make sure you had it during Nov-Dec. BUT if you saw something on your side of the end that wasn't right, couldn't you have at least communicated with us first?]
-personally would not reccomend || too much hassle-

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We apologize your experience was not a positive one.  We are required to mail the final account statement to the last known address if no forwarding address was provided.  We are glad you were able to get the issue resolved and pick up your check.  We wish you the best of luck with your new home!

name: Penny Pointer
text: Worst excuse of a rental agency, they do not tell you that if anything breaks in the rental you are required to fix and repair yourself. And the hidden fees are amazing. Do yourself a favor and stay away.....

name: Nakita
text: I just want to say this company is exceptional. When I first reached out to them about renting a home, I was nervous b/c of my credit, and coming from a divorce that was hard on me financially I just knew my family would not get approved. I showed my kids the home before I even got approved (I was just so excited about it) and they were as well. I prayed to God, and after talking to the mgr of the company they walked out on faith with my family and gave us a chance. When I tell you I LOVE this home, and so does my 3yr old daughter. She has over came so much with her health etc.. And every time I pick her up from daycare she says "Mom are we going to the new house?"  and she just smiles. Just to have a backyard for your child to play in may be small thing, but just to see her smile brings me joy in every way.  Thank you Blake, Kristen and the  A.R.M family...
